Reviews.Title: “Green bath water, stay away!”
Reviews.Author: ponywal
Reviews.Content: We found a great deal on Expedia and were excited to stay at the Hilton. When we arrived the valet guys seemed like they had nothing better to do than harass us. We checked in and later that night I wanted to have a bath. To my surprise, tge tub filled with green water. We called the front desk and they sent someone up to check. The guy who came said it was the city's problem and left. The manager called and said the water was safe and we explained we did not feel comfortable bathing and brushing our teeth in green water. We asked him for another room and to check it first. We waited an hour and got impatient because it was midnight. We called and they said they had one room but the water was green too. We asked for a discount or something and he said he would drop off some breakfast vouchers. We woke up to no vouchers under our door and had to call and explain a couple more times the situation. What an ordeal. They gave us continental vouchers. What an insult. We confronted them and they gave us a full breakfast. The breakfast was actually the highlight but the service at this hotel was disorganized and rude!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel...”
Reviews.Author: bgm1275
Reviews.Content: You would expect more from a Hilton.... You don't find a refrigerator or water in your room, dirty carpets, expensive parking. They don't even offer you an umbrella to walk outside downtown Miami. Poor quality overall...

Reviews.Title: “Ok prior to a cruise”
Reviews.Author: Jona V
Reviews.Content: Travelled in a group of 7, and stayed 4 days in Miami prior to our cruise. At first impression, I am not sure if they are going for the nostalgic dark decor, but the hotel had a sort of antique features and dark wood, with low lighting. We had to find someone to take our bags to our room as there was no doorman when we arrived and only one conceirge with the trolley full of luggages, so we had to go up the elevator to the main lobby and wait for the concierges there. From previous tips from this website I requested a high level bay view which the three of us received. We were very happy and amazed from the views. The rooms were of substantial size and had all the amenities except for a minibar, although there is a ice and drinks vending machine a few doors away. However, my Uncle was unfortunate to get locked in the bathroom and had his wife call maintenance to unscrew the door to let him out. They fortunately were able to change rooms later that day. The rest of the group had no problems with the room. We had dinner on our first night and was throughly entertained by our Egyptian waitor (cannot remember his name) but we really enjoyed the evening. Breakfast was ok, however the variety was limited but I did expect it after reading the previous reviews, so I was not surprised. As a vegetarian, I did fill up on fruits and bread, however the savoury foods only limited me to scrambled eggs and oatmeal. Would have liked beans or hash browns instead of pancakce rolled up with creamy cheese! The staff were helpful and the internet service was good as it was free if you are a guest. The gift shop was also good as well as the bar in the main lobby, however it did take long to get our order as there was only 1 bar man serving...he gave us complimentary drinks for waiting so long. The surroundings were ok, no problems there as we mostly took taxi around town, we did try the mono rail which was exciting but a bit scary at the freedom tower stop, a guy was screaming which led me to believe he was mentally insane, there are no barriers from the platform so be careful as it does get windy up there. We went on the city tour and the Orlando day tour as recommended by Danilo the concierge. We enjoyed the boat city tour, however I would not recommend the Orlando trip as it was a nightmare. The main journey took 3 hours (expected) however if you are going to the magic kingdom, you have to transfer to a mini van, which the driver then took us into the car park of a supermarket area as he had to wait for a guy who was buying the entrance tickets, we had to wait in the car park for 10 minutes, at this time after travellig 3+ hours we were furious as we were told we would get at the park around 10am instead we arrived at 11am, thus cutting short our enjoyment at the park. We vented our frustration but the driver said to complain to the company and muttered in Spanish. We tried to enjoy the rest of the day. The tickets should've been purchased prior to the day. The following days were uneventful and we went on our cruise. Lambert the doorman was thoroughly considerate.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: Nis N
Reviews.Content: Hotel was ideally located for the purpose of my business trip. However the Hotel has an old feel to it and the surrounding areas outside the hotel was a bit rundown and had a grimy feel. On check in the room I was assigned was very smoky smelling but they moved me to a suite with a better view.

Reviews.Title: “resting on Hilton Laurels”
Reviews.Author: hscheff
Reviews.Content: Having used Hiltons before I expected a certain level of service, efficiency and knowledge. The people behind the registration desk were not knowledgable about several facts and instead of informing me and my colleagues that they would have to find out the answers they gave none answers. The interior shows its age. The atmosphere was DARK and dreary. The suite was large and comfortable and even though we were on a concierge floor we couldn't access the priviledges unless we were Hilton Honors members. We didn't learn of this and that if your Hilton account was not used within a calendar year the points expired and you had to sign on again. We ate a light dinner in the pub area - it was not crowded and yet it took us 1 3/4 hours to be waited on, served and get the bill. We are told that they expect major renovations - then it would be time for another look

Reviews.Title: “Service in the Dining room”
Reviews.Author: Zary R
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time I stay in this hotel, due to very busy schedule I made all my meetins in the hotel. Wish to point out the excellent service I and my guests have enjoyed in the dining room from the manager in charge Mr Avi Zarchi and his team. Very polite and very professional approach. Wish I could meet same people in other hotels I stay around the world. Zary Rosenfeld Room 1125 IN 3/12 out 3/16/2012

Reviews.Title: “Convenient business location”
Reviews.Author: Granitestater87
Reviews.Content: We were attending a conference held in the hotel. The conference rooms and staff were great. Everything was ready on time and the food was exceptional for hotel conference food. For nightlife, there were several restaurants within an easy walking distance and transportation to South Beach was readily available. The concierge staff was great for giving running routes and restaurant recommendations. The rooms were a little tired and noisy (we could hear every time our neighbors flushed their toilet or ran their water), the elevators a little slow, but the rooms were rather spacious and the views from the rooms were good. I was surprised at how delicious the conference food was - a breakfast buffet with individual baked eggs was a special treat, and our 'Cuban' themed dinner buffet with roast pig, fired platains, and minted fresh citrus fruit was an unexpected pleasure. Kudos to the food and beverage staff. I would be happy to attend another meeting there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Poor Service, Noisy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jason7897
Reviews.Content: I stay at hundreds of hotels per year for work. I have a difficult time sleeping at night so requested a room away from the elevator. I reconfirmed this request prior to arrival. However, when I arrived my room as well as my mothers room who is also a very light sleeper is next to an elevator. The staff were unhelpful. I spoke to several managers including Humberto several times. After a very poor nights sleep he offered to refund the points for the rooms. I accepted since the only reason I stayed at this Hilton was for a good nights sleep while starting a family vacation. The elevator dinged all night long keeping up the entire family. While the offer of refunding the points was nice, it would have actually been netter if they followed though on that promise!. After several e-mails they responded they were only refunding a single room. I also copied the Hilton executive team and did not receive a response form them. I will be not be staying at this hotel again and if you want a good nights sleep at a hotel with a friendly staff I recommend you don't either.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a very nice view”
Reviews.Author: lolo c
Reviews.Content: My wife and our 2 kids stayed at the hotel after our cruise trip and one of the good, amoung others, is how close is the hotel from the miami port....it's just like 10 minutes! When we finally got to the lobby (because it's a little bit tricky) it was full of people checking in, but everything ran just perfect thanks to the professionalism and friendly attitude of the front desk agents. We got an upgrade when checked in to a better view room, bay/city view which was gorgeous, specially at night! The kids wanted to go the pool, so went there and had some really good sandwiches and the pool was clean and not so many people at all. The executive lounge is in the 16th floor (also a great view!) and there we met Luis who was very friendly and polite, always smiling and as it was our first time in miami he kindly answer ALL of our questions. We also wanted to go out for dinner(the snacks in the lounge weren't enough for the kids)so he recommended a very good restaurant near the bay area and he even called there and made us a reservation so we didn't have to wait for the line. Everytime we ran into someone they always saluted us. I thinks the location it's not the best for young people or a group of friends because there not much to do, but for just one night when traveling for business or with family it's a great place. I would go and would stay again without any doubts.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfy rooms makes the Hilton and ideal post-cruise stop.”
Reviews.Author: The_Arden
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Hilton post cruise and couldn't have been happier with our choice. It's located on Biscayne Blvd, which is a ten dollar cab ride from the port. Located downtown, it's about a 15 minute stroll to Bayside, 5 minutes to the opera house, and 10 to AA Arena. There is also a train station nearby that offers free train service around downtown Miami. In addition, a cab to south beach would take approximately 10 minutes. The room we had was spacious with two comfortable queen size beds. The room and the washroom were immaculate. Your view will obviously depend on the side you're on, and we had a view of a drive-through fast food joint looking onto Biscayne blvd (I believe). Since we weren't in the room much, it didn't matter. Wifi is available in the rooms, but for a price. However, free wifi is available in the lobby. The service was excellent, from the bellboy, to the service desk, to the concierge. All were very helpful and gave us great info about getting around. The only complaint I have is that I could hear the elevators all night long as our room was only a few feet away. I suggest requesting a room further away from the elevators. Overall, I'm very happy with the Hilton and would stay here again. It can be pricey, but look for a sale and the price becomes more reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andy M
Reviews.Content: A few weeks ago I visited this beautiful hotel and I stayed only one night because I was taking a cruise. People was very nice to me there, specially in the front desk where I was told about all amenities. Nice room with a nice bay view. At night and in the morning service was excellent in the concierge lounge attended by Luis who did a great job. I would recommend this hotel and I would stay myself there anytime.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit dated but overall still a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Martin L
Reviews.Content: You may stayed at other modern hotels around the world and you will find it this hotel is a little bit dated. However, I still think this hotel is very nice with the size of the room, lobby area, swimming pool and the gym. We stayed for 2 nights before we board on the cruise ship. Taxi brought us to South Beach and the terminals within 15mins and there will always be taxi. Hotel stuff are very helpful. Room is very clean overall. A little bit pricy but you are staying at Hilton, so you expected to pay a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay before a cruise.”
Reviews.Author: ETontheroad
Reviews.Content: It is a nice property, location is about 15 minutes max to the cruise terminals. Gets a little crowded in the AM with all of the departures especially on a Saturday. (Use express checkout), Should be less then 30 dollars by taxi from MIA airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: grhokie
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed here prior to a cruise. First, the location is great. Everything you need is within walking distance in a fun area of Miami. We walked to dinner, breakfast and a nearby grocery store. It was about a five minute cab drive to the Port. It was only about 15-20 minutes from the airport. This place also has great staff. The front desk has several people working, waiting to help you. Because of this, check in was fast and friendly. The conceirge gave excellent directions and recommendations, from a nearby grocery store to the cost of a cab to the Port. The bell staff had great control over the cab drivers and expertly and carefully packed our bags in the trunk of the cab and stated clearly and loudly in front of the cab driver how much the metered fare should cost to the port. The rooms were large and clean. The beds were comfortable and the pillows actually provided some support. The A/C was quiet and easy to adjust. The bathroom had great water pressure in the shower and the tub drained as it should. In short, this is an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: TorontoRobDT
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night due some mix-up with accommodations in Ft. Lauderdale but that was fine as my cruise was departing from the Port of Miami anyway. Location-- very close to the free people mover and major bus connector to get all over Miami or South Beach. A Burger King was directly across the street for a quick coffee or salad but that was it for restaurants. Room-- I did like the floor to ceiling windows and it was clean but, in all honesty the room was no more different than any hotel that I stayed in with a lower star rating. The bathroom light is on a timer so that was good for energy conservation. Bed was comfortable and TV worked fine. Walls looked a bit old though so I am thinking that perhaps this hotel could be showing its age somewhat. Staff-- were nice, friendly and always had a smile. Negative-- the wireless internet. I decided to purchase it and it was horrible. Kept crashing and when it did open it was slower than dial-up I had years ago. Was good for one night but I would not do longer.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it for the money”
Reviews.Author: saffal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the first stop in a two stop honeymoon for the new wife and I and it was well worth it. The hotel is Downtown Miami so you're not in the uber-cool South Beach but given that it's about half the price it's a bargain. The hotel is a Hilton so it's nice in a business hotel kind of way. We didn't eat there but the restaurant does look nice. The open air pool is lovely and a good sun trap. The rooms are HUGE and many have really nice views of Biscayne Bay. The staff are friendly and helpful and the concierge in particular is very useful to chat to. There is ample public transport - literally around the corner - with a free Metro and Buses running regularly. South Beach is about 15 mins and $2 away. Close to the restaurant there are a number of places to eat which are perfectly decent if you need a breakfast etc but otherwise why are you staying in Downtime - you're in Miami - get to South Beach with you! Also didn't see any homeless people at all. So ignore the reviews that make this sound like an area you can't be at night. It's fine. Clean, safe and cheap with great views.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with Corporate rate near everything in Miami”
Reviews.Author: PepeRamix
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a short break with a corporate rate which was able to jump to a bay view suite. Rooms have a good area and all you need on a Hilton. nearby the Bayside arena and a short drive to Miami Beach (art Deco). The only drawback is that near by the hotel you do not have any life, and the park option is expensive 28 usd.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: delawareseven
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night before leaving Miami on a Caribbean Cruise. GOt the hotel on Expedia for good price , it was difficult to find anything in Miami because we scheduled at the last minute. I would not recommend the location, it is an easy walk to the bus to get to South Beach, but the bus leaves a lot to be desired. There is nothing in the area of the hotel, except for the Arsht Theatre. We had a very early flight and arrived in Miami around 10:00 am. I was amazed when we arrived at the hotel to drop our bags, and they gave us our room. For that, they deserve five stars.. The room was nice, no view for us, but fine for one night. Bathroom was clean with nice toiletries. It was a short cab ride to the cruise ship in the am. The pool was really nice with nice seating, but we had a terrible thunderstorm and could not use it. The only problem is that in the morning, while getting ready to check out, the power went out in the bathroom and 1/2 the room when I used my own hair dryer. It was not fixed before we left. Good thing that my hair was dry!

Reviews.Title: “Daylight robbery”
Reviews.Author: quintopino
Reviews.Content: First of all, this Hilton is OK as a hotel - rooms are all right, service is sort of all right, restaurant and bar are a bit gloomy but all right, and the location is grim but OK if you have to be away from Miami Beach for business. for the price, it's OK, nothing more. Main objection was an absolutely ludicrous bill we received for use of phone in the room - $20 USD flat rate for making a call even when it didn't connect, and about $17USD per minute for international calls. We all know hotel phones are pricey, so we kept the calls short, but even still - the rates aren't advertised anywhere in the room. Coming from Europe, it takes some time to get used to the "rip me off at every corner" culture in the States, but this was just going too far. Really abusive. So the hotel - fine, for the cost, if you have to be downtown, it's an OK choice. Phone - don't go near it.

Reviews.Title: “Might be the worst hotel to wear the Hilton moniker”
Reviews.Author: SKITZOZTIKS
Reviews.Content: Not-so-long ago, this awful hotel was branded a Radission. I am not privvy to when/how/why it became a Hilton branded hotel, but I genuinely believe this was a mistake on Hilton's part. This is by far the most disgusting hilton property I have ever stayed in, and is honestly probably the second worst hotel I have ever visited in my adult life. I was in the hotel for 3 days during an admittedly busy boat show; but you would have never known by the pace or attitude of hotel staff. I have never in my life seen such generally lackluster service throughout a hotel. The desk staff were generally courteous, but simultaneously disinterested and unpleasant. The concierge was one of the more helpful employees, along with one of the bellhops I encountered. That all being said, the rest of the hotel staff and premises are a disaster. Allegedly some renovations were done in the not so distant past, but you would never know except for the random granite counter tops and thresholds. The bathtubs are all old and appear to have been painted; which is peeling. There was an abundance of mildew in the first (bath)room I stayed in - so much so that i had to change rooms. Both rooms were absolutely disgusting. You can see dust CAKED into all switches, fixtures, etc. There is also generally a lingering "goo" on clocks, table tops, etc. Apparently none of the housekeeping staff's vacuums work, because I have never seen such a disgusting amount of hair accumulated in corners, on tile floors, in carpets; and unfortunately on "clean" bedding. This is the kind of hotel that should include a full body condom at check in for your safety - really. Along with a filter in which you can breathe and not inhale pure mold/mildew and dust(mite) remnants. If you want a brilliant show, wait until its sunndy outside and open your curtains. You can see dust floating and reflecting off the sun light for hours to come. If you have the misfortune of valeting your car, prepare yourself for the worst and most unprofessional experience ever. We had to depart/return approximately ten times and never waited less than 10 minutes for the vehicle. You can actually observe as the valets slowly stride around without a care in the world and as if no one, includin them, has anywhere to be. Of course the valet is a third party from the hotel, but i believe the hotel should take responsibility for the valet's behavior on their property. Needless to say, the valet refused to surrender my car during departure and treated me like a thief by saying my valet bill had not been paid, even though we had a paper bill printed moments before showing it was. No apologies were offered, simply rude looks and snide remarks. The only plus this hotel has for it is location - the epitome of downtown Miami. I would still suggest you stay somewhere else, though.

Reviews.Title: “Bickering servers put on a show!”
Reviews.Author: Frank M
Reviews.Content: I was not a guest at this hotel BUT I went to visit/pick up a friend who was a guest at this hotel. We were not able to dine elsewhere, therefore decided to dine and "catch up" at the hotel's main restaurant for dinner. The food was tasty and light; a bit expensive but you are in Miami. We paid for dinner and a SHOW! The two male servers found it okay to fight and argue candidly on the restaurant floor in front of guests! Although the restaurant wasn't full, these two (male) servers received half the attention of the restaurant for their yelling, shoving, and facial gestures! No supervisor on duty to stop the altercation but, although, it was entertaining for us I hope the human resources dept. of this hotel will take some disciplinary action for their shameful behavior. Drinks at the lounge afterwards to finish our conversation and service was better. My friend had been here for a few days and was happy with her stay and amenities even with the "show". Ok, decent hotel she says.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Eepctations”
Reviews.Author: NoPlaceLikeHome58
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out, the nicest most service oriented Hilton I have stayed in. Great staff, nice room great view of the Bay and AA Arena,

Reviews.Title: “Great view of the Port of Miami”
Reviews.Author: ksmith79
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 night here before boarding our cruise ship. Hotel was an excellent value for the location. Rooms were clean & comfortable. Area felt very safe! Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Views, Convient Location”
Reviews.Author: intraveler610
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Downtown Miami the night before going on a cruise, because the port is nearby. We got the bay view rooms and had an awesome view of the Port of Miami and downtown. The windows are floor to ceiling which is even better. The staff were very friendly and knowledgable. The rooms were clean and spacious. There is also a free tram nearby that will take you to the Bayview Mall. Which is a must see, because it had lots of shops and restaurants. There is also some entertainment there as well. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peacheypc_123
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a good position near Bayside and Port. We had a lovely room on high floor with view of city and bay. Also right near to Metromover so easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: sharonephone
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Saturday night before the ING Miami Marathon/ Half Marathon. The entrance is funky if you arrive by car and expect to park in the garage. You drive up to what seems to be the 3-4 floor and there is a nice entrance. But the lobby is on the 7th floor, and the signage to direct guests was lacking. We finally got to the lobby and due to the many marathon guests, it was busy. I waited in the Hilton Honors line, which was shorter than the other line. After about 5 minutes, I was helped. Front desk staffer was very nice, saw that I was a Hilton Honors Gold member and quickly informed me of the complimentary welcome reception and breakfast at the executive lounge. He also noted that I requested a room by an ice machine and replied that he was sorry but they did not have any rooms left. He then upgraded me to a one-bedroom suite. When we got up there we realized it was actually two separate rooms with a connecting door, one with a dining and sitting area, bathroom, and a gorgeous view of downtown Miami. The other room was a regular guest room which was a good size and had a comfortable bed. And yes, we were now near an ice machine. The upgrade was very much appreciated. We did not make the breakfast because of the race timing, but the welcome reception was very nice. The executive lounge also had a nice view and offered hot and cold appetizers, water and soft drinks, along with wine and beer for a reasonable price. Very nice feature. I used to live right next to this hotel and was very impressed with the service and the accommodations. This hotel can often be had for a deal and would be a great value. Location is walkable to the Arsht Center, American Airlines Arena, and Bayside, but you would need a taxi/car for anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel In A Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Craig1963
Reviews.Content: First time staying at the Miami Hilton Downtown. I was in town for a short business trip and the location was perfect, so decided to give it a try. It's very much a Hilton, with all the standard amenities and qualities one expects to find at a Hilton hotel. That also means you know you're in a hotel and not at home :-) The room is nicely furnished and clean, and surprisingly quiet in spite of being located right next door to the ice and vending machine. TV selection was pretty basic, but I'm not here to watch the tube so no biggie. Lots of elevators, so I didn't ever have to wait long. Bed was comfy, though the pillows were a bit thin for my liking. It would be nice if the hotel offered a selection of pillows, as some other chains do. Bath was clean and everything worked flawlessly. The drain in the shower was a bit slow (probably clogged with hair) but a quick call to maintenance fixed that. I did eat in the hotel restaurant one night and it was good. Had the mahi-mahi, with rice. Location is good, with the Sea Isle marina a short walk across the street. I took a walk one night after dinner and enjoyed the view. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Conference Trip”
Reviews.Author: NeedVacation08
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Miami in January for business and stayed at the Hilton Downtown because the conference was being held at the same hotel. The good: Excellent Conciere and Valet service and their helpful tips The food was very good both in the restaurant and room service Nice view of the harbor and I was only on the 3rd floor Close to free tram Close to Downtown and Bayside Market area Pool area looked nice but did not use The bad: Room was in a block reserved by the Conference yet when checking in, there was no mention as to where the conference check-in was located and had to search the hotel over to find it. $28/day for valet and $25/day self parking...very expensive Blood stains on pillow cases...contacted front desk about the issue and they reacted like it was a normal thing and would mention it to housekeeping. Room was very sub-standard for cleanliness...floor looked like it never gets vacuumed. Not the best area at night TV cable kept going out Conference rooms are cold Charge for WiFi unless you have an existing account like AT&T Overall very disappointed for a Hilton...the hotel seemed more like a hotel going out of business. For the money, there are much better hotels in the area. The cost of this hotel should be 1/2 of existing for the value.

Reviews.Title: “As reviewed on here...Sub-par for Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Allante1
Reviews.Content: Well we looked at the reviews and knew exactly what to expect. And got it. As mentioned, the parking was a mess. A long jaunt from the lot to the hotel lobby. We ended up valet parking for the few extra bucks and ease of getting our car. The good - hotel bar staff was friendly and served decent cocktails. We ate a few times at the bar (appetizers) and they were fine. Nice atmosphere. The room (paid for an upgrade) was ample and had a great view. We turned the lights out at night and enjoyed a wonderful view. The bad - housekeeping was terrible. Knowing that I read poor reviews here, I tipped $5 the first overnight. Didn't really help. Our coffee was not replenished nor was the sugar or even stirrers. Oh well. The pool was and pool area was in not-so-great condition. It was OK but not what you'd expect. The hotel needs an overhaul. Kinds of shabby but since we had a car and were only there a few day before a cruise - it was not too much of a downer. If you are looking to stay here for any time, find another hotel. There is one right across the street (Marriott) that we visited and it was first class. Probably more but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to normal Hilton Standard”
Reviews.Author: Barclayboys
Reviews.Content: When we arrived for a one night stay, (we were catching a cruise ship the next morning) the one bell hop at the entrance did not greet us, or offer to help, or open a door. He seemed to be busy counting his tips. The young man at the check in desk was very helpful but was new, as he sounded so scripted as if he had memorised all his lines. The hotel is old and needs some updating in several areas. We had a snack in the lounge as that's all that was available. It was almost uneatable, but we were hungry. The next day they compt our snack after explaning it all to the front desk people. The Hilton Honors lounge had a very nice breakfast available but it seemed that the superivisor was the only one who took the initiative to clean tables, so was hard to find a clean one. The hotel is near the ski train that will take you right downtown for free. Watch out for the unfortuneates in our society. There is tansit police around but not everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: Margie L
Reviews.Content: I have been here for one week on biz & after 30 years of corporate travel under my belt, I have to say that the service here has been outstanding. The staff here remembered my name, my preferences, and even my business associates. They were incredibly friendly & hospitable, and now I'm looking for excuses to come back here! I would like to especially acknowledge the warm, personal attention I received from Xinya at the front desk; and Angie, Andre, Candelaria & David in the lounge/restaurant who kept me well-fed, hydrated & restored during an incredibly busy week away from home. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great service at the bar”
Reviews.Author: Barbara F
Reviews.Content: Our waitress, Angeleena, was exceptionally nice to us weary travelers, night of January 16, 2012. We wanted to get dessert to take to our room. Our room could have been better, candy wrappers in the dresser drawers and a pair on men's underwear crumpled up by the picture window.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking in Amenities; Beware the Prices”
Reviews.Author: France N
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night before boarding a cruise ship. As a Hilton gold member, had access to the lounge, and free internet in room. Luckily, due to the fact that internet access is pricey otherwise. Lounge lacked bottles of water! Only option for a hot meal for breakfast was scrambled eggs and bacon; no oatmeal at this location, which I was looking forward to. The toaster was broken as well, with burned out elements. Other food in the lounge was good (fruit, coffee). When we arrived, only option for a meal was at the bar in the lobby. Horrible club sandwich! Cold fat soaked bacon, processed meats, and very expensive. Plus, they tack on an 18% service fee with the meal - 2 drinks and 2 sandwiches came to $64!! Recommendation: eat elsewhere; even room service would probably have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful at night”
Reviews.Author: srpiccollo
Reviews.Content: Came here on business with my husband. He had conferences all day while I did day trips. I planned on just staying at the hotel for a few days since we didn't get a rental car. After coming here I wish we had. During the day it is fine in this area but at 7pm (after dark in Jan) we went across the street to checkers to buy a few cheap meals and just chill in our room after traveling all day. We were asked for money by EVERYONE who was walking by or in the area. I mean some of these people ran across the street to us to ask us! Even the guy at the hotel warned us to only use taxis after dark. No buses or walking around. The other hotel itself: We had a jr suite which is big and comfy but the furniture has seen better days. Scratches all over the tables and the door to the closet was broken off the hinges just laying aggaibt the wall. The bathroom is small and has no fan or heat lamp. The pool is NOT heated as the website states. When I asked about that no one was aware it ever was or that it was supported to be. I also saw online the rooms were to have plush bathrobes. I looked all over and found none. We are on 15 floor and habe ants. Not a big deal but just weird they are on the 15 floor! This places seems to be very clean and the lobby is really nice. Over all not bad but I do not think it is worth the price due to location. Staff very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded to Presidential Suite on arrival - nice touch”
Reviews.Author: leavemeonthebeach
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a few various hotels in Miami, loved that we were upgraded to presidential suite on arrival, huge lounge area, separate bedroom 2 x bathrooms. The hotel itself is very nice, itâ€™s about 1 mile from Bayside we walked up to Bayside our first evening and didn't do it again as we had to walk passed a few homeless people, not that there was any issues, just took a cab back and forward thereafter. There aren't many people walking up the Boulevard we seemed to be the only people. We have cruised a few times out of Miami, the first time we stayed at the Sonesta in Coconut Grove which was a lovely hotel but too far from the cruise terminal and South Beach. We much prefer staying at the Holiday Inn Port of Miami, itâ€™s just across the road from the bars, shops & restaurants, of Bayside and you can hop on the bus outside to hotel for a short bus journey to South Beach. We loved Sharkeys Bar in Bayside good prices on bottled beers and nice food and you can sit and watch the world go by.

Reviews.Title: “thee place to see in new year”
Reviews.Author: stephen s
Reviews.Content: the hilton hotel downtown miami has the most amazing roof top pool and terrace.with stunning views over the port and miami.staff really helpful,and the rooms spacious clean and beds you just sink into.food and drink what you would expect to pay in city.pricey on overnight parking 28 dollars.but what a view of fireworks on new year.aesy to find and ideal if going on a cruise from miami port,only 5 mins drive.would recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property!”
Reviews.Author: FoxyDerick
Reviews.Content: Below are my ratings for this property on a scale of 1-5: Hotel Location 5 Hotel Lobby 5 Hotel Customer Svc 5 Room Size 4 Room Carpet 5 Bathroom 5 Cleanliness 5 DÃ©cor 5 Views 5 Average 4.89

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for activities in American Airlines Arena”
Reviews.Author: rcblokdijk
Reviews.Content: Location: 3 Cleanliness: 5 Bathroom: 4 Amenities: 3 Room Space: 4 Staff: 3 There is really no point of staying in downtown Miami unless you are visiting for a Miami Heat Game or concert at the American Airlines Arena or Opera. Nightlife and daytime actitivies are non exsistent. I would definately recommend a hotel on miami beach or the south beach area. All with all a nice hotel (although the waittime at the lifts can be quite substansial) and great for visiting Miami with a group like we did but would not stay here again when I would visit Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionl Hilton”
Reviews.Author: DRZL-Enterprises
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in Nov. 2011 for a romantic getaway. Our view from the room was not that great but the view from the terrace was. The staff was very friendly and I tipped generously. The room itself was massive and clean. This is 1 of the best 3 hotel rooms I have ver stayed in and I've been to a lot. The staff was also very courteous and evyeryone was willing to go the extra mile. I was not used to not having free wifi, since its availabele for gold hilton honours members, which we werent at the time. However the odd thing is the wifi fee the charge you is per device not for the room. This means if your not a Gold HIlton Honors member, and have 3 devices you want to connect to wifi in your room, Hilton expects you to pay 3 times. This seems odd consdering that number of devices that have a mobile hotspot feature. Another way around this is just use a device or phone that has a mobile hotspot and connect all your devices thru that. Nedless to say we found out the hard way and were charged twice but the front desk attendant made it right by covering one of our charges. Our only regret was that we wish woul dcould stay longer. We will be staying here next time we visit to see the Heat play.

Reviews.Title: “Great night sleep”
Reviews.Author: keschpo
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Hilton and it was a very pleasant stay. Room was clean and huge with floor to ceiling windows. The bed linens were very nice and it was the best night sleep I have had at a hotel in a while. Did not have a bay view which was ok since I was working. This year I traveled over 85,000 miles and can tell you, having to pay for Internet in the room is normal so, for all that complained, the lobby was very nice and comfortable. I would absolutely stay here again for a business trip or pre/post cruise. It is downtown so if you are in Miami for the beaches and vacation this location may not be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to Angelena”
Reviews.Author: Vicki P
Reviews.Content: After attending an all day meeting at the Downtown Hilton, my group gathered in the lobby bar to unwind. Our server's name was Angelena and I wanted to recognize the fantastic job she did with our group. She was prompt, organized, extremely friendly and maintained a pleasant attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: leandquach
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night (27-28 Dec) to attend a NBA match at American Airline Arena. The view from the room was beautiful, the staff very helpful and the room itself very spacious and clean. Downside was that we did not have internet in our room. If you go to lobby or business area there was free wifi. Location wise it is a few minutes walk from Metromover station (free public transport which takes you around downtown Miami), which we took to get to AA Arena for the match. The area itself is a little shady as we encountered a few homeless persons. Right opposite the hotel is a Checkers and Burger King which are opened late (great for midnight snack ;) We probably won't come back as we would prefer to stay somewhere more bustling but if you are looking to stay just for a night or two to go to surrounding events it is worth it. We paid 200USD for a kingsize bedroom. Guess the prize was inflated due to new years season.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous view to the ocean and downtown”
Reviews.Author: martynoi
Reviews.Content: We spent there 1 night before a cruise.Great location -close to the Port of Miami. Absolutely fantastic hotel with helpful staff. The room very cofortable. Taxi stand in the hotel. Fabulous view to the ocean and downtown.( from the 10 floor) Unfortunately no free Wi-fi available in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and good service”
Reviews.Author: Assenzio
Reviews.Content: I had to spend my last night in Miami, and in Downtown I found this Hilto more convenient than the Hyatt, where I spent a couple of nights ten days before. The parking was just fine: as i already wrote just pick the valet service because a) you don't want to look for a parking in this neighborhood and b) the difference between valet and single entry is risible. The hotel is conveniently located: as you can assume reading the address this hotel is just a block from Bayside Marketplace (biscayne blvd runs parallel to the port) and above all it is 15 minutes drive from south beach. Absolutely nothing to complain about rooms (modern and with huge widescreen tv) and service: the express check out on the phone, in a busy day of meeting and conferences, saved me a lot of time. In downtown Miami I would probably come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for a few days”
Reviews.Author: HappyJJ
Reviews.Content: Our stay was from 14 to 17 December 2011. The accommodation was good. Buffet continental breakfast had a wide selection of items and we never felt the need to pay for extra hot items. The meal we had one evening in the restaurant was good, freshly cooked and reasonably priced. The bar served good cocktails, the martini was very good. Service on the terrace outside the restaurant was abysmal, better to get drink from the bar and carry them to the terrace yourself. The pool was cool but large with few people swimming, plenty of loungers and towels. The taxi from the airport cost $25. There are not many restaurants in the area of the hotel but a Checkers and a Burger King drive in opposite the hotel. Public transport is close by. The Metromover runs from Omni station, which is around the corner from the hotel. This is an elevated railway which serves about 20 stations, including Bayfront Park, were boat trips to Biscanye Bay start. Trips on the Metromover are free. Some of the Metromover stations link with Metrorail which gives access to a larger area. Busses run past the hotel and from Omni station to South Beach etc $2 each way, but one must have notes or coins to pay no change is given (an â€œEasy Riderâ€� card or ticket (like an Oyster card) can be purchased from certain locations to make the payment, but we did not see a card/ticket machine except the one at the airport). Before arriving in Miami we had booked a full day trip which included, everglades airboat ride, city bus tour and a boat trip in the bay. Quite a bit of time was wasted at the start of the trip by collecting people from various hotels and then waiting for minibuses from other hotels to meet us so the passengers from the hotels could be grouped on different trips. The everglades boat trip was a bit disappointing because the airboat carried about 30 people so views were obscured. The city tour did not cover much of the Miami beach area but did cover Coconut Grove, Coral Park etc (A $2 bus ride from Omni Station to Adventura Mall was more interesting.). The boat trip was at sunset, but a lot of time was spent sailing past the houses of famous American sportspeople, business men and pop stars.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Review”
Reviews.Author: cdntraveller12003
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Miami Hilton for New Years Eve 2011. Great view was the only good thing at this hotel. Rates were too expensive and service was terrible. 4 persons stayed in room but only towels for 3 people. called hotel reception 3 times and no towels were ever delivered. not a good way to start New Years eve having to share towels. Air conditioning noise is horrendous. kept you awake all night. Phone did not work in room. WIFI is not free either. Would never stay here again and maybe not at another Hilton either. Watch out at drive inn restaurant across street - kinda scary for families.

Reviews.Title: “Sketchy neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: 1needavacation
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights prior to a cruise. This hotel would have been ok had it not been for the fact that my family was followed and harrassed when we left our hotel and walked down the street. After that we made sure to take a cab everywhere we went.....even if it was close by. If you do venture out definitely do so during daylight and try not to look like a tourist or you may as well have a target painted on your back! I wish the concierge had warned us instead of pointing us toward the public transportation system. As far as our room goes, it was a bit dated- not what I expected from a Hilton. My family did enjoy the pool area. The water was a bit chilly but that did not deter from the fun. Food- the sandwiches were great. Stay away from the chicken caesar salad....not so good. The salad was not fresh. The breakfast buffet was pretty good. Would have been better if they offered either waffles or pancakes at the buffet instead of just eggs. Most of the employees were very kind and helpful. Because of the area and the fact that I felt unsafe when I exited the hotel, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Close to Public Transport”
Reviews.Author: JimboNorth
Reviews.Content: I read a bunch of the reviews of this location and was wondering about the neighborhood. A couple of folks asked me for money, after all this is Miami not Disney Land. I'd be more scared if I saw Mickey Mouse on the streets around here. A few bums remind you that you are staying in a big city. I am writing this review from a beautiful city view room. Everyone at the place was friendly from the guys parking and greeting cars downstairs to the folks servicing the room. The only reason I am not giving this an excellent rating is the fact that there is no free wireless in the rooms. Heck, Motel 6 gives you free wireless. I can't figure the reasoning for not providing free wireless on all the floors at this location. Oh yeah...the pool may be heated, but it's not all that warm. In fact it was chilly when I went swimming a couple of days ago. There's a great little diner a very short walk from the hotel. One of the guys that works in the Motor Lobby recommended it. S & S Diner. It was rated preatty well by the food channel. At least that's what the waitress said. :-) I ate two very good diner breakfasts there. Again, friendly staff, great view if you get on the side with the downtown view and close to public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room, awful customer service-does not live up to Hilton standards”
Reviews.Author: liban0214
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at Hilton brand hotels when I travel which too often and this was one of the worst places. We checked into the hotel about 11:00 pm and granted there was no room service or open restaurant at the hotel at such hour but when I asked the front desk I was told that there arent any vending machines anywhere in the hotel! The room that we were given was very dirty (emply bottle of water near the bed and hair in the tub. When I called the front desk, the gentleman told me there aren't any other available rooms. Although I am a diamond member we were not provided with any water (as the policy states for H Honor members) and I had to call 3 times and wait for 30+ minutes for two bottles of water. We decided to check out and change rooms the next day. As we were checking out I discussed my concerns with the one of the front desk supervisors (at least that is what he claimed to be) and all he said to me was I am very sorry! Nothing more! Very disappointed in this hotel, the customer service, and overall appearance/cleansiness.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hilton experience”
Reviews.Author: Magnus W
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a full week in this hotel as we are relocating back to Europe. Overall the impression is very solid, the hotel has recently been upgraded and is clean, great rooms with spectacular views of Miami downtown and the port of Miami. Location may be a little off but worked well for us. We were a family of four and were all happy with th stay. The lounge (Hilton honors) was excellent and breakfast and smaller dishes served there with service minded staff. Only minor issue was elevator occupancy and somewhat small fitness center. All in all, solid Hilton experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice service”
Reviews.Author: Randy L
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when we missed out flight to San Juan. Arrived late, tired and hungry. Avi, manager of the restaurant took great care of us, helping get us fed after the kitchen was about to close. Went out of his way to help. Nice front desk personnel as well. So far a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “JÃ³se and Ivan Rock!!!”
Reviews.Author: SLEEPYLIN
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay @ The Hilton. The room was good with a great view. All was well until we received no housekeeping after the 2nd day. Even after I told the housekeeper that the room needs to be serviced. However JÃ³se and Ivan were very attentive and gave good recommendations on where to visit and to eat.. I would recommend this hotel to my friends I would also advise them to bring their own towels...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: 000Rach000
Reviews.Content: We started for 3 nights, hotel was reasonable, clean and modern, what you would expect from a Hilton. Valet parking is well worth the money! Much cheaper that paying by the hour! We went to south beach everyday, having a car here certainly helped.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Ettienne
Reviews.Content: Stay here if you enjoy sleeping with loud music. We had very loud booming music until 1:00am, not easy to fall asleep with that going on. $28 for valet parking, really???? I hate being fleeced for parking and this seems to be a trend in Miami. No bar fridge in the room if you want to keep something cold. Not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AGGSBAGGS40
Reviews.Content: I had a bit of fear about this hotel from the reviews, but we are great Hilton fans and users and we were not disappointed. We had good views of the bay and the cruise port, but we were also 2 minutes walk from the metro mover which took us down town in 10 minutes. The staff were great and for the person who said about the bar, why did you not go to the bar in the lobby area, cant believe you needed to ask where to go. Staff there were so friendly and helpful. Rooms were immaculate. We were fortunate to were able to use the Executive lounge which did save us some money but again 10 minutes on the metro mover and you could get breakfast etc at a good price. We are planning to go back this time next year and would not hesitate to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Such a nice hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: PinkLibby
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the Hilton Miami. It is a beautiful hotel. The service was great, the rooms were amazing, we got breakfast for free... everything was perfect, BUT... as a lot of people have mentioned, it is NOT in a nice part of town. It was pretty scary. We were travelling with our 8 month old daughter and there were times when we felt very unsafe. We got a great deal on the room, but I don't know if we would stay here again... it just isn't worth the risk. Next time, we might try the Holiday Inn. It is in the same price range, but it seems to be in a better part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Cruise”
Reviews.Author: Ravens32
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel if staying overnight before a cruise. 5 minute cab ride to the cruise pier. We had a large suite with 2 queen beds and great view of the bay. Fit 2 adults and 3 kids comfortably at reasonable price. Nice outdoor pool. No indoor pool. Lounge/bar was happening on a Friday night. We would stay at the Hilton again if in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient in downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: edu_cavalcanti
Reviews.Content: Pretty standard Hilton hotel. Comfy bed and great breakfast. You can see the Port of Miami and the skyline from the rooms, which can be really special at nightime. Great value in comparison to other hotels in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room size - beware parking charge!”
Reviews.Author: JCitytraveler701
Reviews.Content: Ditto on other recent reviews, accurate in my opinion. Convention-type hotel, large; valet parking was $28, but self-parking was $25 too, and not convenient, but next time I would go for the valet for the extra $. Tip- your convention group may be able to get discounted parking, or being a Hilton Honors member, because they gave my group a discounted parking rate of $18/self or $20 valet. The hotel is located on the bay/inlet side of the water adjacent to the causeway to access Miami Beach, so nice view of bay, cruise ships & terminals, etc. Greatest perk is convenience to the free monorail (people mover) that can hop you over to Bayside Marketplace and other places of interest. If you are flying in, you could probably be fine without renting a car with the MIA monorail system - check it out. In November, my convention room rate of $104 was pretty awesome for this grade of hotel. My room was extremely spacious - I had a king bed, and lots of extra space with a sofa, chair, desk. Extra nice vanity area in bathroom with storage shelves! See pics.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not too impressed”
Reviews.Author: alexisgm
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs work! It's close to the cruise port which is why we chose it. No safes, no Pay movies, no minibar or fridge. Needs updating in hallways and rooms. Pool, bar and lobby are pretty nice but not fantastic. Staff was friendly but not overly accommodating . When I asked where I could get a drink they said the Doubletree next door . Bar hours are lousy .. And sending your guests to the competition? Hmm room service was actually very good. Hotel fine for a night but not more .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a convention”
Reviews.Author: hbhakh
Reviews.Content: I spent several nights last month at the Hilton for a convention. It is located downtown and is convenient to the free monorail that serves the area around Bayside Marketplace, among others. The lobby set up is a little strange. You must take an elevator from the street to the lobby level and a separate elevator to the rooms. I had an executive level room with a great view of the Port of Miami. It was very comfortable and clean. The executive lounge was somewhat small but had a nice selection of breakfast items and afternoon snacks. The staff were efficient. I would use this hotel again for business purposes.

Reviews.Title: “great stay....lookout for the parking cost!”
Reviews.Author: LikeaRock1
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, expensive parking..$28/day! valet service was lacking...our call to pick up luggage & equipment took 45 minutes & you are not allowed to use the carts yourself. we actually called down again...& they forgot us!!! so we were late!!!! no tip for them to say the least. parking was overly priced in my opinion. we paid $55 on priceline.com tho so the savings helped. great location for working downtown.

Reviews.Title: “A DECENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Philjulie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for 2 nights after getting of a cruise. The hotel itself was pretty good. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the lobby and bars downstairs were very relaxing and we did spend alot of time there. The room was spacious, but the walls very thin. We were near the lifts and they were noisy all night. The airconditioning in the room was rather loud as well. But the room was clean and bright. Except for the location, we would stay there again. When we travel, we like to walk around the area/city and enjoy the sights. DO NOT walk too far from this Hotel. We should have stayed at South Beach area instead. Downtown did not feel safe at all, and there were alot of unsavoury looks as we did walk 4 blocks from the Hotel. We soon turned around, went back and called a taxi to take us where we wanted to go. The Hotel is good - the location is not.

Reviews.Title: “Many Better Choices”
Reviews.Author: hotlanta2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is often less expensive and may be a cheaper option than others in the area if this is where you want to stay. Personally, I had forgotten that there is very little in the area and would prefer to stay further south or north. Rooms are avg. for mid priced 3* Hilton, but service is pretty poor from the front desk to the wait staff to the valet. Just remember that despite the fancy lobby etc. this is still only a 3* hotel and there is a reason for that. On the contrary, the lounge staff was excellent, but the food was typical. There is virtually or at least VERY few places to walk to here. So, if you want to get out and wander around or walk to dinner stay further north or south.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location fair price for Miami”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelLosAngels
Reviews.Content: Good location. Walking to downtown,and just over the bridge to Miami Beach and South Beach. Pleasant room, decent breakfast. Good valet service (included in our rate) When the hot water and drain was slow, they had a maintanance guy up in five minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Good Miami Location”
Reviews.Author: Bariloche-61
Reviews.Content: It was our first stay at the Hilton Miami Downtown - the main points for our decision were: - easy access by car from / to airport / the Keys, north direction Fort Lauderdale, etc. - near the port - lounge - near public transport means (metromover / bus to Miami Beach) - quiet area - not as much overpriced as many downtown hotels, but easy access to downtown All of the above points were met and we certainly will choose the Hilton again for our Miami stays.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay !!”
Reviews.Author: Flo V
Reviews.Content: Spent our 30th Anniversary here and everything was excellant. Check-in staff were friendly, Room was clean, spacious and comfortable. We had a very nice view of the bay. Parking was a bit high... $28.00 per night. (ouch) Lobby bar had a great staff and though we didn't eat at the hotel, the food passing by to the tables looked and smelled good. Perhaps next time. We would definetly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, poor location!”
Reviews.Author: lmmoreyra
Reviews.Content: DANGEROUS LOCATION, expensive and really bad valet service. But the hotel is really beautiful, comfortable beds and nice bathroom. NICE VIEW!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, not downtown.”
Reviews.Author: rmg15
Reviews.Content: I thought I would be staying downtown but this hotel is about 1 1/2 miles north of the downtown center. The hotel, its rooms and amenities were all very nice. The staff was accommodating and friendly. They did charge for wifi however, which seems unnecessary. Some tips: The parking is very expensive - $35 for valet and $25 for self-park. After paying the first night, i parked on 17th Terrace north of hotel the second night for free. If you are not leaving the hotel early, you pay $1.50 per hour between 7am and 10pm. A quick stroll in the morning up 5 blocks to the tiled Barcardi building is worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean”
Reviews.Author: julestf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Miami Downtown hotel for 2 nights before joining a cruise and were very happy with the hotel. The room was spacious and bathroom clean with great views over the bay and the breakfast was awesome, the staff throughout the hotel were very polite and helpful. The location was good, very close to the Bayside area and just a $15 ride to Lincoln Rd/South Beach. It did seem that it was full of business people and a couple of seminars taking place but this meant the bar was lively on the evening and the pool area was very quiet during the day so we could soak up the sun with just a couple of other people around :) Overall I would definately recommend this hotel and also stay again if we return to Miami

Reviews.Title: “Really Disappointing!!”
Reviews.Author: 2010new_traveller
Reviews.Content: We went to Miami in sep 2011 and stayed here. From the first look, i could say that i am not going to like staying here. The reception area was so not welcoming and rooms, i dont want to go into the details. Bathroom was so small... and no room cleaning service at all for 3 days.. overall never going to stay in this place ever.. definitely not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed--good internet, but TV options are Fox and no MS NBC”
Reviews.Author: NorthArrow
Reviews.Content: The location is in an iffy neighborhood at best. Probably a good choice if you are seeking to hire female company for the night. Beds, internet, and other basics are just fine. But I am incredibly irritated by places that offer Fox TV stations but do not offer MS NBC. This is one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Quality venue, decent location”
Reviews.Author: Spjika
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 days here for a conference and workshop. Overall really happy with the place. Would honestly give 3.5 but 3 is a bit low. Location is decent- fairly close to real downtown, very close to bus and train terminal for south beach etc. But not much in walking range. Conference setup is typical but decent. Wifi struggles at times, nerd heavy conferences will be rough. Food: seriously excellent snapper, bomb key lime pie. Again conference food just ok though, damn those $16 DOJ muffins Rooms a are good, big tvs, comfy beds, nice setup. Staff were real helpful and friendly, no faults there. Some fun decor and some oldish. Overall really happy with our stay, apart from one crappy bathroom light switch that took all your body weight to activate...

Reviews.Title: “Meh. Business travelers only.”
Reviews.Author: MykeMan
Reviews.Content: The facility as a whole is nice, but this place needs to pay attention to the details. It's located on the northern side of downtown Miami, about a $20 ride from Miami beach. The general area is not well serviced....very few restaurants in walking distance. The restaurant has a lot of safe food, the service was very bad when I stayed....usually went more than 20 minutes between servicing. Don't pay for the wifi....it can't seem to handle the demand in the evenings and constantly times out. The rooms are large and have nice views, but lack safes, mini-fridges, and the TVs are very poor (movie service wasn't working when I stayed and the remote is really unresponsive). The non-restaurant staff was very friendly and competent.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, great views”
Reviews.Author: CallMeJackie
Reviews.Content: We spent one night prior to cruising and were not disappointed. Our room on the 14th floor had a great view of downtown, the port, and the waterfront. The room was clean, spacious, and well appointed. The front desk staff was courteous and efficient during our check-in. The location is very convenient, only a short 1 1/2 miles from the cruise terminal. It also is only a block away from the Omni station, which provides access to the free Metro Mover, as well as numerous buslines (including multiple lines serving South Beach / Miami Beach for $2 per ride). We ate a late dinner at the hotel bar and were pleasantly surprised at the food selection, quality, and moderate prices. However, service was a bit slow, even though it wasn't very busy. The bar, as well as other public areas were nicely decorated and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Sexual Harassment,Liars, DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: StrawberrieR
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I (three young women) stayed at this hotel during June of this Summer. During our stay we were sexually harassed by the security guard on duty by the pool. Not only did the three of us feel unsafe but we were scared to stay in the room for fear the guard might have access to our room. The next day after I arrived back in Atlanta, I contacted the hotel and left a message for the manger stating that it was about sexual harassment at the hotel...I never received a call back. So then I contacted Corporate offices, and I was informed that the manager already stated that he sent a apology to me (LIES). The manger (Mr. Pellon) of the hotel did not give an apology, he just said he did to cover his own tracks. I had to chase down an apology. I JUSTreceived an apology on October 3, 2011. I was not even offered anything to attempt to make the situation better, or even a complimentary night at ANOTHER Hilton (because I defiantly won't be going back to the Hilton Miami) to make up for the awful three harassment filled nights we spent at the Hilton Miami. If this harassment has happen to you at this hotel also, please contact me because my attorney will be more than happy to take your case also.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: DanteGiuliano
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last June before a cruise. Great location. We had a few days of shopping before the cruise and we were only about a 15 minute drive to Dolphin mall from here.This hotel was close to our Avis rental car downtown. It's also close to the port of Miami and at night we took the free tram (about 5 minutes) to Bayside marketplace for dinner more shopping and drinks. The hotel rooms were clean and nice with a great view of Miami. The staff were friendly and helpful. Great place, we will be staying there again on our next trip to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: sboland22
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night after a cruise. The hotel does not offer shuttle service to either the cruise port or airport, however. It was about $15 from the cruise port to the hotel and $22 from the hotel to the airport. There is a shuttle that is $15 pp to the airport, but the concierage recommended a cab since it was cheaper. There is a taxi stand that keeps 2 cabs there. We walked a little over a block to the metro station (free) that we rode for about 5 minutes to the Bayside shopping area. There are several restaurants (Hard Rock, Bubba Gump Shrimp Co, and others) along with several shops and live music. There is a Burger King and Checkers Burger place across the street from the hotel. Since we had eaten large meals for several days, we walked across to the Checkers for dinner to take back to our room. However, we encountered a couple of homeless men while waiting for our dinner that made us feel uncomfortable. They stayed next to us until we gave them some change, but still they appeared to stay just outside the hotel (there the next am also). I would not recommend this hotel for a female staying alone (I felt uneasy) if you plan to venture out. Our room was wonderful and we were upgraded to a bayview. The bathroom was huge! Beds were comfortable and room was quiet

Reviews.Title: “good hotel supported by excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Campbie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as conference attendee with my wife. Slightly concerned by some of the more negative reviews but need not have worried. Room was fine- large, clean with a good bathroom. Comfortable bed. Breakfast was great- buffet at $15 but high quality. The food otherwise was good, bar area lively, gym well equipped and outside pool area clean and pleasant. May seem a long way from South Beach but there is a bus station close by and walkable to downtown/ bay area restaurants. What really made this hotel for us were the friendly helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Mdcarr2
Reviews.Content: The Downtown Miami Hilton is on the fringe of the downtown area but very close to the light rail and a short drive to S. Beach and Little Havana. Rooms are very spacious and modern with large Windows and expansive views. All in all a nice hotel. If you like dancing try The Vagabond nightclub within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Pre Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: dvus0101
Reviews.Content: My husband recently stayed here for a night before our cruise. Upon arrival, we were immediately greeted by a bellman from our taxi. he took our luggage, gave us a reciept and ushered to the elevator for check in upstairs. Check in was easy and we were given an upgrade to bay view room(it was our anniversary)! We checked in early enough to explore Bayside Mall. There is a FREE Monorail System that runs behind this hotel-- a must if you want to explore Miami without renting a car! Overall, our stay was nice, the breakfast buffet was delicious and the bar/lounge area was fantastic. The hotel is very well designed with very modern upgrades. I would definitely reccomend for precruise stay and a great rate!!!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE OF PARKING”
Reviews.Author: Melissa P
Reviews.Content: When I booked the reservation the website stated that the "self parking" was a flat rate of $25.00 with in and out privileges...That was not true, No in and out privileges. We paid $18.00 for 2 hours!! So the next alternative was to valet park for $28.00, which with this we could go in and out whenever we wanted. This was just mediocre. On the second day the valet employees ignored me when I went to drop my car off, they left my car running while they sat there and talked, wasting my gas. The thing that made me upset the most is on the last day when we got into my personal vehicle (not a rental) it smelled like a homeless person slept in there!!! My car had been rummaged through, and I really felt violated since I had personal effects in there. I am now taking it to get the car detailed since it smells so bad. So just beware of parking at this location, since in Miami you have to valet or park for an insane amount of money. Overall the hotel itself was just ok, I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a downtown hotel.”
Reviews.Author: surfercharlie
Reviews.Content: It is a given that downtown hotels in most major cities are expensive, parking is not free, and amenities are limited. This is especially true for 3 and 4 star hotels. In this sense, the Hilton Miami Downtown is exactly what one would expect. We stayed here on two different occasions during a recent vacation to south Florida. The first visit was kind of strange. First, the room we were given, so we were assigned a different room, which was upgraded to a King Suite at no extra charge. The room was huge, beautiful, and the view was awesome. It was a corner suite with floor to ceiling windows all the way across two walls. The view of Miami and the bay was stunning. We were also overlooked at the hotel restaurant when we stopped in to eat dinner. The staff, upon realizing the oversight, went out of their way to make up for the mistake. My wife and I were very pleased with the hotel and the restaurant's efforts to make amends for errors. Everyone associated with the hotel - valet, bellhop, desk clerk, housekeeping, etc. was tremendously friendly and accommodating. The same for the restaurant and lounge staff. The concierge was helpful, professional, and friendly. Nothing but good things to say about the staff and customer service. On our second stay, we got a standard room. Not nearly as nice as the suite. I definitely recommend the suite...especially if a person is interested in viewing the sights of downtown Miami. The Good: The rooms are very nice and very clean. The location is right downtown, and centrally located. The pool is on a rooftop and very nice. Parking is simple (valet). Staff is outstanding. The price we paid was very fair (prepaid on the hhonors website). The Bad: Parking is quite expensive, valet is really the only option, and everyone seems to have a hand out for tips. (I don't mind tipping, but the excessive tipping got a bit old.) Going from the ground to the lobby to the rooms is not at all convenient, and actually quite a trek. No continental breakfast, which is typical for this category of hotel, but am used to Hiltons and Hamptons providing breakfast for Hhonors members. No free internet in room. There is free internet in the lobby, but it's $10 a night in room - even for Hhonors guests. No hotel shuttle to/from airport. Expect to pay at least $25-$30 for transportation to/from airport to hotel. All in all, this hotel probably offered the best value, quality, etc. for a downtown, centrally located hotel and we would definitely recommend it to others and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with incredible customer service”
Reviews.Author: hashemsview
Reviews.Content: After 4 days at Walt Disney World followed by 4 days cruising from Miami to Key West to Cozumel and back to Miami, we wanted a great place to relax. We found that here. The room was wonderful and they actually had one unexpectedly ready for us to check-in at 9:30 a.m., well before their 3 p.m. check-in time. All was fresh & clean, and the view of the bay was an added perk. Every staff person we encountered was friendly & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great for cruiser ship passengers”
Reviews.Author: s0ut0
Reviews.Content: Near Miami Port, short taxi ride. Complimentary breakfast, shuttle to Dolphin Mall. Just a short walk to Metromover and Bayside. Room comfortable, clean and people polite. They provide early check in for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: APCO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in august,2011. I went there with friends and we really enjoy it. Its very central located (7 min by car to Miami beach, near dolphin mall, just 2 minutes from the port). Service is great; they really make us feel welcome and helped us with everything we needed! We were in a high floor with bay view, just wonderful! I really recommend this hotel, great deal quality/rate

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: liarisnot
Reviews.Content: I was here for one night with my family before we board a cruise ship across the bay. I was hhonors gold member so my room was upgraded to a bayview on high floor with access to lounge. Nothing to complain. The room is a big corner room with a balcony as big as the room itself :P floor to ceiling window provide great view and bright natrual light. As I was only there for one night I didn't utility all the services the hotel had to offer. Just used the lounge for snack in the early evening and breakfast the next morning. The lady at the nice enough to give my daughter an OJ even though it wasn't normally offered for snacks and only for breakfast. Of course, as in all other downtown hotels, parking is over-priced and I believe self-parking is almost as expensive as valet so I went with valet parking with unlimited ins and outs. There was one little bump in my stay, my room is a connecting room with the other side also occupied. The neighbor was a bit loud in the music playing but it goes with the connecting room so I can't really complain too much. Then I smelled cigarette smoke leaking through the connecting door. The smell gets stronger and stronger and I have a preganent wife and a small child so I called front desk and confirmed the hotel is a 100% smoke-free hotel and told them about the smoke. The manager was quick to investigate with security staff. Minutes later, the manager is back at my door and told me they have resolved the issue with my next door neighbor and asked me if wanted to switch room. It was late in the night so I thanked him and said I can just open the big sliding door to the balcony to air out the room. Overall, it was a very nice stay with excellent services.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, good localization”
Reviews.Author: sozende
Reviews.Content: The room is spacious and clean and quiet. The service is polite and efficient. Great place: a VIP Hotel with a standard hotel prices. I recomended Sonia

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay -- typical Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Jenkew
Reviews.Content: We got to the Hilton on Biscayne Blvd late at night and got valet parking (due to regular parking not having ins-and-outs). Entered through the lobby which was clean and up the elevators to the front desk to check-in. We got two rooms for three nights. Check in was pretty quick, we headed up to the rooms and immediately went to bed. Slept well, great service. Ordered breakfast room service one of the mornings -- food was warm and portions were large. $16 not including tax/tip. Food was fine but the presentation was good. (mini ketchups, tabasco, variety of jams, etc) Would return.

Reviews.Title: “It's a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bluelace
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ the Hilton during Labor Day weekend. I booked the room thru the hotel website(good deal) and it was nonrefundable so no complaining and no changes. I booked the 1 bedroom suite. The suite was comfortable, large, nice views and decently maintained although the sofa bed wasn't ready, it was pretty uncomfortable and it was stained. The nighttime maid blamed the daytime maids for the whole thing and told us that the maids do a very poor job,cleaning the rooms oh well. Overall it was a good experience. The staff was very nice and the breakfast buffet was good. I saw the regular room and they looked pretty standard to me. Travel is quite affordable these days so if you can afford a better room go ahead and book it. I know is only for sleeping but if is going to make your trip more comfortable it's worth the extra expense. In my case it was only $20.00 more per night so it was worth it. I read many complaints regarding the internet charges I asked front desk manager and he gave me the internet complimentary I think it was a nice gesture plus of course I was paying for the upgrade...least he can do. Hilton gives complimentary internet in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Not a ''glamorous hilton'' but still decent”
Reviews.Author: eroltoksoy
Reviews.Content: We booked via web and got a fair price last fall. The location is pretty much good. It takes 5-10 minutes to oceans drive with cab or car. At first they took us to an unready room which was disappointing but after a short wait they took us to a really big room with a great harbor scene as an apology to the mess. The rooms are pretty new or renovated recently . Bathroom is clean and wide. The beds are comfortable and big. The breakfast buffet wasn't included in the price but we enjoyed continental breakfast. The rooms have fast internet access even internet tv but we didn't have time to use. The staff were pretty friendly and warm especially the bellboys and front desk officials. Ä±t has an interesting entrance you take a lift to 3 floor above to enter the lobby from the valet service but still not tiring. As a matter of fact if you want to spend a few days in central Miami I say go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect ! Parfait ! Perfecto !”
Reviews.Author: Jocelyne Diane B
Reviews.Content: Very nice welcome ! Perfect location, very next to Miami Metromover ! Downtown and very easy and fast to escape to Miami Beach !
