Very professionnal concierges helping guests going wherever they want ! Very comfortable and wide bedroom ! .... unforgettable stay in Hilton Miami Downtown !

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: Lei14lo
Reviews.Content: If you plan on going on going on cruises leaving Miami. Hilton Hotel is a great option. The Hilton helps with transportation to the crusie terminal. The Hilton is very comfortable, family friendly, close to downtown miami and close to freeway access to South Beach. The rooms are modern and clean. The staff is polite and friendly. The price is reasonable. I really enjoyed staying at the Hilton, beautiful pool great views of Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Watch out for the Bums right outside! DO NOT GO TO THE BURGER PLACE ACROSS THE STREET.”
Reviews.Author: jrtraveler07
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. Stayed here during re NBA finals. The rooms are really nice and clean and the staff is amazing. Just need to watch out for all the greedy homeless people outside. Looks like the projects are just a few blocks away from the hotel and these folks come at you over and over. Never had a bum get angry and call me names because I didn't give him anything. He forgot I gave him a few dollars the day before. Also DO NOT GO TO THE RALLY'S ACROSS THE STREET. this is the worst joint ever. It tool almost 30 min to make some food an no one else was there other than the homeless people that kept asking to get their cup refilled for them. Sorry diverted from the hotel but it was perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton I've Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: PManCo
Reviews.Content: Great location downtown with gorgeous views of the bay, ships and downtown. We had a junior suite which was huge. The pool is fantastic as well with nice views and airplanes flying over. But the rooms were still quiet. Breakfast buffet was good but not worth it probably if you had to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Mandaqld81
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night only, before we got on our cruise. A lovely hotel with very spacious rooms, would defnitely go back again. Pool area was awesome, with a bar. Would have enjoyed it more if the weather was better!!! Was very hard to pick a hotel in Miami but we did well with this one, and could even see our cruiseship from our room!!

Reviews.Title: “Old building, Decent, location but only go if you're in a pinch.”
Reviews.Author: ConstantTraveler99
Reviews.Content: They are doing the best they can with the old building. If low ceilings bother you this is not the place for you. This hotel is best suited for the folks who want a decent place to stay when working in downtown Miami or are going to catch a cruise. We only picked it because we wanted a hotel that would give us the night we needed for our Hilton Honors points. That having been said that have updated the rooms and the corner Jr. Suite is very spacious, had a great view of the bay but lacked a microwave or a mini-refrigerator??? The bathroom was small as well. The pool area was actually a nice surprise as it was spacious and well furnished with a very friendly full service pool bar and grill. This is a very large hotel and very busy with many international guest (we overheard many languages spoken) and eventhough the staff was VERY busy they all had a great attitude and friendly demeanor. The overwhelming number of people just means that everything takes a little longer. I also did not care for the $28/ day parking fee. Im confident that given more time I could have found something more pleasing for the second half of our family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location”
Reviews.Author: A H
Reviews.Content: My two daughters and I stayed here for 2 nights after a cruise. I had prepaid for a junior suite and requested a higher floor room with a nice bayview and early check-in if possible. I also told the front desk manager Christopher that it was a special trip as both my daughters had birthdays. When we got to the hotel, around 11a.m, room wasn't ready, but they checked our bags and we went straight to the pool. I was told they would put a rush on getting the room ready and they asked for my cell phone. By 12:30 p.m, I got a call on my cell phone to inform me our room was ready. Beautiful room, gorgeous view. I called to thank Christopher and he even remembered that my girls had birthdays and sent up some treats for them. Thank you so much!! The only thing I found strange was that there was no mini fridge in the room, even for a suite our size.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JuliaDuran
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location (not in the beach, but great for accessing from and to the airport), great service and several options for dinning around. Great Breakfast!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Dadwith4
Reviews.Content: Great room, great view. Staff was great at making recommendations on attractions in the area. Thank you to the staff for everything. Its so hard to travel with kids and this was understood when we showed up at the hotel, at 2 am with 4 crying kids. The front desk agent was pleasant and understanding. I was embarrassed and she completely turned that around.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for leisure or bsuienss”
Reviews.Author: Rumbera1967
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five days during a leisure trip and were pleasantly surprised. We will be returning to this hotel when we visit the Miami area. The lobby had great decor and was comfortable and inviting for cocktails with friends or clients. The rooms were comfortable and well-appointed. The only drawback was the air-conditioning unit, which is loud. The food selections at Brisas restaurant and the bar were very good. Good value without being pretentious.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay but be ready for the bill”
Reviews.Author: Andreinka
Reviews.Content: The people were really nice and helpful. Parking is $28 a day which comes up as a bill itself if you are here for a week or so. The pool is nothing special as they make it appear in the website but it is open at all times (even though they say 11pm) so its really nice to relax here. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place to stay for business, would not recommend it for holiday”
Reviews.Author: bouji
Reviews.Content: Hilton Miami Downtown is fine if you are a business traveler. Rate are cheap, but breakfast was not included and hotel charges $20 for breakfast buffet. I bit too much for the USA and the quality is mediocre at best. Rooms are spacious, but dated. Hotel could do with a refurbishment. Pool was dirty. Overall, it was ok for the money and acceptable while on a business trip, but if I stayed in the hotel for holidays, it would be very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel in Miami, good value!”
Reviews.Author: JMS1980
Reviews.Content: Not right in South Beach, but this hotel still has a very good location near the Biscayne Bay with beautiful views! See if you can get upgraded to a higher floor room, the view is really spectacular! Close to a mall and generally well situated if you are in Miami for business.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: stephie38
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was exceptional. The attendants are very helpful. The hotel room was very clean. The only downside was we were on the 16th floor and I don't like heights! The hotel is absolutely beautiful. The pool is huge and was never busy. There is a tiki bar at the pool which makes very good drinks. Everyone was so nice and friendly. We were upgraded to a double room with a sitting area which allowed enough space for the four of us. I have no complaints about this hotel. There is a $28/day valet parking fee. I will stay again when I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: grantpadia
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the hilton when i go on vacations because it is a reasonable price and also because it is usually nice. This hotel is nice however seems a little out of date. Still an okay hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent visit!!”
Reviews.Author: courteliz2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and it was beautiful!! Great view of the city; close to Bayside and not too far of a drive to Miami Beach. Very quiet too, despite the street being kind of noisy. Recommend using Valet for parking-$28/day and unlimited in and out whereas self park is per hour and not unlimited in and out. Valet staff very efficient despite amount of traffic coming in and out. Hotel staff very helpful and courteous. Only downfall is Internet is $9.95/day and since we have been road tripping for a week we were kind of sad about not being able to access Internet on a computer. Overall, excellent experience for the price and would consider staying there if we were ever back in the Miami area.

Reviews.Title: “Ubelievably good value”
Reviews.Author: Cariadon
Reviews.Content: We originally arranged to stay in South Beach but cancelled after reading horrendous reviews here on Trip Advisor. We were on a budget so as we had a car, we decided to look for a hotel in Downtown Miami instead. We found an amazing deal at $99 per room, per night plus taxes at the Hilton Downtown. We had a corner bay view room with stunning views. Claire particularly liked lying on the chaise longue looking out at the Miami night sky. The rooftop pool was great fun and a welcome relief from the heat of the city. The only downside was that there were not enough towels. The breakfast buffet was superb, the other meals were good. On one evening, however, there was a shortage of waiting staff so we were given a free meal because we were kept waiting for over an hour. This happened even though we had not complained as we had not noticed the passage of time! The valet parking was definitely worth the money as we were in and out so much. Would definitely do this again.

Reviews.Title: “it's a hilton”
Reviews.Author: ilikewomen
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. My girlfriend and I got it for a great price. The room was very nice, as was the bathroom. The room was quite large. The bed was extremely comfortable and the AC worked beautifully. It was very clean. Service was friendly and on top of things. Concierge desk was extremely helpful (leave a tip). Room service was great - they had great 24 hour food - try the conch chowder, the conch fritters, key lime pie - I could keep going, everything was delicious. The restaurant inside the hotel had delicious plates and the breakfast buffet was reasonably priced and delicious. The outdoor pool and patio were awesome and not even that busy. The hotel is a three minute walk to the Metromover which will take you to Bayside in a couple of minutes where there is nightlife, shops, drinks, and restaurants. After 6 nights at South Beach right beside Ocean Drive, this hotel and downtown Miami (particularly Bayside) were a great escape for us. Relaxing versus the 24 hour party going on at South Beach (though that was great as well). This hotel was just great, exactly what you would expect from a Hilton. This hotel was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price...group of kids unmanageble”
Reviews.Author: drjones7137
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel staff to be very welcoming and accommodating. They provided me a room with a great view, and my room was very clean and equipped appropriately. The hotel restaurant was adequate; however, the staff here also strived to please. The view of the bay was incredible, and my bed was very comfortable. A huge group of teenagers were staying in the hotel, and kids were all over the place until late at night...flooding the lobby, elevators, and public space. I finally had to take my drink from the bar to my room as a result of all of the noise and lack of supervision. Kids were in the hallway during the night slamming doors and making noise. I called the front desk, they responded, but little control over the situation. I would hope that there would be a cerfew and expectations of adult supervision in the future as I got little sleep as a result of the noise. Other than the noise and kids, it was a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in downtown”
Reviews.Author: Travellerforlife
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Miami Downtown. It pays to have be a Gold member of Hilton Honors. We were upgraded to a much nicer room with a terrific view of the water and access to the concierge room. Cold water bottles in their mini fridge, fruit, complimentary breakfast in the morning! What more could we ask! Excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: schatsi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Miami downtown for 3 nights at the beginning of July. Everything was great, the room and bathroom were clean and a good large size for 2 adults and 2 teenage boys. The location was good - we drove to South Beach in 10 minutes and in the evenings we walked to the Bayside Marketplace in about 15 minutes. There are restaurants further up the street north. The pool is very nice. We would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible view”
Reviews.Author: afc2112
Reviews.Content: I normally stay in South Beach when I go to Miami, but this time I stayed at the Hilton in Downtown Miami. We got a Bayview room and it came with incredible views of the Miami Skyline. The staff was always friendly and helpful. I even asked a random employee about towels poolside & he was more than happy to help even though it's not technically his job. The only downside is that it is a bit of a hassle to get to the beach compared to staying in South Beach, but I already knew that going into the stay. I also liked that they were dog friendly. I took my Pekingese with me and she loved the beds (slept comfortably) and the floor to ceiling windows.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravlAdvisor
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located pretty far from Oceans Drive, however a bus stop is just around the corner for easy access to Oceans Drive. There is also a Monorail station just 50 Mts away from the hotel making it an easy acess for tourists. If you are a fan of Indian Food then there is an Indian restaurant about 500 Mts from the hotel serving good food. Overall a decent experience and pretty safe too.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it! Will definitely be back.”
Reviews.Author: SweetT1976
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing from check-in to check-out. When I first got there they had me booked with a 2 queen bed, when I asked for another room with 1 bed the guy at the desk, who by the way was so nice and pleasant, gave me an King size bed with a bayview. The grounds were beautiful, the room was awesome, bed was so fluffy and comfortable. The American Breakfast Buffet was delicious. It was very close to the port of miami, which I was going to the day after to board the Carnival Destiny for my cruise. I just really loved all the staff they treated me and my partner like queens, oh the door man on the lower level was awesome, he got me some water to take on my cruise so I wouldn't have to stop in my cab to the port. I will definitely be staying here again because I'm booking my next cruise again, so the Hilton will see me again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a bad car rental service”
Reviews.Author: MunterDam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Miami Downtown for 4 nights and for us it was a great base to explore Miami and Miami Beach. When we arrived at the hotel we asked for our upgrade that we requested via the Hilton homepage when we booked this hotel and we got it. The view from our room facing the water was MAGNIFINCINT especially at night. The staff at the hotel is really helpful!!! One day my husband and I went to the pool but we forgot our Ids and keys in the room. The reception staff helped us immediately getting into our room with the help of the Hilton security guard so that was a nice touch. And on the other day around 10 pm my husband accidently closed the connection doors between our our bedroom and living room so all our stuff was locked inside the other room, we called the reception and they sent a specialist who knew how to open the connecting doors to our two rooms so I was impressed since it was a bit late at night when we asked them to help us. The positive: - Very experienced and helpful staff - Breakfast was great! If you donÂ´t have a voucher like we did the price is 16 dollars per person. You can have fruit, tea, coffee, fresh juice, pastries, bacon ect from the buffet or order from a menu. - The pool was heated but it was SMALL. -The hotel is located near the buss station and the rail way The negative: The car rental service SUCKS! We asked the Hilton concierge to help us to rent a car. The Hilton donÂ´t have cars so they use Hertz in Miami Downtown. The concierge called Hertz and made a deal with them that we can rent a car for one day, with GPS and FULLY ensured for 109 dollars BUT when we the next day got to the dirty office of Hertz they played stupide and they started a new car rental request for 179 dollars. So my husband and I were both chocked and annoyed. SO donÂ´t bother with the Hilton car rental service, Obviously their cooperation with Hertz is NOT WORKING. Just go to Hotel InterContinental Miami downtown they have much butter car rental service with BETTER deals and they also provide Hilton guests with a special discount. Or use a nother car rental office. - No shuttle buss from and to the miami airport

Reviews.Title: “Awful service”
Reviews.Author: JOFH_Review
Reviews.Content: We were so excited about staying at the Hilton Downtown and what it would seem to be a nice hotel but we were wrong. Do NOT stay at this property. Let me explain that the staff of this hotel is the worst I've seen in my entire life. From the moment you arrive at the Hilton Downtown Miami you will realize how bad everything is here. First you will have to get passed the infinity of teenage groups, you will arrive, eventually, to the lobby. At first, we thought we had arrived at the "wrong time' and things would improve later...we were wrong. This is a nightmare. The lobby is constantly busy with teenager groups. The lobby is the only area where there's free wi-fi (and they call themselves a 4* property !) so expect tons of people, sometimes on their pijamas (!!) in the lobby, some of them, sitting on the floor with legs spread, etc. Just awful. The rooms size is good and views are nice but it ends here how good these rooms are: housekeeping do not clean these rooms, they "tidy it up" and that's it. There were breadcrumbs in the desk, the sofa, etc...and we had just checked in! Our friends had other 2 rooms which had pretty much the same housekeeping issues: weird smell from the closet, rooms hadnt been properly vacuum cleaned, etc. Want to move rooms? Good luck, staff the front desk are the worst I've seen in my life in the entire world. I do not share the same last name as my husband, so I made sure when I called from our room that they'd be ready for me at the front desk...my husband had already left instructions about my coming down to get new keys...yet, to my total surprise...they almost did not let me back to my own room despite my calling to reception a few moments earlier from the room AND my husband's instructions, and that's because I had my id with me, I can only imagine what else would they have me submitted if I didnt have it with me. The lady who had talked to me on the phone was just as obtuse as the clerk at the front desk. I had specifically called from the room, informed of the last name difference, they confirmed that I could come down and yet, after 2 minutes at the front desk...they act like they dont know anything! Outrageous! As to breakfast...this is another marathon...if you still decide to stay at this horrible property, make sure you hit the breakfast before 8.00am...afterwards is mayhem. Evidently I am aware that sunday breakfast at hotels can be busy...but to run out of milk ?!? It's insane. Staff try to be courteous but I suppose there's little they can do without the basics ! The only exception is a waiter of the restaurant, at dinner time, named Andre fernandes. He went out of this way to accomodate our request, very polite and quite frankly deserves a better employer as Hilton doesnt know what a gem of employee they have on their hands. My impression of this property is that they have a love and hate relationship with groups, expecially from Brazil. Hilton likes the fact these groups keep their occupancy high but equally hates them and have no idea how to manage such groups. Sadly, they extend this prejudicial attitude against Brazilians to other guests of the same nationalily. I was apalled to see how they mistreated another Brazilian guest, who was not part of the groups. As soon as he left, staff simply said comments like " oh well...these brazilians are terrible"...this is awful. The gentleman was just asking for directions for heavens sake. Our friends had to stay for a few more nights on that properly as it had been prepaid and they had no way of cancelling or getting a refund. Luckly for us, we managed to stay the rest of our stay in Miami at the Four Seasons (what a classy hotel!). I have no idea why and how the other reviewers have had a good experience at this property. Do not spend one single cent on this property. There are other hotels downtown Miami with much better service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay - but I expected more”
Reviews.Author: nanndk
Reviews.Content: My family and I booked 4 rooms and stayed at the hotel for one night. We had a problem with one room where it seemed like the bathroom had not been cleaned. We talked to the front desk and they immediately gave us a upgraded room with a better view. I found it strange that a hotel in this class did not offer free wifi in the rooms but only in the lobby. If you wanted wifi in your room you had to pay $10 per day. The beds were very good and the staff at the front desk were very helpful. The area seemed a bit boring and I have stayed in more interesting parts of downtown. Just a tip about the parking â€“ choose the valet if you want to use your car doing your stay. The hotel was good but I have stayed at better hotels in this class.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CSTraveler10
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Great location. Great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “great lay over”
Reviews.Author: starsrule
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel - got a good deal otherwise I dont know if I would have stayed there though. The bed was AMAZING.

Reviews.Title: “Security needs to be replaced”
Reviews.Author: mljnycity
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 2 different occasions both times the old men secuirty guards constantly harrass woman. I have seen them taking pictures of and with several females no wonder prostitues hang around there. They do nothing but assist in the situation. They ask for your business card and e-mail address it doesn't matter if you are from out of town or not. They are pigs!

Reviews.Title: “Great Alternative to staying on South Beach! Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: TXFowlers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family for quick trip to South Beach. Beautiful views from Junior Suite 101! A balcony big enough to have a small party, instead I enjoyed clouds floating by so close I felt I could touch them. Very clean. Junior suite very spacious. Peter Thomas Roth products in bathroom, excellent! Bed not as comfortable as I would have liked but definitely not the worst. I would stay here again. Walking distance to Miami Heat arena and Bayside. Roof top pool, nice. Parking $25 with hotel key if self park and $28 for valet a little pricey! But typical for Miami downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was great except for lack of spa-jacuzzi”
Reviews.Author: mikeusaca
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hilton Downtown for 2 days with family. Room was acceptable. Room service staff and front desk staff were great, however valet parking staff was rude, impolite and inconsiderate. Stay was comfortable except pool has no spa/jacuzzi. After whole day of activity at beach and evening of shopping could not relax in spa. Lack of towels at swimming pool and cold water.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied-Good Job Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: skoteach32
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights and I couldn't have been happier. When I arrived at 1:00 expecting to have to wait to be checked in,however to my surprise I was given a room on a high floor just as I requested which allowed me to prepare for my trip right away. The room was beautiful, very spacious and had a gorgeous view of downtown Miami and the Atlantic over the bay. I spent my nights hanging out in the lobby area which I brought my laptop and enjoyed the food and drink. My only complaint was the steep parking charge but all in all you can't go wrong. I think this is a perfect hotel for the business traveler, or the family on a shorter stay. The pool is very nice and the staff was very friendly. Good Job Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Only minor issues”
Reviews.Author: SSLtravel
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for business. I must say my first impressions were not good, but the hotel staff made efforts to improve my stay. Got in late and check in was a nightmare. Really have never been through a slower check in - problem was that I was behind about 25 foreign tourists, which is what appears to make up the majority of this hotel's clientel. After finally being checked in I was given a room that had some problems. Had to move rooms, but was upgraded to a suite and my room service was comped. Very nicely handled by front desk staff. Other than that all was well, staff was friendly. Cons: hotel loud, construction going on outside, Internet is not free. Pros: friendly staff, clean rooms

Reviews.Title: “Best downtown hotel for business.”
Reviews.Author: mmillernp
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler to Miami and I have stayed at different hotels every time. I stayed two nights in a room with two beds and floor to ceiling windows with a beautiful view of the city. We had difficulty with the TV the first night and called the front desk. Someone was at our door within 5 minutes. He was knowleable regarding the TV and needed to make severeal setting changes and everything was working perfect. I must say my most recent experience at this Hotel has really blown me away. Front desk staff very courteous and professional. I also had great meals in the restuarant with good quality and service delivered by the staff. I plan to stay hotel in my future visits to Miami. The staff is extremely nice and always finding ways to go the extra mile... I received a discount for parking for my conference and paid only $12 dollars for two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: fsufan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights while attending the Sony Ericcson tennis tournament. The tournament shuttle had a pick up at a nearby hotel making it a convenient option. We were able to check in early which was nice. Our room was relatively clean. There was a random hair in the tub, but I guess that happens. We ordered room service one night and it was actually quite good! There does not seem to be much in walking distance to the hotel, but we spent most of our time at the tournament. We did take a cab to South Beach for lunch one day - I think it was about 20 minutes. We were in Miami on a very busy weekend (there was also a music festival going on downtown) so we did not get a great rate as others have posted. If you can get a great rate this is a decent option.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Francescax12
Reviews.Content: I was not looking forward to staying at this hotel after reading the bad reviews ,but i have to say that we really enjoyed our two night stay. The room was really clean, the hotel facilities were very good and the views from the room were amazing, we could not fault the service and the breakfast, everything was presented well. I would have to say don't be put off by the bad reviews about the hotel. The only downfall is that the hotel could have been in a better area. Also there are safes available at this hotel at the reception which are free of charge!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service provided”
Reviews.Author: 1982villa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel for 2 nights in late may on way to Orlando, excellent reception service clean rooms, excellent restaurant services and well equiped gym Would recommend staying there again

Reviews.Title: “AVOID--Housekeeping is determined to steal!”
Reviews.Author: megan2010
Reviews.Content: 1) When I first arrived at the hotel there were two prostitutes trying to pick up guys in the lobby. These two girls looked so young and desperate. I almost felt sorry for them. They truly needed help. This was the first time I was so close to human trafficking. After I checked-in I made several phones calls to management before security chased them out. 2) My room had two adjacent doors that anyone could have pried open with a butter knife. I felt very unsafe. 3) I called management and requested to NOT BE DISTURBED during my 2 day stay. I had the "Do not disturb sign on my door". I was taking an afternoon nap at 3pm. While I was sleeping I heard someone knock on the door. Before I could get out of bed a maid walked in. She didn't have a cart or anything. I suspect she was entering my room to steal. She was in the room for several minutes before I kicked her out. My biggest fears while staying at Hilton was: 1) Someone walking into the room while I am sleeping 2) Getting robbed The next day when I went to the store I noticed one of my credit cards was missing. I eft my credit card on the dresser and the maid must have grabbed it before I kicked her out. I will never stay at Hilton in downtown Hilton again! NO FREE INTERNET IN ROOM!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but I expected more.”
Reviews.Author: cute1_cnr
Reviews.Content: I visted this hotel on a Thursday with two other family members. Check in was quick and our bags were brought to the room in a timely manner. The lobby, restautant, bar and pool looked great at this hotel. The rooms and hallways left a little more to be desired. On the way to my room someone had dropped 3 beers on the floor and it was wet and sticky with the cans still there and a wet floor sign in the middle. After staying in Hilton's in Alabama and other states i was expecting more from the Hilton in Miami. The room's didnt look nearly as good as they did in other less known cities. No safe or frig in the rooms. The staff was great. They only give 2 free continental breakfast coupons no matter how many people you book in the room. I didnt like the looks of the free continental breakfast so I ordered room service and it was tasty and arrived quickly. Checkout was quick. I would still stay again now that I know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hilton values for Downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: gs07jas
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this property for business. The property has 21 floors with beautiful views of Biscayne Bay, just steps away from the Miami Arena, Miami Herald, Arsht Center for the Peforming Arts, Bayside Marketplace, the fashion district, and lots of nice/good restaurants, etc. Paid only $119.00 for three nights. Parking runs for $28.00 valet, but you can take car in and out unlimited times for this rate.

Reviews.Title: “I was worried before I arrived”
Reviews.Author: jrmcd52
Reviews.Content: The reviews for the hotel were terrible. I had wanted to cancel and stay somewhere else before my cruise. But I'm happy to say the Miami Hilton met all my needs. Check in was smooth and courteous except after waiting 20 min for an elevator my keys did not work and I was on a high floor. Got a new one and all was fine. I was upgraded to a lovely suite facing the port for only $25 a night and they also gave me free internet. The pool was outstanding and service very good there. I also enjoyed the Lounge and food there. I will stay at this very busy hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “the best service I'd ever had in a hotel and a nice view from the room”
Reviews.Author: stella_24_1987
Reviews.Content: only a few days ago, I was at the first time in miami also at the first time in this hotel and I'm impressed! Everything there were great from the nice clean and comfortable room with the unbelievable pretty view until the good food, the great bar and pool etc and last but not least the helpful friendly and sympathetic staff especially the ladjh in the little shop and the men called fernando at the front desk, he'd done a well work, gave good advices and was very cordially,smart, professional with a nice charisma and left behind a positive impression! so I would like to say thx to all staff and especiall to fernando for this great service, that's one of the reason why we will come again soon... it was the first and definitely not the last time. I only could recommend a stay in this wonderful hotel to everybody

Reviews.Title: “The worst of the worser!”
Reviews.Author: popo007Louisiana
Reviews.Content: First of all, hilton hotels are my favorite chain of hotels. However, The Hilton DownTown Miami florida is one of the worst hotels I ever stayed in. When arriving to the hotel it seem like a luxurious hotel. The moment I walked in the room I was disappointed. 1.I was advised when I booked my reservations(2queen bed bay side view jr suite) that there would be a microwave and refrigerator in my room but there wasn't. 2. As usual when staying in a hotel; I lifted the blankets and check the sheets and found blood stains, hairs, and other stains on the sheets of one bed and yellow stains on the sheets of the other bed. I called and spoke with the hotel manager and she came to inspect the room as i was taking pictures of all the stains and hairs that were on the bed sheets. 3. On my last night of stay, my camera was stolen out of my room. I call for room service to bring some mouthwash to the room in which they promise that they would. 30mins later I haven't received my mouthewash in which I understood because they were sought of busy, so i placed my camera on my suitcase and as I was leaving to go to the mall I saw a male housekeeper near the elevator so I advised him that I haven't received my mouthwash; the male housekeeper said which room are you staying in because I will bring you some; I told him. then he asked if anyone would be in the room. i told him no but he could leave it in the room because we all was going to the mall. upon gathering my luggage to checkout for the next morning, I noticed that my digital camera was missing. On that morning when filing a report with the hotel security staff, she spoke to me as if I was a liar. I advise her that I was in law enforcement and that I know you may get false reports but this one is not. There was a moment when I thought to myself that they may have had my camera stolen because they saw me taking pictures of the sheets. can prove anything with no photos but I do have a bunch of witnesses.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel......terrible location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Joolsandlyla
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel faultless, really clean, excellent service and really good value for money! Loved Angelina who served us every night in the lounge bar! Our only gripe was the area... We live in the NE of England so are used to a bit of rough and tumble but upon leaving the hotel each time we felt really uneasy!!! Too many hobos and drug addicts!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Renovated? Don't believe it!!”
Reviews.Author: Cruisini
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights pre-cruise. We are Hilton Honor Gold members and always try to stay at Hilton hotels when we travel. I especially looked forward to staying here because the hotel claimed to be totally renovated, all 527 rooms. Our first impression of the Hilton Downtown Miami as we drove up, was good. The outside appears to be a very nice hotel. Once inside, the staff were very friendly, they greeted us and gave us a corner room with a great view of the port. When we got to the room I was so disappointed. This room had not been renovated. The furniture was disgusting. The orange chaise had stains all over it with something fresh dripping over the side. There was an inch of dust in the corners and along the back. The lampshade had yellow stains on it that looked like urine, smelled like urine. The sheets seemed fresh and clean..thank goodness. We politely told the lady who checked us into this room that we were not happy with it and she said that she was sorry, and that "renovation" didn't mean the furniture or fixtures. She said that she would tell the manager who was not available at the moment. He never got back to us and we were there for 2 days. There is a very nice bar and lounge area that we would have liked to take advantage of, but the chairs and seat cushions and covers were so dirty and stained that we wouldn't sit on them. The pool was nice and warm. Loungers were old and dirty. The restaurant staff were very friendly and our lunch there was good! The hotel is in a good location, close to the port if your going on a cruise and close to Bayside Marketplace. Overall, I am disappointed in this hotel and will never stay here again. Perhaps if we had been more aggressive about speaking with the manager and demanding another room we might have gotten a better response. Just didn't want to start our trip off like that. We have stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel in downtown Miami before and will stay there again. It is slightly more expensive, but worth it! Don't stay here if you like clean hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Pre cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: MJG2011
Reviews.Content: We overnighted at the Miami Hilton prior to embarking on a Royal Carribbean Cruise. The hotel was located close to the public transit to explore the city. The room had a good view of the bay and cruise docks. There was quite a lot of construction in the area so taking a walk around the neighborhood was a challenge. However once you are a block or so away from the hotel there is a vibrant neighborhood and nice park. There were not a lot of shops in the immediate but Bayside is easily accessible via the public mono rail.

Reviews.Title: “Truly trying to go beyond the rules”
Reviews.Author: dAABUD
Reviews.Content: This is my first review on tripadvisor and I am writing this as I cannot accept the cockiness if the Diamond member a couple of posts ago. Let us start objectively. Property is well located for access to the port, the beach and downtown and for people without cars there is sufficient public transportation to get you there. The property is not the newest around but is clean and the rooms are exactly matching the star level the hotel advertises. You are not in a five star hotel so don't judge as it it was one. My own personal experience show the staff is being proactively trained by management to exceed in every possible manner guest expectations. This my first stay as HH gold after years of diamond so I was kind of stressed of the benefits I would get. Let us start with how they exceeded my expectation. I checked in on an award reservation (not paid stay) at 8 AM and I must admit approached the conversation at check in the most respectful and polite way and made the check in agent understand that I do not expect to be checked in before 3PM (THIS IS CHECK IN TIME) but if she could that I will really value that. Guess what she checked me in. Now that was not senior employee but I could tell a Junior employee and a Junior employee will only override the rules if the hotel itself has a policy to extend early check in when possible. She noted my status and gave me a gold key to access concierge. Coming back to our diamond member because i am really offended by his attitude: 1. Check in is at 3PM. Any minute they check you in before is a exceeding the normal check in time. You can start complaining after 3PM and with my case you can see they did would they been able to check in you in before they would have. 2. Your front office agent was smiling at you the whole time and most then likely was doing it in order to come over friendly to you. You really think in this economy and with his ethnic background he'll want to risk his job especially to get a complaint note from a diamond member. 3. In terms of your exec lounge access key. Check in time is at 3PM and the hotel is obligated from 3PM to extend you access. Not a minute before if they do not want. Now would you have kindly asked front office if they could issue you a key I am sure they would have but if you do not the front office person might have thought of it. From now on the hotel could proactively train their staff to allow diamonds early access to the exec lounge and this is if they want and if they do so this would really be again exceeding the requirements. 4. In terms of the room allocation. You need to realize that for some people who make quite less income have different expectations of a fantastic room than you have. I imagine you thought you would had a suite and understand your disappointment in that but if you had a room with a fantastic view of miami or even one of the nicer corner rooms that might be qualified for the front desk as a fantastic room. Don't attack the front desk guy for his subjective opinion. He could also have answered you at check in that check in as it 3 PM and to come back at 3PM. 5. In terms of your coffee situation. I would not have appreciated that neither but you have exec lounge access so instead of waiting 30 min (which is strange as you were in hurry) you could passed through the exec lounge and the fantastic attendant which was there would have done that for you. Or on the way to check out you could have stopped by the lobby bar, ask for a coffee and explain the situation. In terms of your complaints the only one that I would look at from management as an complaint would be the coffee but as you had exec lounge access and the option to go by the lobby bar it is not a MAJOR complaint for you to rank the property that low.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and very clean”
Reviews.Author: vacationfamily101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hilton Miami Downtown for 3 nights in April with a family group. We had 5star service from the moment we arrived and through out the stay. Our room was just a standard room but was large with two queen beds etc. Our view was out over the city from the 6th floor with clean and modern rooms. Just a 2 minute walk from the Hotel is the mono rail that will take you for free to many places around the city including the Bayside shopping on the water.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for Domingo”
Reviews.Author: kathleendermod
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel for a group/work event. Working with Domingo in sales was the best part about this. He consistently had suggestions that were perfect. I don't generally plan events for work and so Domingo took the helm and provided the direction needed. The meeting rooms and lodging rooms were very nice. You don't generally go wrong with a Hilton. In this case, it was the staff that made the event run smoothly. Also, the food was far above the standard conference selection.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL STAY AS A DIAMOND VIP MEMBER...”
Reviews.Author: SaltShaker09
Reviews.Content: Just to give you a background, i have been a Diamond VIP member with Hilton Honors program for the past 4-5 years. I was very very loyal with Hilton Hotels, and quite frankly 4-5 years ago the the Hilton Honors program was much better, but anyways, thats beside the point. The reason i said that was that the stay i had at this Hilton Hotel in Downtown Miami SINGLE HANDEDLY made me QUIT my Hilton Honors program. i was SOO upset, that i was like fc&* it, i called Marriott and already have 9 night stays with them in the past 3 weeks. So i arrive at this hotel at around 11:30 am, i ask if there is any rooms free, and there was this employee at the Front Desk ( I'm pretty sure his name was Fernando, and he was a short latin male). I asked him if my room was ready, he said that the room was not ready and that i would have to wait. I asked how long, he said he doesnt know. I mentioned to him that im a Diamond VIP member and if they have any other rooms free, i dont mind going into a room other than the one i requested. He said he had to go talk to the manager...5 mins go by, he comes back with a cheesy grin on his face saying " wow sir my manager said they are able to give you a very nice room, but its not ready yet".. its hard to explain, but the way that he said it was just like a sleazy used car salesman trying to sell you a lemon car... Its like he was talking to a little kid.. He took my credit card and wrote down my info to call me as soon as my room is ready, and asked me to sit in the lobby. First of all, its rude to tell your customers what to do, second of all, I SHOULDNT BE THE ONE ASKING HIM TO ( AS A DIAMOND VIP) GIVE ME A BLANK KEY CARD SO I CAN ACCESS THE EXECUTIVE LOUNGE ! He should be giving me access to the lounge so i can sit there while my room gets ready. Anyways, i asked for the blank key so i can access the lounge, i got a diet soda from the lounge and decided to grab lunch. I come back at 1:45, i ask the same guy if my room is ready, he said no ( again with a sleazy grin). I go to the lounge, get some work done, around 4:00pm i was like screw it, I already called the Conrad hotel they had room available, so i decided to go downstairs and ask one more time if my room was ready. I go downstairs, ask a different front desk staff if my room is ready, and i see the same guy ( Fernando i think) sprint from the other side of the desk and telling this staff he'll take care of it. He looks at the screen, types some stuff, and says " oh wow sire the room just opened up, its a magnificent room, my managers must have done something right now in the back, they gave you a beautiful room"... i swear its hard to describe, but he sounded SOOO sleazy, describing how magnificent this room that they were giving me was, and making it sound all my stars were aligned in order for me to get this room... i go to the room, and guess what, just a normal king size bedroom like i had requested. I was fu*&ing furious, I really couldnt care less about the room, he couldve just easily said " sir i apologize but no upgrded rooms are available and we will just give you the king bed as you requested" and i wouldve been fine, but to think im stupid and try to sell it like the entire staff was going ABOVE AND BEYOND, but really, its was just the front desk staff acting sleazy and thinking i was stupid and didnt know that this was the normal room they wouldve given me anyways. And next morning i wake up, kinda running late trying to brew some coffee in my room, there were 5 coffee packs in my room and i swear ALL FIVE WERE DECAF ! i mean like WTF, dont they go through a checklist for every room? make sure 2 packs of reg coffee, 2 packs of decaf .... Its just so unprofessional. I called the front desk at 6:05 to send 2 packs of coffee up to my room, at 6:35 i called them to say forget it, if after 30 mins they cant send 2 packs of coffee to my room, then im over it... Seriously, this hoteel, and the Front Desk staff at this hotel ( specifically that guy Fernando) single handedly made me say goodbye to Hilton forever ( not forever, i have like 600,000 points which i'll use for vacations), but i will never ever PAY to stay at a Hilton ever again in my life.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views”
Reviews.Author: BC8-TC8
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hilton on March 12 (pre-cruise). We appreciated its proximity to the Port of Miami and the convenience of having the free people mover metro just steps from the hotel. We used the free metro twice to visit the Bayside Market area. Room-wise, we paid a little extra to have a Bay View room. Initially, they gave us a room on the 3rd floor with little/no bay view. After politely complaining to the front desk, they agreed to move us to the 18th floor once a room was available. 4 hours later we were sitting on the 18th floor with a stunning view of downtown Miami and the harbor. It was well worth the wait while they cleaned the upper floors. The only real negatives about the hotel is the slowness of its elevators and the odd configuration of its entrance. The taxi drops you off at street level, but you need to take an elevator up to the third floor to check in at the lobby. You then have to take an entirely different set of elevators to reach your room. Given the masses of people that may be checking in/out at the same time, it makes for some awkward/crowded navigation through the lobby from one set of elevators to the next. Otherwise, the hotel was wonderful; it looks great, the service is excellent and the rooms (at least on the upper floors) have fantastic views.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for a night or two, but that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: MSkinner
Reviews.Content: Stayed here March 12th for 1 night pre-cruise. It's a relatively nice looking hotel - probably used for conferences, as it has that 'conference' feel about it. The layout is somewhat of a pain in the rear, as you get in at the ground floor, go up a couple floors in an elevator where you get to the lobby, then walk around the lobby bar to get to the next set of elevators that go up to the rooms. Just seemed like we kept waiting for, or walking to, elevators. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Workout area was a little small, but had enough machines and weights for a hotel of this size. Pool area was nice, as was the lobby bar and lobby restaurant. Food and drinks were expensive, just to let you know. Most staff were courteous, but as per below, not all of them. Our flight arrived early, so we figured our 2 rooms wouldn't be ready. And we were right. It was about 10am and the front desk person said they were full the night before, so all rooms had to be cleaned, BUT they were cleaning one of our rooms right now and the other one would take a little while. Fine, we just needed one to change & drop the bags into. The sun was out, pool was open, and we're on vacation, so no problem. She also said we would be upgraded. I wasn't sure if it was due to my HHonors status or the email I got previously asking if I wanted to pay for an upgrade if it was available. Either way, all good. Well, 10 turned into 11, turned into 12, 1, 2, and finally got into our first room at 3 (which was the supposed-to-be-upgraded-but-wasn't room). Second room about 3:30. We really wouldn't have minded much if they didn't tell us 5 hours ago that it was being cleaned at that moment. 5 hours to clean a room? I don't think so. And the upgrade? Once again, don't promise something you're not going to deliver. Of course every time we went to the front to ask about it, it wasn't quite ready & they'd let us know... Location-wise, it's convenient for the port or for a Heat game. Unfortunately, location-wise, it's also very close to a run down / rough area of town. Every big city has it, I know, but it's really close. Even the Concierge told us to take a taxi back from the couple blocks away we were going (Bayside Market), as he said you don't want to be out in that area at night. Overall, I MIGHT stay here again pre-cruise, or maybe not. If so, we'd likely just stay real close to the hotel or take a taxi everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: sumi101
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel perfect location, although there was a lot of construction around the hotel. Parking is super expensive, but that's Miami for you, at $28 per day. Be careful when you check in make sure they put you in the room you actually reserved. Beautiful lobby!!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I would expect from Hilton”
Reviews.Author: otgwk
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on way to cruise. Booked a 2 queen bed junior suite for 5 people. The 2 queen beds were NOT queen size. They were at most double beds. The room was very large and had a pull-out sofa. But, there were no sheets available and we had to call down to housekeeping at 2am (when we arrived) to get sheets. The poor gentleman who arrived with our sheets had NO idea how to make a bed, he started putting the blanket on the mattress (before the sheets) when I told him he could leave. The room did have windows on 3 sides and a great view. As a Hilton gold member, we went to the concierge level for the continental breakfast. It was NOT good. Extremely runny, undercooked scrambled eggs, bacon, cheap bagels, yogurt, some cereal. I have had much better free continental breakfasts at Holiday Inns. And if you think the reviews about the elevators are exaggerated, they are not. The elevator can take 20-30 minutes to get to your floor and is often filled with people and luggage. We tried to take the stairs, but there is no direct route to the lobby and ended up on a wild goose chase around the building. Ended up riding up and back down to get to the lobby. This was just an OK place to stay for 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “What has happened in a year to this place?”
Reviews.Author: OCDTravel
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this Hilton for a couple of nights en route to the Key West for the past 3 years. Prior to this year, we had very good experiences, and we are Hilton Platinum members. This year's visit will be our last. EVERYTHING has gone downhill, from the guest service at check-in, to housekeeping, to restaurant/bar. The concierge lounge was not stocked and closed early. Last year, there were manager's receptions in the lounge with the old General Manager, (who we are sad to hear is no longer at this property, he was quite a nice gentleman), there was energy at the pool and in the bar, the staff smiling and friendly. A complete change this year. Sad to see from a once upgraded Hilton that has a spectacular view of the seaport, and Miami Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Miami from the top”
Reviews.Author: havelock78
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in the financial district, close to the hall of American Airlines Arena and the Metro Mover. From the upper floors (we had room on the 18th floor) there is a beautiful view of the bay and the city (especially at night). Big windows from floor to ceiling. Rooms are clean and make the impression of just renovated. Very comfortable beds and high quality bedlinens. You can use the Internet in a special room with computers. The weakest part was the breakfast - a small selection of dishes which doesn't match the rest of the hotel. Parking is expensive (28$).

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Mconey
Reviews.Content: I travel about every week for business and stay in the Hilton/Hilton chain for the points and usually my stays are fine there. This was my first and last time at the Hilton downtown Miami. Where do I start? Checking was fine and the room view was outstanding...that's the good. Valet service is god awful. There Is a dedicated attendant in a booth working but she doesn't pick up her phone...what's the point. Then when I got my car 10 minutes later the attendent just handed me my keys and walked away...a total joke. The room,...bathroom had hair on the sink and tub. The ventilation system (not the ac) was loud and could not be turned off...I am not the type that needs total silence to sleep but I was counting the days to get the he'll outta here. I was 5 rooms away from the elevator and the noise in the hall of just the elevator was annoying. I asked to change rooms and was met with attitude and a "check back later, we have no rooms left". I just smiled and went to work. You need to take an elevator to get to the registration. Then after registration you need to walk to a different set of elevators across the hotel to get to your room. A design genius put this hotel together clearly. My lesson! All Hiltons are not the same. I will be back on business in Miami soon and am damn sure I'm not staying here. Don't make the same mistake I did.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty socks found in bed”
Reviews.Author: DAPN2
Reviews.Content: I checked into the Downtown Hilton Miami on February 15, 2011 around 7:45 p.m., got in bed around 10:30 p.m. and found a pair of dirty socks still in the bed. I had to call for management twice and after the second try, some one from housekeeping came up, but spoke no English and did not understand what I need. I tried to explain to her that I wanted bed strip down and room throughly clean. After that fail attempt, I call for management again to send someone to room who can understand/speak English. This time the housekeeping supervisor came up. The night manager on duty gave me free breakfast during the length of my stay, but it was clearly obvious, I was lying in an unclean bed. The next day, I ask for the manager's name and phone number. I proceeded to call Benny -- and left several messages and as to date, I have not received a call back. That night should have been given to me free..... in addition to the free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “DONT GO HERE!!!!! STAY AWAY!!”
Reviews.Author: Mermaid1924
Reviews.Content: Worst experience ever with any hotel I have ever been at!!!!!! This is a 100% true story or what happened; 1) False advertising that we get a bayview that we paid for but did NOT receive . 2) Rude staff; who would be better suited to work in a jail than a upscale hotel. 3) Disorganized and made us wait 3 hours for a room. 4) The room we finally got was already oocupied by another guest when we entered after our three hours wait- the guest was totally naked also did I mention? 5) They insulted my fiance because he is french. If you have the misfortune to go here and see a Supervisor by the name of Pierre -- or a surly clerk named Brent --- Run!!! I say again this place is the worst- stay far away.

Reviews.Title: “Paris doesn't stay here”
Reviews.Author: mpeopl678
Reviews.Content: The bad: I had reserved a non-smoking King room but was given a room with two beds, neither one a King. I was too tired when I arrived and had waited in line to check in for over 15 minutes. The front desk was not properly staffed and I was not about to wait in the line again to be moved to another room. The check-out feature on the television did not work so I had to stand in line again to check out of the hotel. I guess this hotel is proud of their reception area and want you to spend as much time there as possible. The WiFi in the room is sketchy and there is a fee ($9.95 per 24 hour usage). No mini-bar nor in-room safe. Lighting is adequate and electrical outlets are plentiful and easy to access on the lamp bases. The television had the worst picture I've ever seen in a hotel and the television set is right out a page in history; a 25-inch gray box sitting on top of a dresser with so-so channel selections. The televisions really need to be updated in the worst of ways. One of the lampshades in my room had a hole in it and there were stains on the strip of fabric at the end of the bed that is put there for decorative purposes so the stains defeated the intended purpose. The shampoo and conditioner were nice, the bar soap was very drying and no facial bar was offered. Shampoo, conditioner, bar soap and a shower cap made up the bathroom amenities. The good: The meeting facilities and meals provided in the meeting room by the conference hosts were excellent. I was most impressed with the breakfast and breakfast service. It was really incredible and a welcomed surprise. I think I gained 5lbs from eating so much. The food was delicious and presentation was lovely. The coffee and coffee maker in the room were excellent. This may not seem like a big deal but the ice bucket was fantastic. It was extra large in capacity and kept the ice as ice all night long. I would love to have one just like it at home. The beds (mattress) are not very comfortable but I guess all hotels can't brag about having a "heavenly bed" like Westin hotels. The pillow selection was plentiful and the towels in the bathroom were actually soft and plentiful as well. The rooms and reception experience is what was not good about this property. The valet parking and bell staff were fast, friendly and efficient. The front desk staff were friendly and efficient as well once you made it to the counter. The conference I attended chose this hotel. The only reason I would ever stay at a Hilton again is if the conference hosts chose it as the meeting place.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view!!”
Reviews.Author: PenkiArnhem
Reviews.Content: Only the view from the hotel room made it worthwhile for me. I had a corner room with views from two sides of the room. I had expected a minibar in a hotel of this category. The location is not that good for the regular tourist with no car but a Metromover station is nearby. It can take you to the Bayside Marketplace where you find nice restaurants and shops. However, if I will ever visit Miami again, I will book a hotel in the Art Deco District.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel may be the final nail in the coffin for US Hiltons”
Reviews.Author: twogaijins Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very disappointing, dated, and has poor customer service. The room did not have a mini-bar and the bathroom has the bare minimum of hilton products - when I called to request some shower gel, for instance, I was told they didn't have that and they provide soap for use in the shower... The in-room internet was so unstable it was unusable for anything but checking emails - don't plan on using a VPN, streaming or doing anything complex online. Since there was no minibar I had to get drinks with room service - 18% room service charge, $3.50 delivery charge (?), $3 for a small pepsi and then they had the cheek to print "Additional Tip:" on the bill. On arrival I was told that we had been upgraded to a bay view room (we have Diamond HHonors VIP membership). It always sounds good when you hear the "U" word, but having seen this room I'd hate to see the others. We were on the 16th floor (Room 1616) and did have an ok view of the cruise terminal, but you have to ignore what looks like a post-industrial wasteland directly outside. The windows of the 'Club Lounge' were perpendicular to our room window which meant we had to have the curtains closed the whole trip for any privacy, negating any view benefit. The room was right beside the lifts - they had rather loud bells every time the lift doors opened, which was regularly due to the Club Lounge footfall. The lounge was disappointing. On the first morning I went there for breakfast which was basically bacon and scrambled eggs. The hostess there seemed snowed under with the handfull of clients as the coffee was empty and there were no knives to eat with! That night I had planned to go for canapes and drinks as I always do at Hiltons but the welcome letter stated that only soft drinks were available so I didn't bother until around 15 minutes before the end of service when I went to grab a coke. When I got there there was no staff to be seen and no drinks available. When I asked at reception they said that it had closed early. They offered us some breakfast vouchers for the following morning to eat in the restaurant instead but we had to ask 3 times for these, finally having to argue with the receptionist as to why we she should give us them! The hotel is in a really awful area. There's NOTHING nearby - we took cabs everywhere. There's a Burger King across the road which we went to once but the place was full of homeless people and it just did not feel like a safe neighbourhood. The hotel does have a decent little Business Centre with free laser printing which was useful. All in all I wish we'd stayed in another area of Miami (where there were actually restaurants and shops) or in Miami Beach. But this Hilton was so disappointing and we were treated so indifferently by an apathetic staff that I think we'll be taking our Diamond status to another hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for cruisers!”
Reviews.Author: hiviolet007
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because we wanted to have a view of the Port of Miami. We had never been to Miami before. We got the "Bon Voyage" package for 2 nights which included breakfast and transport to the ship. It cost about 30 bucks to take a cab from the airport. We did eat dinner in the hotel restaurant the first night. It was ok. The staff wasn't all too friendly but the service was good. This applies to all staff at this Hilton. The only person who was friendly and personable was the concierge. We had room service the following night and it was quick and our menu choice was great this time. Really great Buffalo wings and pasta! The room was very clean, comfy bed. I didn't like paying 10 bucks for wifi. It's my belief that all hotels should offer this for free. We were disappointed there was no spa also. Too chilly to go in the pool. The location was pretty close to the Bayside Marketplace which has lots of stuff to do and shopping. There's a free tram to take you there right near the hotel. We took a siteseeing cruise which was fun.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay prior to our cruise”
Reviews.Author: tuck5829
Reviews.Content: Stayed the night prior to our cruise, was a $15 taxi ride to the airport the next day. Reserved a king sized bed through lastminutetravel, however was not available when we arrived. The staff upgraded us to larger room, with a terrific view of the downtown and port. I would always ask for an upgrade if you dont already that that room. as a side not they had $2 beers in the bar which was quite nice

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: martiniclub
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in my life. In my experience, a less than perfect hotel is greatly improved if the staff is helpful, friendly and accommodating. By the same rule, a decent hotel can become The Worst Hotel EVER when the management treats their guests as if they should feel blessed just to be there, and gives no guidance whatsoever to their staff. This is the perfect example. After a long day of travel, I arrived at the Hilton Miami to check in. I gave my name and confirmation number. A young man behind the counter turned and asked his 'manager' a question in low tones. The manager looked us up and down, checked to see the name of my company (I assume to see if I was important enough) , whispered something back and left the room without looking at us. The young man, visibly upset, turned and informed me that there were no rooms at all in the hotel. He told me I would have to be 'walked to another hotel'. I insisted there must be a mistake; I clearly had a reservation. I also told him that if he planned on moving me to another hotel, it would be one of my choosing. He fussed and asked me to wait. He asked me to sit in the lobby. I refused.Ten minutes later, he takes a brief call, looks up and tells me that his 'manager' says there is a room. Not a bay-view, upper floor premium room as I had booked, but a 3rd floor basic room overlooking a cement roof. No explanation how they went from no rooms to having a room. Just the overall impression that I should be thankful to have a room at all. I accepted, mainly because was exhausted and didn't want to fight. But what continues to irk me is that management had obviously screwed up and couldn't even be bothered to manage the situation. They made some poor new employee bear the brunt of an awkward and frustrating situation. I won't even bother to describe the bland room, the noisy old air conditioner or the desperate need for a paint job, because my stay was ruined before I even made it past the lobby. There are a lot of hotels to stay in while in Miami. In this economy, why wouldn't you work extra hard to make your guest feel welcome?

Reviews.Title: “Good view and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: nomiam
Reviews.Content: hotel is close to the port and the AAA Arena. The rooms were clean and large. Bed linen and towels were nice and good quality. Very large windows - floor to ceiling. Wonderful view over the city and the bay (I got a room on the 18th floor). A nice rooftop swimming pool. The worst breakfast I have every had in a premium hotel (it was only a few products to choose from). Parking was expensive ($ 28 a day)

Reviews.Title: “MY BIRTHDAY WEEKEND!”
Reviews.Author: isisj116
Reviews.Content: As we arrived we parked on the street, there was constructiono but being that we live on Sobe we knew the area and parking area well...so we avoided the $29 valet parking per day....We were greeted by Andrew, excellent front desk person who gave us a room on the high floor....I told him it was my birthday weekend and he tried to make it very special for me and my family...we then went to lobby to wait for room, excellent service also...The service at every place we went was superb...i even thought i wasn't in Miami...lol..everyone super friendly....the pool bartender also....In the executive lounge, service was great too...nothing to complaint....our room had a great view of the port and bayside also miami beach and the bed was amazing.......

Reviews.Title: “Yeah for Hilton Miami Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: courtaz
Reviews.Content: This hotel makes me believe that, once again, service to the customer is important. We were greeted by the doorman who escorted us to the front desk. Already I was impressed with the professionalism and courteous way we were greeted. If I thought this part of the staff was good I was blown away by the bar and waitstaff. They made me feel like I was the ONLY customer that mattered. The room was clean and the beds were incredibily compfortable. We had a breath-taking view of the bay. The hotel is close to the Metro Mover (people mover) so access to Bayside and Brickell shopping was a piece of cake. Departure time as the staff arranged our ride to the pier. All in all staying at the Hilton was a very pleasurable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! If this hotel is representative of all Hilton's,they are BACK!”
Reviews.Author: mspennyhughes
Reviews.Content: The luster has been off the Hilton chain in many cities, for years. However, I was genuinely amazed at the quality of the room and the professionalism of the staff, at this seemingly ordinary hotel within walking distance (if you are FIT like me) of the American Airlines Arena. I chose it because it accepted pets (we travel with a 10lb Pekingese) & it was close to the Arena. But I was worried...because not every Hilton lives up to its marketing image. I had nothing to worry about. The rooms have been redone (or they look like they have been recently renovated) and the furnishings are great. The rooms are spacious and the views are breath taking. The housekeeping is impeccable and this was more like a Hyatt or a Lowes. I cannot say enough about the quality & friendliness of the staff--from valet to bell to front desk to bar and even the restaurant. It's either a terrific coincidence--or the sign of good management. I travel way too frequently for business and NEVER have such a 100% positive experience. If you need to be in downtown MIA, this is the best hotel option amid a lot of higher and lower priced choices.

Reviews.Title: “Well done Hilton”
Reviews.Author: oann72
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hitlon for 3 days prior to a cruise. I'm a single lady traveller getting close to 40. I have travelled extensively in Europe as well as a few trips to Egypt and Jordan, but this was my first trip to the US. I am very critical when it comes to cleanliness and service as I work in the tourist business myself. I arrived late at night and asked if they had any upgrades avalilable as I had read that the view from high up was wonderful. For a few dollars I was upgraded with no fuss to a top floor room facing downtown Miami and Biscayne bay. The nighttime view was amazing ! Ordered roomservice which was fast and the food was delicious even though it was late at night. Went to bed, slept like a log on the huge bed and woke up to an even greater view in the morning. Room was lovely and big, tv was the old fashioned type but worked well. Bathroom was immaculately clean. The only gripes about the room was that there was no safe ( you had to go to reception to store valuables ) and there was no handheld shower in the shower/tub combo. Wifi was about 10 dollars a day and very fast. Pool area was lovely and the frozen drinks did the trick. I'm a smoker but prefer not smoking indoor and the hotel had 2 outdoor smoking areas with tables and comfortable chairs. The concierge was very helpful and only after I left the hotel did I realize I should have tipped him like I did roomservice and others( I'm from a country were tipping is not normal ). He helped me with info and bookings several times during my stay but never said a word about it and was always smiling and acommodating. So very good service from him. And the rest of the hotel had the same standards concerning service. My room was always kept clean, roomservice was fast and good and reception was always able to help. The hotel does not have a spa but was able to arrange inroom massage very quickly, something that was very much appreciated and needed after a 22 hour flight. The masseuse was professional and managed to work out the kinks. So if you need a massage you would do well to go with the service the hotel works with. Location for the hotel is ok if you are in Miami on business or just for a few days, but you need a taxi to get to South beach although downtown is within walking distance or you can use the free tram that has a stop right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: Carolina_ferr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and modern, but you have to pay the wi-fi and the car parking, very expensive, by the way. There are better options in town.

Reviews.Title: “An okay Hilton”
Reviews.Author: UkSil
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the Hilton Downtown for 2 nights prior to a cruise. The hotel has vastly improved since we stopped there a couple of years ago, but is still only average for a Hilton. The location is convenient for the cruise port and Bayside, but there isn't really anywhere to eat or drink in the locality. You need a taxi to go anywhere and it took over 40mins for the bell boys to hail one on a Friday evening when we wanted to visit Lincoln Rd.

Reviews.Title: “To sum it up - very nice...”
Reviews.Author: em_rae
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when I went to visit U of M. I got a great deal online! The hotel is very clean, the staff professional - and the food - simply amazing. Although - taking a tip from a previous poster - dine at the Bistro - 1/2 price on some of the appetizers and reasonably priced sandwiches. What I got was beyond what I expected - I was stuffed to the brim. The room was immaculate (although the hair dryer had a broken attachment). If you can get a good deal...I say go for it. If you're visiting the med school, it's supposedly only 2.5 miles away - but it took me nearly half an hour to deal with the miami traffic - so either familiarize yourself the night before OR leave early enough to address the bumper to bumper traffic. BE WARNED though - self-park is 25 per day in the garage (or pay everytime you pull it out of the garage); valet park is 28 per day (can pull it out as often as you want). Rates are valid as of this posting.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, service terrible”
Reviews.Author: WillnRoss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last week on route to Key West for a couple of nights. The hotel is OK. What you would expect from chain, however the room service took 1 hour and 45 minutes to send up a burger and a salad! Crazy! Much better places to stay on SOBE.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Miami”
Reviews.Author: cigurl
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to its name and expectations! VERY clean and tidy The staff was great, courteous, and friendly. Our room had a great view of the city. The restaurant on the main level was excellent, had a variety of food and drinks. We had a small group and received a decent price for the weekend. The central fire station is located a few blocks down from this hotel. The valet was efficient and always had our car available when we exited the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Great Nights Sleep!!”
Reviews.Author: nihon13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here prior to our cruise and really enjoyed our stay. Staff were friendly and efficient at check in and we were impressed with the size of our room and the floor to ceiling windows too!! I have seen the other reviews with the comments about the air conditioning being noisy but we had no such trouble! The bed was one of the most comfortable I have stayed in too. We also had complimentary buffet breakfast included which was nice and unusual for the States - if you wanted hot breakfast you could so for an extra $10!! We ate our breakfast out by the pool in the sun which was lovely. I would definitely stay here again and if like is it is just a stopover between a flight and embarking a cruise it is perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: neuronas
Reviews.Content: The rooms are extremely noisy because of the AC. Even with the A/Cturned off you hear a noise during the night that can be really anoying. And it's quite load. Other guests in different rooms and floors had the same issue If you want to sleep well avoid this hotel. Service,cleanness and rest were very good

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: SATanthony
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel no real complaints. Thanks to Anthony at the front desk who managed to get us a room with a great view for my partners birthday. Nice bar and restaurant downstairs, great pool and views. The drinks and food are pricey in the hotel, but then again in Miami everything seems to be expensive. There are fast food places to eat right across the street, you would have to drive a few blocks for a good place to eat. Also lots of construction on the streets make sure you plan to leave a bit early especially on the weekend. Close to all - short taxi ride away. I would not recommend strolling at night in the area, during the day very busy and walkable. I would definitly stay again, and it was a great experience overall. One more note parking is 28 per day, and internet 10 bucks for 24 hrs - again something expected in a downtown major city ..no real place to park otherwise, so this may be the only option, or cab it..

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: AureliaSC
Reviews.Content: My stay was great!! I had a corner room on the 10th floor overlooking the Bay and downtown. Fantastic views!! Room was very clean. Had room service --- food was soooo yummy. It was just as good as if I was eating in the resturant I am sure. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I felt very safe at this location vs. places I have stayed in the past in downtown Miami and that is very important to me. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: charliegirl_b
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night prior to our cruise. We arrived mid afternoon and got in to our room straight away. We were happy with the size and I loved the floor to ceiling windows. There was a good happy hour at the bar but service was a little slow and after my first cocktail their ice crushing machine broke down which meant no more cocktails :( The hotel has free internet in the lobby and bar area.
