The breakfast was very nice and we were lucky to have it included in the room rate. We were able to watch the cruise ships come in early in the morning through the big windows. The hotel has 2 fast food restruants across the street but nothing else super close by. The cab to the cruise port was very quick and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel in downtown”
Reviews.Author: Rob591977
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights here for a business trip. This is an older hotel but seems to have been renovated fairly recently. One annoyance, the first suite assigned to me was already occupied! Second room was upgrade to huge corner junior suite with nice view thru floor-ceiling windows of Biscayne Bay and cruise ship harbor. Hotel was packed with south american tourists but my corner room was quiet. Location is a little awkward to enter due to road construction. 2 sets of elevators and 2nd floor lobby layout is confusing at first. High parking rates unless you get park & stay AAA rate (I did). Good restaurant. Good Chinese restaurant in Doubletree next door. Room was in good condition and seemed fairly recent renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and utilities”
Reviews.Author: j78_32828
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights with a wedding party and was sorely disappointed. They upgraded us to a junior suite. The room was clean, but a little run down. The AC system wasn't working well - after 3 hours of closing the drapes and running it at 60 degrees, it was still hot. Even the bridal suite was hot. We requested items from the front desk like a menu and toothpaste/mouthwash that never came. We had no hot water, but someone did come up to fix it, which took an hour. There was a wrong charge on our bill, and the desk fixed that, but they offered no concessions for any of the other problems we encountered. All in all, we were very disappointed - we expected a lot better from a Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Here Twice”
Reviews.Author: Johnny_CocountWater
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hilton Miami Downtown on more than one occasion. Both times I got very good rates (less than $100.00US per night) and I thought the hotel was great value for money. Pros: Close to people mover which takes you downtown and to Bayside. Comfortable rooms Refurbishment of hotel is well done Complimentary water Very helpful staff Luggage storage for late check out Shuttle to Dolphin Mall picks up at the hotel Bus stop close to the hotel Fast food restaurants across the street Walking distance to other eating places Cons: Paid parking You must use two sets of elevators to exit the building Immediate area does not have much to see/do Older hotel

Reviews.Title: “Above expectations”
Reviews.Author: PTuckness
Reviews.Content: Booked AAA Stay and Park. Great rate for a room to accomodate 4 persons. Large room. Very comfortable beds. Fantastic view from 19th floor. Excellent service. Beautiful common areas, lounge, lobby, pool. Stayed post cruise for 1 night only. Wished we had longer to stay. Will always return to Hilton if in Miami. Only negative, which is not fault of Hilton was road construction on Biscayne blvd. Noise never a problem, just navigating the in and out of hotel slight challenge. Car rental agency at location a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms , Nice view , great bed , bad location and NO soundproof”
Reviews.Author: siempreengira
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice , but for a business traveller is far from ideal , i arrived with no sleep and had to pop a coupe of earplugs to be able to , the beds are great and rooms are spacious and beautiful view but the walls are paper thin and you can hear crystal clear conversation tvs sex ect coming from the other room ,you can also hear the hallway noise amplified times 4.. there is no minibar which is also quite annoying when u are in business as usually you need drinks and snaks at hand ,, room service was ok and inexpensive compared to other Hiltons I have been at ..had the Chicken quesadillas which where not bad but artificial cheese , beware ... this hotel is far from everywhere touritsy and you need a car or taxi to move around , this was not an issue for me as i only needed the room to sleep and eat and had a driver.. an Ok hotel but too noisy to book it again , probably best for a group and tourist trip, avoid if in Buisness and looking for peace

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: S4024I
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great service, good price from AAA, and great view of bay. Cons: Rooms are dated, TV is dated, and only places to eat close by are Checkers and Burger King.

Reviews.Title: “Great price & room with spectacular views”
Reviews.Author: MtlFire
Reviews.Content: I'm a hhonors Diamond member. Was pre-assigned room number 1630 a large corner room with its own huge private terrace. The floor to ceiling windows and the private terrace made for spectacular views of downtown Miami as well as the cruise port. The staff were all pleasant and helpful, especially Bell services that made several dining recommendations. There's a Tapas bar on the other side of the street about a block to your right. The pool is on the roof just off of the lobby, with a large selection of loungers as well as couples loungers with cushions. The executive lounge had new Dell computers, wifi internet access was available throughout the hotel (including the pool area) -- free for gold and diamond members. Would definitely recommend for a pre/post cruise stay. Great treatment of hhonors members.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, spacious room”
Reviews.Author: quarks77
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night at this Hotel (prior to cruise embarkation the next day). Hotel location is away from the main tourist attractions (Bayside Marketplace, Miami beaches). There are hardly any shops nearby except for a fast-food outlet opposite the hotel. The room was large, clean and quiet. Bed was comfortable. Great view of the port from my room. Free wifi only at the lobby and not in room. Most guests are in T-shirt, shorts and slippers (We are in Miami!) so the feel/atmosphere is different from other Hilton (business) hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dirt cheap, but many compromises.”
Reviews.Author: seawall77
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying that I only paid $79/night, an absurdly cheap rate for a Hilton. As a Diamond HHonors member, this got me free internet and access to the concierge lounge... so the rate was an even better deal. With that said, I don't think I should expect much. However, most people are paying more...AND... this is a Hilton...so there really shouldn't be anything wrong with it. #1 The location is so-so. Nowhere really to walk nearby. Parking is expensive. The hotel had better be a perfect "island," or else. #2 Room service shuts down early...so you're really stuck if you get in late and are hungry. I had to get back into my car and rive to a Taco Bell. Not quite a full service amenity. #3 Valet parking, while pricey, was friendly and VERY FAST. Wonderful staff at valet parking. #4 They put me in a room right next to the elevators. I'm a friggen Diamond HHonors member. You didn't have anything else? C'mon. I'm always in Hiltons. I don't need to listen to "ding ding ding" all night long. #5 There were a TON of high school kids at the hotel on some group tours. WTF? Put them all on one or two floors and don't put them on mine. Colleagues' calls to the front desk at 2 AM yielded the response "their chaperones aren't controlling them." Gee, thanks. Try planning this a little better so it's not so inconvenient for your other customers. Junior high or high school kids in large numbers are unpleasant in business hotels. The lobby felt like a gymnasium, and furthermore, these kids clogged the elevators all the time. #6 The Concierge Lounge on 16. Oh, the Concierge Lounge. Too often, the fruit salad was skunked. Hello, health department? This was not good. #7 The Concierge Lounge on 16. The women working here were super friendly and helpful. They made me feel at home. All of them were nice. #8 The Concierge Lounge on 16. The guys working here were all jerks. Really cold and unwelcoming. I think one guy was named Elvis. He would sneer at us (and other customers with whom we conversed and came to the same conclusion) and storm from table to table, demanding that we sign in or point to our names on the sign-in list. Jerk. I stay at Hiltons at least every other friggen week of the year, AND I used my card to get into the secured lounge, and you STILL treat me like a thief? Jerk. Jerk. Jerk. And I' m not the only one. All you had to do was look around and catch the eye of anyone else in there, and they nodded and rolled their eyes at the behavior of this jerk. Why is he in the room for your best customers? Another guy was using the computer set up for the guests to work on his resume one morning. Nice. #9 My TV was old. Very few channels. This is a Hilton in a major city. You should have a modern flat screen TV. C'mon. And have more than 10 channels. What an abysmal selection. #10 The guestroom doors do not automatically shut. There's not a spring mechanism to close them....so you'd walk down the hall and see multiple doors not fully closed. This isn't safe. I had a worker knock on my door (thankfully) while I was in the room and the door wasn't closed. This should not be. Anyhow, like I said at the beginning of this... in my particular case, the rate was only $79/night...so I recognize, this reduces my credibility in griping...but on the other hand, this is a Hilton and they should be doing a better job than they are doing. This hotel seems to be a notch off from what a Hilton should be.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: worldtravel4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights - excellent value for money! Spring fling rate of $125 which included a food credit for $50, champagne and late check-out. Our room was nicely decorated, great linens, flat screen tv and a beautiful view of Miami skyline. As we had a car ,the location was not a problem.South Beach is just a short drive across the bridge and we took a taxi to Bayside.We ordered room service for breakfast and it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: frugaldiva
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great hotel. The beds were very comfortable and the room was inviting. In addition, the staff was very welcoming and knowledgable about the environment. Please note: There is a parking charge there. We opted for the valet parking, which was a few dollars more than self-parking. The valet parking staff was very prompt in retreiving our vehicle during various times for the duration of our staff. I highly recommend this hotel. It is in a location that is accessible to various cities and events in the city of Miami. Thank you Hilton Miami Downtown for an awesome hotel stay! :)

Reviews.Title: “Honest choice for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: FilipeLisbon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located away from everything, and you can only get out by taxi or car. I only had a problem with the toilet of my room, that was promptly solved. For the price charged, it offers a very honest service and acceptable quality and it can be a good choice if you are planning to stay for 1 or 2 days (as in my case). If you go to have fun, you better stay in South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Great Views of Miami”
Reviews.Author: CindRobi
Reviews.Content: Great Hilton Hotel. The furnishings were currently dated, comfortable and contemporary rooms, comfortable beds, large beautiful roof-top pool with comfortable lounge couches, and helpful desk employees. My only complaints are the expensive parking, the old, blurry TV, and loud air system. However, the old TVs were being replaced with flat-screens during our stay. Great location to catch the free metro-mover public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Needs More Attention to Detail At Times”
Reviews.Author: ItchyFeetLichfieldUK
Reviews.Content: One or two issues during our stay included :- Housekeeping - at least 2 days out of the 5 our room was not made up and we had to chase housekeeping. Don't really need this on holiday especially when you have been out really early say on an excursion and you return late afternoon/early evening to find room not cleaned or replenished. Excursions booked via hotel consierge could only be paid for with cash. As previous review on Hilton Bentley this seems to be a policy throughout the Miami area. Other travellers we spoke to experienced the same. Cannot even charge to room account. Bar service at busy times was a little haphazard - incorrect orders although they did make amends for errors. Pool area although at roof level and could be quite a haven staff appeared once again overwhelmed at busy times - could not keep on top of towel demand and allowed guests to bring bottles/glasses into the pool area. One issue with the executive lounge access - hotel literature stated the lounge should have been open from 6.00 am - this was not the case and when we arrived on one occasion to grab breakfast before leaving for the day we were told to "try later lounge not opening yet staff had not arrived". We felt that an establishment of this nature in this location and carrying the Hilton brand should have made staff available to man the lounge at the times stated. That said we enjoyed our time Downtown and the location of the hotel is good especially for one/two night cruise passengers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: EdUrias
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I had arrived in Miami a day early for a cruise to the Bahamas and found it excellent. We had stayed previously at other hotels near Ocean Blvd and by the Airport, but found this wonderful hotel. The hotel had great views of the Port of Miami, the Miami skyline and nearby shuttle access to the Bayside Marketplace all in close proximity. The front desk was friendly and the executive lounge was fabulous with drinks in the evening, and the continental breakfast in the morning. The next day we took a 10 minute taxi ride to the Port and got there early. By the way we found an excellent price at the last minute; believe it or not but it was $59 a night! For my next leisure trip to the Miami area, we will definitely consider the Hilton Downtown Miami!

Reviews.Title: “bad staff and executive lounge, good view and location”
Reviews.Author: KAAD
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 4 nights. as gold hilton hhonors i was upgraded to executive floor and had access to executive lounge. I liked the view from my room, good location. What I didnÂ´t like was the staff. They were not friendly at all. Especially in the executive lounge I felt I am not welcome. The beverages and the breakfast was also bad. it canÂ´t be compared to what i am used to executive lounges in hilton hotels in europe. valet parking 28usd/night, self parking 25/night...around are other parking lots more cheaper (10usd/night). internet is free in the lobby. good restaurant for reasonable prices good fitness center

Reviews.Title: “I'm having a great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Naddd
Reviews.Content: This is my second night here at Hilton hotel downtown miami. I love love love it!!! Clean and spacious,everybody is very polite and helpfull. Thank you all for making our stay unique!!! My only reccomendation would be providing free WiFi connection up in the rooms.not only at the lobby. I would love to enjoy that when i return. This is definetely not my last time here!! We still have two more nights to enjoy here!!! A beautiful place!! We feel so VIP;-)

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: Dand978
Reviews.Content: This hotel met our expectations. It was clean, the breakfast was ok, not great. The neighborhood is suspect though. We asked the front desk about a place in walking distance to get a bite and they said not to go out at night.

Reviews.Title: “Quite an Experience”
Reviews.Author: LesS_10
Reviews.Content: I am still trying to work this one out. They have been offering competitve rates for direct online bookings. The offer was too good to refuse. Reception staff were good and I was allocated a room on the second floor. Still I had an excellent view of the harbour and was able to watch the comings and goings of the cruise ships. The room was large and furnished to the expected standard of Hilton EXCEPT that there was no fridge or mini bar. Room services were as expected. Nontheless I felt that the room was somehow downgraded from Hilton's reputed standards. The hotel is located in a rundown part of town but is close to a major bus interchange and the people mover. There are few service facilities nearby. The equipment in the Business Centre was rundown. Many of the keyboards were worn out or the screens/servers did not work.

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: bs1887
Reviews.Content: To ease the reading of my review I devide it into two parts, pros and cons, and start with the pros. We stayed in the Hilton Miaimo Downtown for 4 nights and were enjoying a bayview room. Pro: ++ excellent location, good connection to the airport, downtown, South Beach and Key Biscayne. ++ great restaurant, room service, friendly waiters and reasonable prices + clean rooms and bathrooms with nice beds and an overwhelming view + freindly personal in general Cons: - - - The valet parking company is a mess. We were given the wrong care twice and a couple of dollars were stolen from the cup holder (which was closed). The bucks were estimated to be the tip, so maybe it's their service to self-tip. Theft was reported to company, but did not reach anyone when dialing the number I was given. - - Our room was prepaid (booked with Expedia), which was confirmed three times when checking in, but guess what happend? Back in Germany the credit card was charged again, this time from the Hilton. Took a week get someone on the phone who was really helpful and delivered resultes, but finally the refund was USD 50 short and we are going into round two... Must be a business sissue between the Hilton and Expedia, but not favorable to me due to a lot of time and money spending for international calls... Conclusion: Good hotel, well locoated with nice, clean rooms and friendly people but in terms of business processes, communication and availability not the Hilton standard I'm used to.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Tom71_Tina76
Reviews.Content: Firstly let me start by saying We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel.It was the last leg of our honeymoon and they hotel manager really looked after us.Started badly,our booking company in Ireland made a mess of our reservation.When we arrived they had cancelled it,Front desk checked us in anyway even though the hotel was almost full,They rang and sorted the booking the next day,Thank you Mr Pacheco.When we came back from lunch Mr Hendricks(manager) had upgraded us to a beautiful bay view room on 21st floor.It didn't finish there,He also sent us champagne and strawberries with a card wishing us well on our recent marriage.Great pool and lounge area,Free internet and close to metromover and bus station which will bring you to southbeach within minutes.I would like to mention Sinan at the front desk aswell,very helpful even though he is new to job.Couldn't complain about the hotel and we have stayed in many all over the world.Would recommend to anyone visiting the city.If only everyone else in the city was as helpful as the staff.This was our 6th stop on our honeymoon in the states and probably the least friendly.Would go back though and would certainly return to The Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Badly located for Hilton, who coined the phrase 'Location, Location, Location'”
Reviews.Author: AlexSW
Reviews.Content: I was in Miami for business, but sadly the location of the hotel was not ideal for me, which was my bad planning. There has clearly been a large amount of real-estate development at an unfortunate time for the economy, leaving this area feeling like a highly developed ghost town. That aside - the hotel: I am Hilton Honours Gold, and a one-time employee of Hilton in the UK, who I was very proud to work for. I was disappointed with the service in this hotel from the Front Desk to the F&B staff. The only employee who I thought was particularly service orientated was the Concierge. I put this down to the staff being unionised in the US - Management are afraid to tell their staff off, and are very restricted in what they can say or do. (I have various friends working in the Hotel Industry in the US who have confirmed this). Therefore, other than the career employees who are looking to move on in the industry (as I was) there is a tendency for the positions to attract 'lifers' who are doing it as a McJob, and nothing more - Hoteliers need to have passion for service, and there was none shown here. The free internet in public areas, part of Hilton's 'Stay Connected' program is great, but the hotel fails to capitalise on this market. The lobby was always full of people on their laptops, but you would have to BEG to buy a coffee, and mostly it was just not possible. The staff would say 'actually I am finishing my shift' or 'No, we have no coffee at the moment' - I was amazed, and remember, this is possibly the only location in the whole of the USA where there is not a Starbucks in walking distance. Hilton Downtown Miami - you are missing a good revenue opportunity here, and if you can't do it, why not sublet to a coffee concession? The internet was good - wireless only, which I can live with, but running on a clever system with good control over the bandwidth. I would have liked to see bandwidth options - a premium package would have been nice, as on occasions the connection was a little too slow, but ok. Overall, an ok Business hotel, let down by uncaring staff - this may not be managements fault though.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: JackyVicky
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel in downtown Miami with a business lounge offering free use of compueters and internet free of charge!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: kkrai16
Reviews.Content: Again another top hotel. Travelled from NYC to Miami. This hotel has everything you need, pool restaurant, free internet access, tv, lovely part marble bathroom with toiletries, room was a very good size and had outstanding views over miami from my room on the 10th floor. Staff were very helpful when need. The only problem i faced with this hotel was whilst staying at the hotel i travelled from New York and bought quite a lot of Mac make up which was stolen from my room by the cleaner leaving only one product, which was very upsetting as i had to re buy all the product and in Miami they charge 7% tax on all purchases which they didnt in New York. Security were called and Chance the security guard wrote a report, in which he was very helpful and came to check the next day if we were ok, had we heard from insurance company as of yet still no? I felt that the hotel could had been more sympathetic as it was of high value and no apologies were made and not sure as to to whether they investigated it with the staff??? But otherwise loved everything about the hotel. It is a little far from South Beach, we took the us there in which there is a bus station 5 mins from the hotel and costs $2 a ride. Bayside mall is nice and there is also another small mall behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: emiesmom
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton Downtown Miami the night before my cruise. My husband has a Hilton Rewards card so the stay was free using his points. We arrived in Miami at 11 am and although check in is not until 4pm we thought we would check at the desk and see if by chance a room was ready. We had been up since 2am and were anxious to relax a little. The man behind the desk took my information and immediately seeing we were a rewards customer said he could definitely get us in right away. He upgraded our room and gave us a great room on the 20th floor overlooking the port of Miami. Being a gold member we also had access to the lounge on the 16th floor for complimentary wine and horsdevours that evening as well as a complimentary continental breakfast in that same lounge. The room was nice and very clean with floor to ceiling window facing the bay (beautiful view!). After reading reviews I was skeptical about this hotel and the area however we had a very short, less than one block walk to the free people mover transportation system which brought us to Bayside market where there were lots of shops and restaurants to keep us entertained for one evening. I would definintely recommend staying at this hotel pre-cruise. 5 minutes to the port and plenty to do for one nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tim-N-Sue
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here as a 1 night pre-cruise hotel. I had bid on this thorugh one of those "find out the name after you commit" websites. We got the room, taxes and breakfast for $90. Excellent value. The room was great especially the bedding. Each of the staff we had interactions with were very helpful. Next time I go to Maimi I will stay at the Hilton. The hotel is a very short walk from the Metromover whcih we took to Bayside Marketplace.

Reviews.Title: “less than promised”
Reviews.Author: mutti4
Reviews.Content: two out of the three onsite options for food were closed although advertised as open - a disappointment

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, close to the Port of MIami”
Reviews.Author: a60chevy
Reviews.Content: We were wait listed for an upgrade and recieved just that. A huge room, with access to the business lounge, and great views of both downtowm Miami and the Port of Miami. Staff was all very friendly, my only problem the entire trip was the lack of elevators, as if you are on an upper, the wait seems long and the elevators are packed going up. Food was great, drinks at the pool were as well. We stayed for the "Snooze and Cruise" package, and it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice for one night”
Reviews.Author: NPotomac4
Reviews.Content: We were there pre-cruise, but are not in our 20's or over 65, nor were we with kids, and were there on a Wednesday. Parking was $28 per day with valet with unlimited in and out, or $25 per day self-park, which made our great rate on the hotel only so-so. However, the parking area was really nice. The check-in oun the 2nd level went smoothly, although it was hard to understand the people at the fron desk due to fairly heavy accents (I may have done a little better communicating with them in Spanish). The room was beutiful, although our view was to the North. The area around the hotel is in renovation mode, and it looked like the renovation ground to a halt after the recession began, so it may be a while until it will be nice. Very close to the cruise port and downtown. Outdoor pool and bar were nice, especially after a long day of travel

Reviews.Title: “Great price but beware of the cruise tourists.”
Reviews.Author: xavierCT75
Reviews.Content: This used to be the old Omni Hotel-it has been updated by Hilton but there are still some minor issues: the staff at the Motor Lobby will never tell you that registration is several floors up [but it is easy to figure it out]. The biggest problem is if you are ever at this hotel during a weekend: beware of the cruise tourists. These folks are usually youngsters, 65 or better or entire families; suffice to say that these are unexperienced travelers that love to clutter the elevators. So, if you want to go down to the lobby the stairs are actually emergency exits and they are nowhere near the lifts leaving as your only option to ride the elevator up and then go down...while you tell the people at every floor "sorry, there's no space". Otherwise, this is a good deal if you do not need to be right on SoBe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hilton for business trips”
Reviews.Author: jh635csi
Reviews.Content: I travel to Miami on a regular basis and always stay here when the rates are competitive. It is in downtown Miami, so it makes sales calls very convenient for me. The rooms overlooking the bay have fantastic views. The food is decent, nothing great, but Bayside is just a short drive or 20 min. walk in one direction and there are more places to eat in the other direction. The pool area is nice and the water is just two blocks away. It is by no means a South Beach property (thankfully). The staff is very friendly and they always remember me. The only complaint I have is the required $28 per day for parking, but this is Miami and any decent place will charge you for parking. The valet employees are very quick and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Another disapointing Hilton brand property”
Reviews.Author: NCLimey
Reviews.Content: Like the airlines often say, I did have a choice (of competition) and as soon as I pulled up, I was annoyed that my corporate travel system hadn't offered me the Doubletree immediately behind the building, hmm, maybe they were full and thatâ€™s where all the cool kids were hanging out. Immediately, something doesn't seem right - people have double parked the driveway (parked next to each other with no other cars in the whole 2x2 lane drives.) I pulled up and a valet appeared, I told him that I'm checking in, he grunts and asks for my keys. Somehow I still ended up parking my own car, since he just returned my keys to me when I got back down without asking any questions. This was after I had made the trek into the lobby which isn't a lobby (take the elevator to the 7th(?) floor) to get my key. I Waited in line for several minutes, despite their being three staff at the desk attending to two other guests, I didnâ€™t notice any hhonors line. I then turned right into what I thought was the parking lot (no signs say â€œvalet onlyâ€�) to be greeted with a keypad. I had to reverse out and find the parking lot for the people that didn't automatically get valet parking, meanwhile the valet watched me drive past him in a stationary car and didnâ€™t say a word (again). The parking is the Omni center, next door, which turned out to be some fairly expensive parking. I paid $26 for just 3 hours before I had to go to work for the night at a nearby datacenter. Another tip: Don't consider this hotel if you happen to work odd hours. Itâ€™s too loud. I paid the Omni center $50 more dollars for the subsequent 28 hour stay (reduced from $60 because I was a hotel guest). No wonder this large multi-story is practically empty - those should be concert parking prices! - or European capital, not downtown Miami (technically, this is just north of downtown, to be specific, across the street from a Checkers and a Burger King). The room: Beautiful bay view and downtown made for a great photo (attached) - It was a shame that the window was so dirty. Whatever housekeeping are using isn't working, because you can tell that the person is quite short since at my eye level and up to the ceiling, the windows were clean, but left to dry from wet (with a dirty rag) from 5'8 down - unless John McCain was cleaning the windows, he has a medical excuse for not being able to raise his arms and it would be wrong to chastise his work if he were (disabled) housekeeper. I think the housekeeping staff, or maintenance, should use a squeegee, simple solution, or get a professional window cleaner - there should be several in a diverse, large town like Miami. I got an interconnecting room. My corporate system doesnâ€™t let me send notes and I always forget to state I donâ€™t want that at check in. I could see light below the door when my room was dark and I could clearly hear the people in the next room talking and going to the bathroom. The Air Conditioning sounds almost identical to my Lawn Mower (room 1216) just a few decibels lower, or like my lawn mower if my neighbor had stolen it and was cheekily using it while I was in bed. Himia (new nick) tip #2 â€“ crank the AC for an hour or two before you go to bed and seal the drapes well â€“ the heat bleeds into the room from the ceiling to floor windows, then raise the thermostat so that you can go to sleep. TV: - I havenâ€™t seen an old square button Zenith in years. If the TV gets any older, Zenith might buy them park for posterity, or some kind of new-age hip corporate campus artwork/sculpture. I forgot to check if it had faux wooden sides, but the red gun was definitely about to fail. An ambient buzz fills the room if the picture contains too much red and peopleâ€™s skin seems to melt off their face â€“ even more so if youâ€™re viewing Jersey Shore. Himia tip #3 â€“ itâ€™s not the ambient drone of a Stuka divebomber, itâ€™s the TV Internet: One night I chose free, basic wireless access â€“ no problem, next day I read my hhonors diamond welcome letter â€“ it said that apart from the boring â€œweâ€™re so happy to have youâ€� crap, that I was entitled to â€œfree high speed internet accessâ€¦the charge will later be removed from your bill.â€� â€“ It wasnâ€™t â€“ I paid $9.99 and I couldnâ€™t be bothered standing in line again to dispute it, I left. Food: I only tried room service once, because at 10:30 on the second night, the phone just rang out. Day 1 was a Cuban sandwich with fries and a pepsi, it came to about $21.60 after the compulsory 18% gratuity + $3.50 delivery charge. I look forward to the day that Iâ€™m not relied upon to bolster employee salaries for doing their jobs, so I didnâ€™t really mind the compulsory charge (not my money anyway) but I accidentally signed my name on the extra tip line and then again on the signature line. I can only hope that this was not construed as some sort of xxxxblock. Power to the people! and so on and so forthâ€¦ The sandwich was kind of salty by the way, Iâ€™m hoping it wasnâ€™t for the benefit of the pork, but Iâ€™m happy to report that my bowels are OK! <thumbs up> (in the air). As I mentioned, this hotel isnâ€™t considerate enough for people working unusual hours, both days there, I had the housekeeping cart parked outside my door for what seemed hours while the staff held conversations with each other down the hall and then loud radios continued to operate with sound wafting in from under my conjoined room (along with lots of hairspray from the guests next door that morning â€“ they commented the brand, and both agreed how great it was and how they both used it, but I missed the actual name). Other, little, mostly whiny things: No body wash, no mouthwash, hair on washcloth. Toilet flush seemed to last for minutes, used gallons of water and continued during refill. I think Iâ€™m done with Hilton brand, Iâ€™m not all about the room service (I usually have a car and often eat drive â€œthruâ€� like a plebian anyway), so Iâ€™d much rather have a fridge. If I stick with Hilton for another million hhonors points, it will mostly be with other chains in the group, such as Embassy (not Southfield, MI tho).

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: JudeCork
Reviews.Content: overpriced, bad service, room smelled of dog, no restaurants nearby, bus ride to beach was an experience we never want to repeat again. Strange locals.. Boring place to go especially after getting off a royal carribean cruise.

Reviews.Title: “will not recommend - overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: BullerDenmark
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family twice on the same vacation in Florida. Unluckily we had pre-booked this overrated hotel and could not change the booking for the last day. The location is not so great except if you are going on a cruise. No shops nearby and we didn't feel safe on the street after dark because there were many homeless people. We were 6 sharing a jr. suite - and both times we stayed here we had to go down and ask for sheets for the pull-out sofa. The toilet was loose. There were only decaffeinated coffee and no spoon or anything to apply the sugar. When we asked the frontdesk were the nearest restaurant were? - they did not know any!! - Price for valet parking 28$ !! So much noise from the airplanes taking of just abowe the hotel. No free internet in rooms - no breakfast - no flatscreen - The good thing is the view from the rooms which is stunning and the pool area is very nice but unless you are going on a cruise from the cruiseport nearby I will not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, nice price”
Reviews.Author: staceskins
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Miami Hilton Downtown for 2 nights following a cruise. I am a member of the Hilton HHonors so I always stay at a Hilton property. Since our ship disembarked early, we arrived at the hotel at 10am. We were told a room was ready on the 1st floor so we took it. I had made reservations for a room with a King size bed but this room had 2 queens. We really didn't care, we were just happy to get a room that early. We were very pleased with our room. It was very large with windows all around and sliding doors that led out to a patio. Since we are smokers we enjoyed the use of the patio. When we first arrived there were broken beer bottles outside on the patio but it was cleaned up right away after I had let house keeping know. The room was clean and beds were very comfortable. We left our room the next day at 9am and headed to South Beach. We came back at 4pm and our room had not been cleaned yet. I was a bit disappointed but called House Keeping to have our amenities replenished but didn't bother getting our room cleaned since it was getting too late for that. The hotel isn't in the greatest area but everything is fairly close by. You can walk to the Bayside Market in about 20 minutes or take a cab. We really liked Bayside, had some lunch and did a bit of shopping. Nice lively atmosphere. We walked to the Double Tree just behind the Hilton for supper one evening. You can use the Skywalk to get there or walk outside. We ate at the Italian restaurant and it was great. Fablulous food and great service. The prices were good too. South Beach is a definate must if you are visiting Miami. Very lively and what a huge beautiful beach! Tons of shops, hotels and restaurants too. If you want to spend a night there be prepared to pay at least $350 per night. It was a $15.00 taxi ride from the Hilton so you won't break the bank to go by cab. The Hilton also has free internet stations in the Business Center which I used a few times during our stay. We didn't eat there but had drinks and cappacino's at the bar and they were very good. They have a lovely pool outdoors to use also with lots of loungers and pool towels. There is also a bar by the pool so we ordered a bucket of beers and soaked up the sun. Check out was fast and pleasant. We took a cab to the Miami International Aiport. The Hilton Shuttle is much more expensive than a cab so don't bother. It is $16 per person and a cab is $21.00 for the trip. I have added a few pictures of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “weak service for business travelers and horrible food”
Reviews.Author: sfphotog
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that I had a really horrendous experience with the room service food. Here are a couple of examples: One of the dishes I wanted to order: "Pasta with shrimp, garlic, white wine, herbs in an herb butter sauce" I wanted something slightly healthier, so I asked if they could lighten the butter in the sauce, and they said yes. So, what did they deliver, pasta noodles with cheese on top--there was no garlic, no evidence of white wine, and no evidence of herbs. Another dish I ordered, "Grilled Chicken breast, roasted tomatoes, olives, and basil on baguette" (note I'm using quotations as these are actual citations from the menu itself...just so you don't think i had some twisted interpretation). I ordered this as I thought it would reasonably healthy, so the first order came with a huge amount of cheese--I mean the sandwich looked like nachos in a sense that was covered with cheese, so I sent that back. I noted to room service that there was no mention of cheese on the sandwich and they apologized but said this is how they do it and customer like it . Ok, fair enough, but send me what's on the menu. So for the 2nd order, here's what arrived: a grilled chicken breast on a bun with sundried tomato paste (probably from a can), and evidently the basil and olives are in the paste. Is it just me or wouldnâ€™t one expect to see some fresh basil and some fresh roasted tomatoes on the chicken breast?? The Internet connection was a bit intermittent over the four days I was there. It probably worked 75% of the time, but given that I'm there for business, that's not acceptable, especially if I'm paying for service. Last, I asked several times to speak with the general manager and have him/her call me, and I never got a call... wouldn't recommend this hotel to a friend, and not even an enemy

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - very pet friendly”
Reviews.Author: miumiu4me
Reviews.Content: We had a horrible experience w/the Marina and had to find a last minute room. We ended up getting sent to (and later booking) the Hilton. We had our small dog w/us and they were very nice to her. Everyone was friendly. While the location isn't that great unless you're in Miami to take a cruise or to see a show (which we were), we'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location Free internet 24/7 Poor service Late checkout”
Reviews.Author: peterperfect2
Reviews.Content: Booked over the net (hotels.com)from Australia for a 4 night stay prior to a cruise from Ft Lauderdale. King double requested with views to south or east as well as breakfast and carparking $200 / night. Got a 4th floor room with canyon views. No breakfast or carparking. Location was great 200 yds from Omni station for free Metro Mover + local bus station ($2 one way anywhere on route). $25 taxi from Miami airport. Rooms large and clean. No room safe or fridge - ice down the hall. Paid for newspapers - got 2 out of 4. They just said they ran out. Once coffee machine was used it was not replenished, even after a request to staff. Give it 4 out of 5 for location, but 2 out of 5 for service. Room service trays stayed in corridors for 2 days.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING VIEWS! No jacuzzi, balconys, or flat screen TV's”
Reviews.Author: DiMartinoM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Miami downtown for my girlfriends birthday. We got a decent rate and decided to give it a try - we're glad we did! We got a jr. suite on the 17th floor and the view of downtown Miami was breathtaking! The beds were very comfortable (as in most hiltons) The only bad aspects were: A very disorganized and unknowledgable front desk staff, a steep 28$ valet fee per night, no flat screen tv's OR jacuzzi. Hotel def. needs some upgrades but nothing too big to hinder your experience. Happy hour was decent, and food came out pretty quickly. The hotel advertises it's "metro motor" but it's done through the city without any affiliation to the hotel, still very close and worth trying!

Reviews.Title: “Rip off”
Reviews.Author: hope2345
Reviews.Content: Rooms are outdated. Rugs and furniture are stained. Rooms are dirty and small. There was a coffee stirrer on the floor when we arrived and it stayed there for 3 days even though the housekeeper came to "clean" the room daily. Night stand was full of dust. Lamp on nightstand was not working so had to call for repair. Television had only 4 channels. Called front desk and they sent someone to repair it. We were then able to get about 8 channels. Bathrooms don't have ventilation so after shower, mirror stays fogged for a while. Hotel has no heating system. Air conditioner was old and loud. Definitely not worth the $249 a night that we were charged. Called Hilton headquarters to complain and was told that the hotel manager would call me back---he never called. They seem to only be interested in taking your money and not providing appropriate customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Not the prettiest hotel and the area seemed kind of shady.”
Reviews.Author: Agarcia08
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Labor Day weekend in 2008. The hotel was okay. The room was a decent size, but seemed old. Doesn't look like the photos provided. They were doing some construction while we were there, so it was loud. The area the hotel is in isn't exactly the prettiest or safest. The only thing close to walk to if you get hungry and don't feel like eating at the hotel is a Rally's which has really slow service. You get harassed by homeless people walking to Rally's and back from Rally's. The pool area was okay. Nothing really memorable about the hotel itself. We had a good time on our vacation, just didn't care too much for the hotel. We booked here because they were having a special.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel booked through Barrhead Travel. Stay was en route to Cruise to Caribean”
Reviews.Author: Barrheadtravelhater
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great as was cruise but BEWARE Barrhead Travel. We had to change at Heathrow and on return they only allowed us 45 minutes to land on hard standing at terminal 3 which meant we had to wait for a bus into terminal 3, get through passport control. pick up our luggage and get through customs, THEN get over to terminal 5 for flight to Glasgow. Not surprisingly we didn't make it and had to pay an extra Â£160 to get home. Barrhead Travel deny liability and wouldn't refund us!! We are pensioners and this was supposed to be a once in a lifetime. Certainly was!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location.”
Reviews.Author: alex1012hearts
Reviews.Content: After spending an awful night in South Beach at Hotel Riviere, this place was like heaven. We were on the 14th floor, city view. There is parking but it's $28. Seriously, if you want to visit South Beach and want to avoid all the drunks and the noise this is the place to stay. It's a 9 minute drive across the bay and it's actually quiet. The pool area is great, although it was very windy that day. We sat on the adjacent patio, where they let you have drinks without putting them in plastic cups. The bartender was a bit aloof, but whatever. The pool area is also a great place to watch the sunset. The valet parking guys were funny. My only complaint is that we asked if there is a better restaurant to go to in Miami instead of South Beach and they sent us to the most expensive, yuppiest place - Oceanara. We paid $177 + tip for 3 appetizers and a bottle of wine. Plus the place was comatouse. I really wish we had gone back to South Beach that night. Oh yeah, and you have to pay to use the internet here - boo. Bottom line - I plan to come back to Miami and stay at this hotel when the weather is warmer and now that I know where to go.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Close to Cruise Port”
Reviews.Author: Lovebug87
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel for a "half way" room between our flight to fort lauderdale and hoping on our cruise out of the port of miami. The room was very spacious and it had a pretty view of the water and the port area. We got to see our ship come into port. :) Go out downtown to the market it is really neat. Bubba Gump Shrimp is there. Talk to the bell boy at the hilton he knows a lot of languages i think around 10... and he is incredibly helpful. Take the monorail it is fun :) The hotel has a really nice pool and sunning area as well. We stayed there for half a day in the wonderful Miami Sun The service with drinks on the patio was very slow... not too sure why , and food was a little expensive... but it is miami and it is a hilton hotel. Very nice hotel. I recommend it for business people or for cruisers! If we ever go on another cruise out of Miami, this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - fabulous views”
Reviews.Author: cadaques12
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel not far from all the sights of Miami. It is right next to the Metro Mover (the free overground metro which loops the city for FREE) and the bus station. It is very clean and the staff are incredibly friendly. The rooms were spacious and very well maintained. The TVs were ancient though - so old the screen was green - but we were never in! The best thing about this hotel is the view. Our rooms were on the tenth floor and we had views of the bay, over to South Beach and of downtown. Morning and evening we were mesmerised by the view. You could always see the huge cruise liners when they came into dock. We had breakfast one day - it was average ...... but there are limited choices in the area.... we went downtown for great brekkies! It is only about 20 min walk to downtown - wonderful. We went to a show at the arts centre across the road - awesome! All in all a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay over Super Bowl”
Reviews.Author: SpineyNorman
Reviews.Content: I had great difficulty getting a room in Miami as it was Super Bowl week end and so used some HHonors points to stay here. I was delighted to be upgraded to Executive Level something I don't think Starwood or IC Hotels do when using points. The hotel was full and jumping with lively but good natured Colts fans and had a fantastic atmosphere. In spite of everything, the hotel coped very well and it was great - food, staff, room, lounge all excellent. Being downtown the hotel is a bit lacking in local amenities. Bayside Plaza is a short taxi ride away which is a lot of fun especially on Super Bowl week end and the Metromover is just a block away which gives access to Metrorail. This will get you to Dadeland Mall, a good place for shopping and gifts to take home.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing in Miami”
Reviews.Author: relaxingexperience
Reviews.Content: we enjoy this property.The staff is friendly specially the bellstaff and front desk.The room was clean good amenities and view of Miami was worth the price.we will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Just an ok stay - needs updating!”
Reviews.Author: jtx4
Reviews.Content: I was in Miami for work and booked at the Hilton Downtown. Upon check-in, I was pleased to hear that I'd been upgraded to a Junior Suite because of being a Diamond Hilton member. To my disappointment, my stay wasn't all I'd hoped for. I had some issues with the sink and toilet in the bathroom, which I asked to have repaired twice. The sink was eventually fixed, but the toilet was broken during my entire stay. I was also disappointed that the rooms have not been updated in quite some time. The television was a mammoth of a thing, clearly from the 1990s. The picture quality was bad and the remote was so worn that all the numbers were rubbed off the buttons! Finally, I was disappointed to find that the kitchen closes at 10pm, even on busy weekend nights. I was there over the Super Bowl weekend (when the hotel was completely sold out) and was extremely frustrated that at 11pm my only option for food was to walk to the Checkers across the street. I would think that when the hotel is expecting a massive group of people, they would extend their dining hours.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for short stay before cruise”
Reviews.Author: vqsparklejoy
Reviews.Content: Booked thru Priceline for 3 star Downtown location, and was very pleased with Hilton Downtown Miami. Lobby was one level up, but I rather liked that part considering the neighborhood. We did not get the downtown or port view, but considering that I only paid $51/night, that was understandable. We walked to the bus station (which is about a block) and took a bus #120 directly to South Beach for $2 each/ each way. We also used the free metromover (located beside the bus station) to go to Bayside Shopping. The room was large. The pool area was clean. Taxis are always at the hotel, or across the street.

Reviews.Title: “How did they get the pricing so wrong?”
Reviews.Author: pungpui
Reviews.Content: Hilton International hotels are typically your luxury 5-star brand that oozes style and class everywhere, particularly in Asia. In America, however, they are really just a 4-star hotel chain (e.g. Hilton Anaheim, how is that called anything more than 4 star?) as is Sheraton and Marriott. So, after reading the reviews on this website, and after looking at candid photos, we were pretty much prepared for the same thing; a 4-star hotel chain. And thatâ€™s exactly what we got! Upon arrival, the hotel is right outside a drive-thru diner where the cops like to hang out. Itâ€™s not a visually appealing area at all, and in fact, the hotel lobby is 1 floor above the street level (what the?). On the lobby level, registration desks and a souvenir store that looked like it has remained in the 80â€™s sits with the restaurant, bar, and access to the pool (how can the guest be expected to go through the hotel bar to the pool area??). This hotel is another one that has been built in the 70s/80s and has had a renovation to try and keep up with the times, but really looks like a refurbished old hotel. The design of it shows that! We had 2 rooms on the 3rd floor and upon entry, the first thing that hit me was the sheer ugliness of the view. It is literally a large white roof from the building next door. The only thing that could have made it worse was old rotting air conditioning units. After closing the drapes to avoid more eye sores, the rooms are relatively spacious with 2 double Hilton Serenity beds, a coffee percolator machine with take-away cups (which seems to be the standard in US hotels) and a toilet which looks like it missed the renovation and also remains in the 70â€™s. Whoever designed the toilet roll holder was an idiot, which is so far from the toilet you need to stretch toward the sink to get it. Once you tear toilet paper off and let it fall, the roll falls to the ground and soaks up water from the floor which had not drained properly. What the!?! The room also does not have a room safe, and for some reason had an iron, but no ironing board. The air conditioning was also a hit and miss â€“ our room was at a good temperature, but right next door it was constantly hot which meant turning up the air conditioning so that it was so noisy and smelt damp that you couldnâ€™t really sleep properly, no matter what kind of Serenity bed you put there. Breakfast in the restaurant was quite limited, but I guess quite standard for an American hotel. What I completely disagree with at this hotel is the automatic gratuities charge of 18%, both at the bar and hotel. How can a gratuity be automatic!? It means the staff know theyâ€™re getting this amount, so they can just slack off. Our waiter cleared our plates once (in a buffet!) and still expected the 18% - complete rip off! Check-in staff were quite brief and pretentious. Nothing like the welcoming concierge who helped us with tours and activities to do. As a business hotel, it has a very good location, being a brisk 1 minute walk to Miamiâ€™s free tram system, while South Beach is about a $10 cab fare away, and Port of Miami is well within sight of the hotel. Itâ€™s also a 5-10 minute walk to Bayview Shopping Centre â€“ if you can stand the Florida sun! We also ventured to Dolphin Mall during our stay which the hotel recommends a $10 return trip bus shuttle. Beware, however, that the Hilton is one of the last hotel stops to the mall, and when we tried to get on, it was completely full. We had to then fork out $40 each way for a taxi. All up, the stay did not exceed nor went below our expectations. If you expect a 70â€™s/80â€™s style hotel which has new beds, then youâ€™re pretty much spot on. Probably next time would look at a newer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful downtown Miami Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lookingforward44
Reviews.Content: Excellent services clean and spacious rooms with great view of downtown Miami.Bar off lobby is a great hotel bar.We were given a bottle of champagne for our anniversary.The staff was very accommodating always smiling and engaging in conversation. We are looking forward to returning.We highly recommend this Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel has no heating system and our room had no hot water.”
Reviews.Author: kataslater
Reviews.Content: The hotel website clearly states that the rooms are equipped with both air conditioning AND heat. This is untrue, but the hotel staff failed to mention this until we were four room changes into our stay. When it was finally established that the hotel had NO heating system, we tried to settle into our freezing room... only to find that there was no hot water. We changed rooms again. And again. Finally, we settled for the last room. This room had warm water for part of our stay and cold water for the rest. When we complained about the state of our room, the person at the front desk assured us that our first night would be comped. When we checked out, we were told that because we had booked through Hotwire, this would not be possible. So, we came to Florida to be warm, and while we can't blame the record cold temperatures on the hotel or the staff, we CAN blame them for a miserably cold room, a cold shower, and an unapologetic staff, armed with nothing but lies about how they would resolve our problems. I am so disappointed. I thought that Hilton stood for quality and service, but I have been proven wrong. As a frequent traveler, I am constantly booking rooms and talking to people about my experience. I will never recommend a Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “YUCK- This Hilton is a tourist mill for the cruise ships”
Reviews.Author: Andriegel
Reviews.Content: I stay in hotels 60-90 nights a year, so I have a pretty good perspective on how a proper hotel is run.... this is not a well-run hotel. They cater to the cruise passengers coming and going, so they have a real slam-and-jam attitiude knowing that you probably won't ever return...so why should they care? The cleaning staff were very ineffective- fingerprints, stains, crumbs, and hairpins were there to greet us when we arrived. (And this was an upgraded suite because I brought 80 associates for meetings all week.) *In spite of claiming "renovations", this hotel was merely painted and carpeted...it's still a 70's building with loud AC units and tired infrastructure. To exit to street level from your room, you have to take a slow and old elevator to the lobby and then yet another slow elevator to the "Motor Lobby" *Most staff are very slow and apathetic *Food quality is poor: a lot of the food is pre-packaged or not prepared on site, and the coffee is made from coffee concentrate, not really brewed coffee. *Internet in sleeping rooms very slow *Cable TV has a lot of channels, but watching it on the 15 year old TV (I thought they said they renovated?!) was problematic with static and bleed-over from the music channels. *There is no security mechinism in place to stop bums, hustlers, and pizza advertisers from wandering the hallways *The restaurant forces an 18% gratuity.... no incentive to provide good service. When we ate lunch on Saturday afternoon, we had to listen to three staff members talk about hair styles, extensions, and color treatments.... very inappropriate. Summary: It's tough to get good service and accomodations in Miami AT ANY PRICE, but you would do better to search elsewhwere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gap907
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 days before our cruise out of Miami. The hotel seemed renovated and it was clean and beautiful. We had a room on the 14th floor overlooking downtown Miami. The view was amazing. The room itself was huge compared to other hotels I've stayed at. The only negative would be that they didn't come to make our beds or clean the room, but that didn't ruin our stay at the Hilton. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a hotel close to the Miami port and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible. Never going back.”
Reviews.Author: serious2
Reviews.Content: When we entered our hotel room, the tables were dirty, along with the floor. The shower curtain did not have any rings on the shower curtain and the the curtain was covering half the bathtub (it was ripped). The water was not even going through in the sink or the bathtub. They have serious plumbing issues. The tables had something sticky all over them. We had to call the hotel management at 12 am to get the water to go through. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. It was horibble. Please do not book it.

Reviews.Title: “great pre cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: dalm0m
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the night before our cruise. It was perfect for that. Many other guests were doing the same thing because it is a bit tough to get an elevator on Sunday. Tip: push the up button & go for a ride. You will not get on a down elevator. We stored our bags & explored the city Sunday morning to be behind all those people who had to be the 1st ones on board. The lobby & public rooms are beautiful. They have generous high ceilings & magnificent foliage. The staff is gracious & truly works as a team. After a horrible flight down the guy at the front desk was so nice, even after I bit his head off. I didnâ€™t mean to but our travel day had been the worst. I immediately apologized after the words left my mouth. He sympathized & offered to upgrade our room. I donâ€™t know if he did or not but we had a bit of a water view & a comfortable room. Since we booked on priceline & paid about 10% of the price listed on the door, I was thrilled. The HVAC system was noisy so we just shut it off. I would have liked a little heat; we were there during the cold snap. The hotel was HQ for the Iowa University Alumni Association while we were there & filled with fans in town for the Orange Bowl. Except at the lobby bar & while trying to get an elevator on Sunday morning, the place could have been empty. It really is well designed. The restaurant had good sandwiches although we didnâ€™t care for the dÃ©cor. They must have gotten slammed with unexpected diners due to the cold or something because the host and the managers were running food. To me it truly showed team work. I was a bit disappointed that the rooftop pool was above the parking garage rather than on the 21st floor but it was only in the 50s. The hotel is near a metro mover which we used for a â€œfreeâ€� tour of the city. Although we saw some homeless people on the train they didnâ€™t bother anybody. Downtown Miami really is a ghost town on the weekend; it looked like one of those sci fi bombs that kill all the people & left the buildings was detonated. There are 2 fast food restaurants across the street from the hotel but there wasnâ€™t anything else visible in the area. We went over to Brickel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, pricy as everything in Miami...”
Reviews.Author: ArieLu
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at Hilton dowtown after a terrible experience in South Beach, at "Suites on South Beach". Weather was terrible, never so cold in Miami since 1930. We had a wonderful room at 20th floor with 2 walls of windows, overlooking the city. There was a problem with heating system, but it seems it was the first time ever they need it... Anyway the staff had been wonderful and tried immediatly to fix it. Valet parking was very pricy ($ 28) but very efficient. Internet connection free in the lobby, pricy in the rooms, breakfast not included. Nice swimming pool, even if not tried having 32Â°F. The hotel formerly was a Radisson and the struistoric Hilton are better. Heating quite noisy. Anyway if you have a car it takes 3 minutes to go to South Beach and it is better spend money for a good hotel in downtown compared to a fake design hotel in SOBE. Try taptap haitian restaurant for dinner, wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “an average hotel in a not so save neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: webomen
Reviews.Content: I liked the comfort of the beds, the flow of water in the shower, and the helpfulness of the staff, but that is pretty much it. Aside from the convenient location to the MetroMover, which was all we needed to get to the bayside station. The hotel needs to seriously upgrade its rooms to be in par with other establishments. It lacks a new television sets. Switching between channels was quite dreadful; the volume was vastly different for every other station. The room was a bit dusty and the coffee station did not have stir sticks. In addition, it did not enough tea bags for two people. With the absents of bath towels in our room, especially after haven already taking a shower, made the experience of drying off a difficult challenge. The area is not safe to walk around with panhandlers lurking around, if the burger king needs security at night, this is a clear indication that you better stay inside and order in. We witnessed an arrest by hotel security staff after a man refused to leave the motor lobby. Btw, when you arrive at the hotel, it is quite confusing where the check in is located (2nd floor). In this case, I would suggest more signage for those arriving at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hilton Property in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Hosalito
Reviews.Content: We just returned from his hotel having stayed 2 nights. Here are some observations that may be of assistance to you. LOCATION: If you are attending an event at the Miami Arena, this is a great location. It's within walking distance and the neighborhood isn't so scary that you are afraid to make the trek. There are plenty of places to grab meals within walking distance as well. ROOMS: The room was fantastic. We paid the extra $5 upon booking in the hopes to be upgraded to a bay view room when we checked in and our request was honored. The room was on the top (21st) floor with spectacular views of the bay and of downtown Miami. The bathroom had a nice granite countertop as well as the rounded shower curtain for more room. My only complaint is that the water would intermittently shut off while you were showering, which made for an interesting experience at one point when I had soap on my face! Eventually (within a minute) the water sputtered back on but it happened to my husband as well so the hotel must have a water management issue. The bed was very comfy and there was a desk w/ chair and also a nice arm chair in the corner. The TV was not a flat panel but worked just fine. May I add here that our room was very close to the elevators yet we rarely heard anything - proof of good sound insulation! FOOD/AMENITIES: The concierge was fantastic. It was my husband's birthday and the gentleman, David, helped me to arrange a delivery of strawberries and champagne to the room, which was greatly appreciated. We tried room service one day for breakfast and it did leave a bit to be desired (for the price especially). I would suggest going out for breakfast if you can swing it. The bar at the hotel is quite nice and it open until midnight. It has TVs in it so you can watch the game. There is a pool bar which our friends utilized and said the frozen drinks were amazing. My only complaint would be the steep price for parking - $28/day. I had read on here on a previous review that there was garage-style parking a block or two up but we were unable to find this and had to park at the hotel. Valet was very quick though, which was nice. I would definitely stay here again as well as recommend this place to any friends/family.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, satisfied with our stay”
Reviews.Author: verywellthen
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a $20 cab ride from Miami International Airport, which was well worth it considering the hotel's daily parking fee. Once we arrived, we had to take an elevator from the "Motor Lobby" to the "Lobby" area. Check-in was easy. The person at the front desk acknowledged our request for non-down pillows, but failed to mention that the comforter was down-filled. The lobby and lounge areas are clean and nicely decorated. The rooms themselves are not bad, although upon a closer look, there were many touch-ups done or needed. We had a nice view from the 14th floor. Our room was across from the ice/soda machine so that was sometimes noisy. While the A/C is somewhat noisy when turning on and off, all in all it didn't really bother us. One thing that we did notice, and which others mentioned on this site, is the fact that the toilet paper roll is very difficult to reach from the toilet. One could easily hurt their back or even fall off the toilet while trying to reach it! The overhead shower worked, but the valve between it and the main tub faucet leaked, so a lot of water ran directly in the tub even while the overhead shower was running. The TV is rather old. Our complaint was the volume difference from channel to channel. Sometimes it was so loud, or their was a humming sound requiring us to change the channel quickly or mute the TV. We called the front desk on several occasions to ask a question or to get something for our room. When they did answer they were very pleasant and accommodating, but there were several times when the phone rang and rang with no answer. Once someone at the front desk connected us to housekeeping and we got their answering machine! One final complaint, the need to take the elevator from the room to the lobby, and then take another elevator to the motor lobby is an inconvenience. While we were there on New Year's Eve this became an outright challenge with many people coming and going. At times when the hotel was "quiet" it was more of a nuisance than a real issue. On the positive side, we ate once in the bar/lounge area and the food was decent. We used the wireless internet access in the lobby areas as well vs. paying 9.95 in the room. The Bayside Marina is about a 10-15 minute walk with many options for food, sightseeing. There's also a few fast food places across the street from the hotel. Cabs were waiting to take us to the airport as early as 6am the day of our departure. We were able to check-out by calling the front desk and leaving our keys in the room. All in all we were satisfied with our stay and thought it was worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: CLHughes
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for 1 night prior to our cruise. We bid for rooms in downtown Miami on Priceline and were very pleased with the price and hotel selection. The Hilton is conveniently located near Bayside Marketplace and the cruise terminals. Upon check-in, all of our requests for room locations and bedding were met. The Front Desk staff was extremely friendly and efficient. The rooms are large and well maintained. The floor to ceiling windows provided a panoramic view of downtown Miami. Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries and Lavassa in-room coffee makers were an added touch. The TV's do, however, need to be upgraded to flat screen. We did not find the elevators to be slow as others mentioned. As for the A/C noise, many other older Florida hotels suffer the fate of a noisy in-room unit. I guess we just don't pay attention to it. Had pre-dinner cocktails in the bar and the drink prices were very reasonable. Breakfast in the morning was either buffet or menu. We chose the latter, having a delicious vegetable egg white omelet. The only negative we could find was the issue of parking. $28.00 per day for hotel parking is OUTRAGEOUS!!!! But all of the surrounding hotels (Hyatt, Biscayne Marriott, Intercontinental) all charge basically the same price. For cruisers, there is a Walgreens 3/4 north of the hotel on Biscayne Blvd. Our friends needed to pick up a few things, so we walked off our breakfast. All in all, a great pre-cruise hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and a great hotel Manager !”
Reviews.Author: AParadis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel during the Art Basel miami art Fair, a busy time of the year in Miami...This hotel was just great ! Smiling and helpful employees, a very nice pool, clean rooms, waht to say more? Well the Manager M. Hendrix was very nice to accomodate me since I had reserved for the wrong nights on internet, he managed to find me a nice room for my last day at no extra cost and with a smile. I will be back at this hotel on my next stay in Miami !

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and rooms - but problems with AC, and some cleaning issues”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveller2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in early Dec for a conference, with conf rate of $159/night. Some others at my conf claimed they got 1/2 this rate from hilton website with prepay. I called ahead and asked for a quiet room - they put me in a lovely corner room that was indeed very quiet. It had only a small view as it was on the 5th floor. The problem with the room was upon checkin, the AC did not work. It was 80 and humid in Miami so this was a problem. Fortunately it turned out to be a valve that was not open in the unit and the engineer fixed it within 5 minutes. That said, there were continued AC problems throughout the hotel. The fitness center was warm. The thermostat said 77 degrees and it was in a locked clear plastic box. I called downstairs and asked them to turn it down because with the humidity it was uncomfortable and they told me that the fitness center AC was out and they had problems all week and it was still not fixed so I would have to live with it. The conf I attended was on the ballroom level and we had continual HVAC problems throughout the week. One main room in particular was fluctuating between sweltering and freezing. They could not seem to get it to maintain a reasonable temperature. Outside of HVAC issues, there are some real pluses and minuses with this hotel. My room was not really cleaned all that well - some details like the coffee mug had coffee stains on it. One end table was visibly covered in dust. Several things like that were below the level of what I expect for Hilton however there was nothing really troubling. Really it was at the level of attention to detail rather than marked problems with cleaning. Little things like they did not replenish my in room coffee one day. Another day they did not leave me a bath mat in the bathroom and only left me with one bar of soap. Regarding room service/restaurants. I ordered breakfast room service twice. The first time they made a mistake with my coffee - I ordered a pot of decaf and it came as regular. I know this only because I prodded the delivery guy that it absolutely had to be decaf. Fortunately he checked on it and found out it was not - and they phoned me in my room and said "do not drink the coffee - it is not decaf" and they came up with a regular pot. If I had not persisted to ask about it I would have had a nice pot of regular coffee which would have created some medical issues for me later on during the day. Another inconsistency - I ordered identical breakfasts both days. The bill was about $6 different however. The second and more expensive time the breakfast came with a large dish of berries rather than a small dish. But there is one item on the menu that I asked for so I did not understand it but I also did not care enough to follow up on this. Despite the inconsistencies the room svc breakfast was very good. In fact the regular coffee was quite good - better than the decaf, but unfortunately I could not drink the regular coffee except for a couple of sips before they phoned my room. Twice I had meals in the restaurant. One day during lunch they had a buffet. It was mediocre but also certainly a passable lunch. $15 including gratuity. The second day they did not have the buffet so I ordered a sandwich off of the menu. It was very nice. Note that for restaurant and bar even for one person they automatically add 18% gratuity, something I had not seen before in the US. They also have a very elegant bar right around the corner from the lobby. This is one of the high points of the hotel and I highly recommend the bar. You can get drinks or order food off of the bar menu. They are a little slow with the check but it is a great bar for conducting business conversations. I had several such meetings in the bar. I also got some free drinks. One night I met friends and I ordered a gingerale. I asked the guy if he wanted me to pay for it and he said no that was OK. So I gave him a small tip which made him very happy. Another day I ordered lunch with a friend and we were there for hours talking and never got a bill. Finally I left and told the front desk we never got a bill in the bar - they went and found the bill for us. I don't think this is a huge problem. At best you end up getting stuff for free and at worst you wait a little but. The front desk/concierge can help with that. Another comment - the hotel seems to be in the flight path of MIA airport. It is not a big hardship but if you are out by the pool you get some lovely views of the bottoms of jets as they pass overhead. They are pretty close. It did not bother me - I found it rather fun actually, but some may not like that. I had no problems with noise in my room from planes at night and I had two walls of floor/ceiling windows. The pool is pretty and has a small bar and beach towels. Not so many people were using the pool when I was there. It is on the lobby level. Regarding location - the hotel is not on the beach. You have to drive 10-15 minutes to get to south beach. Easy drive if you have a car, or the hotel can order a taxi. It's also a similar distance to MIA. There is not much around the hotel (other than another hotel) so if you want to go out for dinner you need to take a taxi, but as I said the places are close. Overall, I liked the hotel but had some concerns. I would certainly consider it again if I were coming to Miami but given the large number of hotels I would also look around to see what else is available. I did inquire about at least one other property this time around but they were considerably more than my conference rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linnea68
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms. All new and complete. Kind service. Lovely breakfast. Very comfortable. Free wi-fi. Free shuttle service. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great room, bad loungeI”
Reviews.Author: kerwriter
Reviews.Content: overall, we are very happy with this hotel. We have a great room, spectacular view. However, we have sought a bit of relaxation in the lounge both nights we have been here. Both nights the same three staff members have been on duty. They seem to have no idea how to run a bar. The service is unbelievably slow. On both nghts we have waited for 20 minutes or more for our drinks. On both nights my husband has had to get up and deliver our orders directly to the bartender. The first night our food orders took forever and tonight I never got my slice of pie and our second round of drinks never arrived. We gave up, paid for the drinks we had and retreated to our comfortable room. We go out and we travel a lot - this service was just plain bizarre.

Reviews.Title: “Compares favorably with other Bus. hotels in area.”
Reviews.Author: loge54
Reviews.Content: Regular Miami traveller here. First time for the Hilton Downtown. The hotel room is well-appointed, clean, and contains the new amenities at Hilton - Lavazza in-room coffee, thick towels, and comfortable bedding. The A/C, as mentioned elsewhere here, is very loud. Can't hear the old-style TV (?) when it comes on. The location is less than optimal - the northern edge of Downtown. I wouldn't venture by foot very far here after dark - not there's much around. There is a couple of small restaurants two blocks north on Biscayne worth a try: Bin 18 and a Sushi bar. Pretty safe if you stay on Biscayne. Also a salad place and sandwich shop just past 19th St (hotel is on 16th). Have not tried the hotel offerings yet. Parking is absurd. $28 in this economy?? You have to be kidding!
