Indoor Park a block and a half away just off 2nd Ave and 14th St. on your left. You'll see the signs - much, much less expensive. All in all, not bad if you can figure out the parking. Compares well to the Hyatt in the room, although the Hyatt personal service is superior.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Firegal773
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice but there were some hidden costs that should be noted. They charge for self parking and valet per night and internet is only free in certain public areas.

Reviews.Title: “Good Property, Service & Rate”
Reviews.Author: 007CubsFan
Reviews.Content: I decided to go to Jam @ the MAM here in downtown and I knew that I would be drinking so I decided to be responsible and get a room so I could enjoy the drink and be safe. I checked in and entered my room on the 20th floor. Nice view of the bay. Nice room, not too big yet big enough to enjoy. Nice, comfy bed. I could easily get into bed and never get out of it!! The internet is free for HHonors members (so sign up). Its next to the metromover so its easy to get around downtown. There was a nice, heated pool, front desk staff were great (especially Frank), and everything has been neat and clean. The rate was under $100 so that is a big plus too. Only for a night but I would certainly return anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: talkshowsonmute
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hilton Downtown Miami was nothing short of perfect. The staff were very friendly from the moment we reached there to the moment we left. I have never come across such friendly staff! We arrived there after a very long flight from Ireland and we were delighted to have such a fast check in and such friendly service. Our room was very comfortable and had a amazing view of the city and of the bay. Definitely worth the money. The breakfast buffet was quiet nice. There was one occasion in which we ordered from the menu, sadly it was a little disappointing because it was overcooked but we were taken care of almost immediately when we complained. The hotel is close to everything. All you need to do is hop on the bus or metromover which is almost outside the door! So it is impossible to complain about that! There were always taxi's at the hotel also that could bring us on a five minute trip to the beach!! Fantastic hotel, keep it up! We will be back for sure. Thanks for a great stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “NO WATER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ors63
Reviews.Content: Checked in late last night after a red-eye from California only to find that there was no running water in my room! Had to check out...was lucky enough to find a Marriott next door.

Reviews.Title: “The complete package!”
Reviews.Author: youdontgetit
Reviews.Content: I too saw a number of marginal comments however I stayed at the hotel in the begining of October. I was on the 8th floor. The view was inrcedible. Folks, I travel often and certainly know the difference between hiding quality service and providing quality service. If you are not the type of person who is trying to find something wrong, you will love this place. It is in downtown so you have to cab or drive to Miami beach but you know that upon reservation. I suggest the cab. It cost me 6.00 one way. 10.00 after the tip. So for 20.00 you get a safe way to and from the SOBE area. The rooms are clean and truly comfortable. The complaints you see are not accurate. Now, if you are a person who can find something wrong at any hotel than do not stay here. Because you will complain that the elevators are slow....that the elevators are warm....It will always be something and frankly you would complain if you were given the room for free. If you are complaining about anything in your room, get a life. You are in Miami. Get out and see the beach and the nitelife!!!! Overall, great place, great hotel, great staff. The total package!!!

Reviews.Title: “There are better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tbrains
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Miami Hilton for a conference he was attending. Not a terrible place, but I have to say that I've stayed in nicer places that are less expensive. For me, it's the little details that make a hotel worth the money, and the Hilton just doesn't have the attention to detail that a hotel of its caliber should. First, the toilet paper holder is 2.5 ft. away from the toilet - I kid you not. You almost fall off of the toilet trying to get it. Second, my husband and I are both businesspeople, and to get wireless internet in our room, we were EACH charged $9.99 a day, even though their materials all say "wireless internet in your room for only $9.99 a day." What they should say is per computer. Maybe other hotels do this, too, but I haven't experienced it. I'm sleeping in the bed with my husband. Will I be charged extra for that? Third, the entire hotel is a little run down. I'd suggest Hilton put a few dollars into a rehab. Soon. Last, the food is mediocre at best and overpriced as all hotel food is. Breakfast was cold, room service was OK. As I'm writing this review, we've been without water - the entire hotel - for more than 3 hours. Now, I don't expect Hilton to be able to control emergencies like this, but I mention it only as another point of frustration with this place. In a city like Miami, I'm sure there are better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “CANT FIND ANYTHING TO EAT AFTER 23H00!!”
Reviews.Author: Huaso111
Reviews.Content: IÂ´ve stayed twice during the same week, so I used two different rooms. In general, it is a nice hotel but I find unacceptable they close the bar and the kitchen at 23H00. There is no room service and the solution they gave me was to order a pizza from a nearby place. Incredible!!! If you come with your car, donÂ´t forget to use the Valet Parking service. It costs the same as the parking besides the Hotel )$25 day) but you can come in and out anytime you like. On the other parking you pay $6 hour anytime you come and go!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: barisingerIllinois
Reviews.Content: We traveled with two other couples and stayed here the night before a cruise. We ended up with a corner 12th floor room with terrific views on two sides for $69. Staff was very welcoming and helpful and we all had a great time that evening at the roof-top pool. Will plan to stay again when we visit Miami.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: zoach
Reviews.Content: stayed for 10 nights couldnt fought anything only parking cost a lot . no shops nearby only burgerking breakfast was espensive and not very nice only tried the once pool area was very nice .happy hour was from 5-7 lovely margaritas

Reviews.Title: “All you expect”
Reviews.Author: holub78
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean hotel with great view. I enjoyed staying here but I don't understand why there isn't free internet like in all other hotels I stayed in during my 3-week vacation. Free internet is available only in lobby downstairs and if you want internet in your room, you have to pay for it. That's a big MINUS. If you have a car, you have choice of vallet parking or self parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great service all around”
Reviews.Author: ecbin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the last day of my 2 week trip in Florida and this was the best of the 6 places I stayed - better than the EPIC hotel down the street. Fernando at the front desk made me feel like a welcome guest while David the concierge provided great recommendations for dinner in South Beach (and was a hoot to talk to). Room service breakfast was terrific (timely, delicious and it came with a rolling table). The only 2 things I would change would be making new TVs with HD programming available (I had a very old 27" CRT) and providing free wireless internet in the rooms and not just on the lobby floor. Otherwise I had a terrific time - the service was fantastic and the room was very nice (I had a corner with views both north and east).

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: W0rldTraveler001
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in this hotel because of the rates and the Hilton name but now i know the not all Hiltons are good, first thing that happened to us was one morning i had to go out for a couple of hours so my wife ordered room service for her and my 2 year old son, it took around 45 min. to bring the food and when my wife opened the yogurt to feed my son she noticed a bad smell and checked the expiration date it was expired a week ago, so she called room service and explained this but they only said sorry we will bring u a new one right away, 40 minutes after she called and ask what was going on, and they apologize again and said that they don't have any more blueberry yogurt would u like a different flavor?, that same day we were out all day and got back to the hotel at 10 pm. the little table,sofa and rug area where my son had breakfast was completely dirty full of bread remains, we were tired but didn't wanted to sleep in a dirty place so i went down to the front desk to ask them to come and clean my room immediately, i also mention to them about the morning incident, and the answer was that they were gonna talk to the restaurant manager to check all the yogurts, and that for the inconvenience they were gonna take care of the $40 breakfast. But what if my wife didn't check the expiration date an my baby got sick!. In general the cleanliness of the room was bad especially the toilet was completely dirty i don't think that in the 6 days that we were there the maid ever clean it. The Internet is only free if you go down to the lobby area,and the parking is expensive, $28 per day this is for valet parking, if you choose self parking is $25 a day but if u take the car out you have to pay $25 each time. The day i left the hotel i noticed that the car i rented was used by someone from the valet parking staff, they drove it 11 miles the night before, i always check the odometer i found out about this but couldn't say anything because i didn't have time,had to get to the fort lauderdale airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room for the Price”
Reviews.Author: sdrob
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night at this hotel as my wife and I prepared to fly out to the Caribbean the next day for an extended vacation. Check-in was easy, though its a little funky getting to the reception area as you have to take an elevator up a floor, but not a big deal. Had a great internet deal we found on hilton.com for the website, so we were able to stay there for under $65 a night. Room had a great city-view, it was clean, and everything worked properly. We wanted some firmer pillows and they brought them right up. They also gave us concierge access so a continental breakfast was available to us the next morning (not sure if it offered to everyone or to us because we were Hilton Honors members). Breakfast was typical continental, but good. We hung out by pool for a little bit in the morning as well, there were plenty of lounge chairs and pool was clean. They also had a business center with free internet access for guests, so we were able to check our flight info, which was a big help. Great value for the money we spent and not that far from airport. We'd stay there again w/o a 2nd thought.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Miami Downtown HIGHLY recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: VaSquashblossom79
Reviews.Content: We booked pre-cruise for two nighs and we were pleasantly surprised!! We had an awesome non-refundable internet rate (55$/night), the pool was excellent, the food and drinks were great and the staff exceptionally friendly and courteous, especially the poolside bar attendant. The only minor downfalls were the toilet in our room was slow to flush and the restaurant was overpriced, but the food was good. Will definately stay at the Hilton Miami Downtown on any future visits to Miami and will definately recommend this hotel to others!!

Reviews.Title: “What a View, central downtown & a bit of flair”
Reviews.Author: scbleo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an Omni and was taken over by Hilton. The location is excellent for those taking a cruise or wishing a place with a view. It is not really in a good spot for walking for everything is a cab ride away. The bell captain, Pedro Rodriguez greeted us with smiles and eager to get our bags. This was excellent, what a welcome, after that, oh well.... The arrival was rough, we had requested a junior 2-queen suite on a high floor with a 4pm checkin. We arrived around 3:40 and were advised we would need to return in about 30 minutes. No problem, since we were early and hungry. Went to eat, came back at 5:30. We were told the room was not ready yet but that it would be on the 12th floor with a great view. I would need to come back in 20 minutes. I said fine, since I wanted to make sure I would have a room with a view on a higher floor. 30 minutes later at 6:10, I am told the room was not ready yet by the front desk manager but if I did not want to wait, there was a room available on the 6th floor. No way, I would wait for the 12th floor. A very nice man who proceeded to give us 3 drinks (one for each of us) free at the bar. By then, I was not only thirsty but getting tired. I figured it was a one-nighter, might-as-well go with the flow. At 6:40, tired of waiting around and feeling happy hour, I walked straight to the front desk manager and finally got our room keys. In fact, the manager even remembered my name - I swear I was nice and gave them no negative reason. The wait, I hoped would be worth it. The bellman a really nice guy, brought our bags up and the room was cozy. The view of downtown, the rooftop pool, and the bayfront were priceless. The room is spacious, clean, and well designed. There is only one television but with the views, who needs a tv. The beds were wonderful. A negative might be that the sink, toilet and tub are all in one room, but updated and clean. We might consider this site again, but only if another is not available. It is a nice hotel but too disorganzied for our style. I would have enjoyed a swim, but without my checked in suitcase, I had to hang in the bar. The view was priceless but there are plenty of high-risers in Miami. I would recommend this for my cruising friends for the value, but the parking fees, internet fees, and wait are all things to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rinald0
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay. Everything works nice. Good staff, good bar and nice food, not expasive. I'll be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “SUBSTANDARD”
Reviews.Author: jeerytudman
Reviews.Content: This is the best word I can choose for this Hilton. I stayed at this Hilton because of the rates and the reputation it has with its name, along with the location, but was very disappointed. The water in the shower was weak, and would cut off every 20 seconds or so for about 4 seconds. The housekeeping would show up after 3pm and whiz through the room, vacuuming, making the bed, emptying the one small wastebasket in the bathroom, and not picking up any garbage I left next to it (which was in a plastic bag and tied neatly). They also did not replace the glasses, mat towel on more than one occasion and had to have them send it up to the room. On one occasion, they didn't vacuum at all...the Frito chips on the rug from the night before were still there! Internet: POOR. No free service unless you go to the lobby for wireless, only other option is a 9.95 rate for daily use of a slow throughput, sporadic connection. I called guest services and they comped me one day, transferred me to tech support which had me run a repair on my wireless connection, then ping Google, then told me there was nothing wrong on their end. Also, my laptop would pick up a wireless signal named "Free The WiFi" which was a third party offering connections to hotel guests for $35 for a week I believe, It was named Meraki and would offer different plans with different throughputs, the faster connections being the most expensive. When I looked them up, they would ask for a login name creation and your credit card number...YEAH Right!!! Not a whole lot of trust with that. Whoever offered this service must be aware of the fact that the Hilton charges for theirs. They have a business center in the lobby with about 8 terminals or so, which I went to use at 11pm but couldn't because a family with what seemed like there visitors (kids) were using them to watch Youtube. Valet service: $28 a day, unless you choose self parking which was $25 a day but if you take the car out you need to pay the $25 again....this in essence forced me to go with the valet. No qualms with the valet guys, they were great. The room itself was fine cosmetically, the view was great also, but the little things were what put me off. I've had better service (and free in-room internet) at the Marriott in Tarrytown, NY, and the Radisson in Harrisburg, PA...places which are far less exotic then Miami. Who knew? I won't rule out the Hilton because of this one, but it won't be my first choice going forward, and it won't be a choice at all at this locale ever. Shop around.

Reviews.Title: “It was simply...Perfect !”
Reviews.Author: ReviewBoi
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the mixed reviews, we decided to give the Hotel a chance, since there were more positive then negative. I'm very glad we did, as our 2 night stay (Friday / Saturday) was amazing. When we pulled up to the front of the hotel, we thought we may have the wrong place, as the price we paid (under $200 US total) did not match up to what was in front of our eyes. Beautiful hotel, really nice outdoor lounge area, modern art and friendly staff to assist with baggage, questions, etc. We were promptly checked-in (and an upgrade was automatically thrown in, which was nice) and directed to our room. When we entered the room, again our eyes opened wide with surprise at the beautiful, spacious, clean room with a great view. We walked to nice restarants, clubs, cafes within 15-20 mins and took a cab to the beach, which was approx 15 mins away and cost $15.00. Internet access is free in all main areas of the hotel. The pool is beautiful as well, but we didn't stay in the hotel that much to take advantage of it. Both Tory and Natalie (front desk staff) were AMAZING and should be promoted !! :)

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: mrrms658
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Miami Downtown with my husband and our friends. We had a standard room and the staff upgraded our room to a Jr. Suite because we were Hilton diamond members. The room was very clean and the beds were super comfortable. We had a great view of downtown miami. The fitness center at this hotel has amaizing equiptment to use. The concierge at the hotel was very informative and reccommend a great restaurant on South Beach. Over all we really enjoyed our stay. I would reccommend this hotel for those traveling in the Miami area.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT PRE/POST-CRUISE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: bogelbtk
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, especially for the price. I was skeptical of the quality because of the great rates. I was pleasantly surprised. Within 5 minutes of arriving, three different employees greeted and welcomed our family . First impressions count. Huge windows with great views. Extremely comfortable beds. Two fast food restaurants across the street. Even though we booked on a discount site, we felt like important guests. Gorgeous pool. We needed extra pillows and towels - to our room in 10 minutes with a smile. This hotel should definately be rated higher.

Reviews.Title: “funtriptomiami”
Reviews.Author: TampaJusthavingfun
Reviews.Content: My husband and friends stayed at the Hilton Miami Downtown for a week.We really enjoy this hotel.Our room was clean and comfortable.The pool is great if you enjoy swimming great drinks at the pool bar.Driveway staff was very friendley and polite. We had a great time.Parking is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “COUNT ME OUT”
Reviews.Author: msladie3
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton Miami Downtown. This was a horrible decision on my behalf. When I booked this hotel, I was told that it was close to everything, and it was in a great area. That was all a lie. I chose the Hilton because of the economical price offered at the time of reservation. Unfortunately this was a situation in which you pay for what you get. The hotel room was clean. That was about the only thing the hotel had going for it. The service was horrible. When I booked the hotel, I requested Bay View, two rooms that were connected and early check in. When I got to the hotel before check in. I was told that they were overstaffed and my room wasn't ready. They informed me that they could get me a room that wasn't bay view if I wanted to check into that one earlier. I really didn't want to do that because I had paid for a bay view room. So I waited and went and got something to eat to kill time. When I returned my room was ready about 30 minutes before 4:00. I had more than one room so I wanted them to connect or at least be on the same floor. We ended up getting two rooms on two different floors, and neither were bay view. The shower in my room which was room number 1025 kept cutting on and off. The water would come in and go out. The water pressure was very weak. The incidental fee is ridiculous, the fee is $50 per day per room. Yet, I only paid $50 for my whole stay per room due to the lack of not getting a bay view room. The beach isn't that far away from the hotel but if you have to take a taxi it WILL COST. I spent $100 alone in cab fees just going less than ten miles away back and forth. On the last day I was packing up my things to leave, and I noticed that my clothes were missing. I had went shopping at Aventura Mall and left my clothes in the room because I thought surely they would be safe there....Later I discovered that my clothes, had been stolen. It was a $200 loss for me. I did call security and they did come to my room to check everything out but all the bad memories of this hotel will never be forgotten. PLEASE DON'T STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Miami Sucks”
Reviews.Author: Grimwolf
Reviews.Content: Do not book at "The Hilton Hotel Miami Downtown" we had so much trouble with them its unreal. The service sucks we had nothing but problems Miami is a scary crappy place to be in, People are very rude, the taxi cabs tries to get more money out of you telling you that the meter says 17$ when it only says 10$ so you have to watch.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay...”
Reviews.Author: lmaclc37
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled with my family to Miami for vacation. We stayed at the Hilton for one night prior to boarding a Cruise Ship. The staff was very helpful and friendly, the rooms were great with a wonderful view of the city at night. My daughter loved the pool area and spent most of our time at the pool. The location of the hotel was not to our liking, it was in a ruff part of town. It was may understanding the night we stayed at the Hotel the local law enforcement worked a killing about one block from the Hotel..

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hospitable experience”
Reviews.Author: ggonzalez79
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the Hilton Miami Downtown with my Wife. The hospitality of the staff here was amaizing. We had no issues when we checked in and best of all our room was spectacular. The bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean. We had a wonderful view of the bay. I highly reccommend this hotel for anyone who travels in the Miami area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff - tropical style business hotel”
Reviews.Author: PRRecBooks
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night on business, enjoying the $89/night rate they were advertising on their web site. I would call this a four star hotel that's slightly rough around the edges. Tropical theme, colorful decor. All the staff members I encountered were more than friendly and attentive. Really, very hospitable. My first room was a bit noisy as it was across the hall from the vending machine, so they moved me, gladly, to the 18th floor. And they sent someone up to move me and didn't make me haul my luggage all the way downstairs again. Nice touch. The pool was fine, relaxing for downtown location. I had dinner outside in the nice Miami breeze. The ceviche was terrific. But the wines by the glass selections could be a bit more varied. Kendall Jackson and BV were about it. For such an international city I thought there would be more attention paid to international wines, but that's my thing so... Overall, nice place to stay if you are in town on business.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was terrific”
Reviews.Author: ppalacios
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a conference. The staff was incredible from the front dest to the bellman. The banquet food was great they were very creative. They just completed a renovation of the entire hotel and it looks great. I would definitely use this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel, service is excellent”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixPhoenix
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at this hotel for 2 days. The staff was extremely helpful and attentive. Guestroom was spacious and the bed was so nice, it was difficult to get up in the morning! Food during the meeting was very good. No missed wake up calls!

Reviews.Title: “A very good option for Downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: OnRoadAgn
Reviews.Content: During my recent stay in a corner jr. suite the views were wonderful!! Very spacious room and very good service. Meeting space was in good condition, staff very attentive and nice comfy lounge area for relaxing with associates. Concerige staff was very accommodating! Unfortunately it rained all week so I was able to enjoy the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Service Hilton Miami Downtown”
Reviews.Author: ttowne
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Miami Downown performed at a "10" for our May meeting. The hotel made sure we were well taken care of during our stay. The service during the meeting, in housekeeping, as well as the every other department was outstanding. I would recommend this hotel to all of my clients that are considering Miami as a destination.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to be near everything in Miami but not pay South Beach prices”
Reviews.Author: VenueFinder
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Hilton in downtown Miami for a company meeting and found the hotel to be of very good value for the price. The rooms were clean, well attended and most importantly, quiet from noise from other rooms or even the hallway. Absolutely no complaints about the food, had everything from room service to lunch and dinner at the hotel. Service was very good from bell staff, front desk and found it refreshing to see housekeepers say good morning or hello in the hallways. If you need to get to Coconut Grove, South Beach, U of M or anywhere on Brickell Ave, everything was very close and a short cab ride away....if you want to be near South Beach but don't want to pay SoBe hotel prices, this is a great alternative and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business and meetings”
Reviews.Author: jamstanjr
Reviews.Content: I was on a weeklong business trip and attended a training program. The hotel is very convenient to Enterprise Rental car and very easy to get to the airport and to the South Beach areas for business and fun. Cab ride to South Beach was $15. Beds were very comfortble with excellent creature comforts, towels pillows and bedding and I felt that it was a very comfortable sleeping room. Wireless internet access is $9.95 which isn't bad by most comparisons. The banquet food was fabulous and themed menus were creative and well presented. I loved the shrimp and crab claws. Nice pool area for catching some sun or for a late night swim.. I had a great burger and beer at the lobby bar upon arrival and felt like the staff was very friendly in all departments. I would definitely go back. Great meeting space adn overall a well managed Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, great job with new renovations, comfortable rooms, great meeting space”
Reviews.Author: jakesterOR
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Miami Downtown has completed a major renovation of the hotel. The lobby sparkles and is very spacious, with a "step-down" lobby bar. Friendly, helpful staff. Great meeting space, comfortable rooms. I would highly recommend this hotel for business meetings to my clients, and anyone else traveling to Miami and wanting to stay downtown. Great downtown location, across from the Performing Arts Theatre, and walking distance to the Bay and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Affordable Hotel in Miami”
Reviews.Author: PittsburghSeason
Reviews.Content: I had occasion to stay at the Hilton Miami in May and I have to say that it is one of the best downtown business properties that I have stayed at in a long time. The service was excellent, the room was beautiful and the meeting space was great. Their rates are also very reasonable for being a downtown property. I would recommend this property to anyone looking for a good deal @ a terrific hotel. They also have a free business center for all guests. You don't see that very often anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Most attentive Hotel I've ever stayed at in Miami”
Reviews.Author: jenn_jennCoronado_CA
Reviews.Content: We asked for Towels - 5 minutes later they were there We had room service - said it would take 25 minutes - was there in 15 We needed more pillows - there in 10 minutes Housekeeping was a pleasure and our room was always made up early. The value is terrific and attention makes it even more stellar. They Aim to please and have true hospitality -

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but not impressive”
Reviews.Author: ccutchins
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Hilton for a conference meeting and found the hotel in need of repair and rethinking. The hotel rooms were ok but there were small things that were annoying. For instance, one of the mattresses had a major sag on one side - impossible to sleep in. The shower curtain rod was broken and made a mess when you showered. The toilet paper holder was so far away from the toilet that even my 6'2" husband couldn't reach it. The television was pretty old & crappy as well - we had issue with sound quality. The hotel restaurant should be avoided if possible. The service was terrible but the food is edible. We had lunch there twice - the first day it took them 30 minutes to greet us and the 2nd time, it took 30 minutes to get our check. This might be ok if the restaurant was busy but there were never more than 6-7 other tables. The food does come out fast once you can snag a waiter. There were still dirty tables left from the breakfast and service trays were pile high with dirty plates. Maybe just a competent bus boy would solve their issues. The conference facilities were acceptable. However, they keep the rooms like a meat locker - I would estimate that the temperature was set at 58 in some of the rooms. I wore long pants, a sweater and scarf and was still quite cold. The location of the hotel was ok. It is fairly central - close to the airport, south beach, coral gables, etc but the downtown is completely desolate. Unless you want to eat fast food or at the hotel lobby - you have to take a $15 cab to get anywhere. Downtown is unsafe to walk around at night so walking is really out of the question.

Reviews.Title: “Not great but ok.”
Reviews.Author: hnybee09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in Sept 2008, on our way down to Key West. Got a great deal on the room through priceline. Room was great, very large corner room, nice flat panel TV, fridge, the 2 outer walls were basically floor to ceiling windows with amazing views. Service was good, nothing to complain about. Hotel is clean and nicely decorated. Now the things that ticked us off, and I know some of this isn't the fault of the hotel. When I booked the hotel, the hotel info said that parking was available, it was not stated that I would have to pay $28 to park, so when we went out for the day and came back $28, and when we left to go to Bayside $28, and then when we checked out another $28, now my great deal wasn't so great anymore. To further my aggravation, the hotel information stated that a continental breakfast buffet was included, however when we went down the dining area and got the kids some food and sat down to eat is when we were informed that the breakfast was not included, since we were already sitting and eating it was a little too late to get up and leave, add another $60 to the bill and my deal is now no deal. I could have spent less in the end and stayed somewhere else. I know that the hotel had recently changed ownership but they should have had the hotel information changed with the various booking agents.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional...had trouble @ check in, check out, and AFTER i arrived home!!”
Reviews.Author: bhsballa44
Reviews.Content: My debit card was charged over 10 times for 1 room! caused a hold to be placed on my card, had to cancel my debit card and order a new one! im all the way in miami from SC and im worrying if i will be able to get my spending money out of my account! luckily i was able to. I paid the hotel in cash at this point...i was put in a room with 2 beds instead of the 1 king size which is what i booked months prior to arriving. my shower water was cold 3 of the 4 nights! we ran out of tissue paper 1 night. wash clothes were not replaced daily, we had to request them @ the front desk! They charge $28/ day for valet parking, i paid $112 to the valet service in the motor lobby and @ check out they tried to charge me for an additional 2 days for valet. I had a $0 balance @ check out...they actually owed me $1 back. They didnt have $1 at the particular check out drawer i was @, and the employee had the nerve to tell me to just tip them the $1, after all of the problems they caused with my bank and overdrafting my account, and a cold shower for our entire stay! one week after my arrival back home to SC...they charged me once again for $700!! causing most of my paycheck to be drafted out of my account! not to mention it was the 1st of the month, my rent is due, cell phone, and car insurance and i have no paycheck thanks to the hilton!! the only thing i was pleased about during my stay was the view and the beds were comfy...i personally wouldnt recommend this hotel to anyone, even after all of the troubles they created for me...they made me feel as if i was an inconvience to them! not very helpful @ all. i was not the only one to have the same issues, i meet several people there for the same event that had the same issues...more than 35 people were charged more than once for one room! not to mention the 3 false fire drill alarms that caused people to run down 17 flights of stairs...there was an announcement 40 minutes later saying that it was only a drill!!!

Reviews.Title: “Double-charged!”
Reviews.Author: LynnDub82
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was great. Rooms were clean and the staff was nice except for the front desk clerk who double-charged me and my friend's credit cards. When we tried to get answers, he waved his hands in our face and dismissed us and told us to talk to someone else in the morning. But other than that, not a bad place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: NorfolkBillpayer
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay for 3 nights. We arrived rather late in the evening after a long trip from New York with a speedy and efficient check-in which was greatly appreciated. We found all the staff in the reception, bars, pool and restaurant to be friendly and extremely helpful. Our room was spacious, immaculately clean with spectacular views. The hotel is situated within minutes of the metromover and bus terminal. This hotel is ideally located for transfer to the cruise terminal and we would not hesitate to book again when hopefully we are next in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Get location for Pre-Crusie Hotel,”
Reviews.Author: JPTexan82
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel for a one night stay for a pre-cruise hotel. At the time of check in it was a Raddisson. It was needing some updateing at that time but not bad. Also the day we checked in George W. Bush was giving a speach in the conf center. It is sad to see the rest of the complex closed down. Its close to the monorail thing for the downtown to get to the outdoor mallOne thing I did like about the room was the View. I got up at 5:30 am to watch the ships come into port and the make the turn. We did use the pool, there is a Burger King across the street which is nice for breakfast. I booked 8 rooms all using hotwire and got a great rate. I would stay there again. p.s. I left a bag at the hotel and made sure it got on the shio for me, That was very nice

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel very goodservice”
Reviews.Author: ltravelor
Reviews.Content: really enjoy this hotel.Friendly staff also the room was clean and great view. The pool is great great drinks by the pool. Overall I enjoy it with my family.

Reviews.Title: “convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: jitendra04
Reviews.Content: convenient business hotel, with clean rooms and not so great food.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel but felt nickel and dimed...”
Reviews.Author: floridaboy22
Reviews.Content: We were in Miami for one night as I had an appointment at the nearby Bascom Palmer Eye Institute the next morning (and being that we are from Bradenton, we needed a hotel for the night.) We decided on the Hilton as it was nearby and we found a low rate. So we arrive at the hotel after a long drive(Alligator Alley was closed due to wildfires so we ended up taking US 41.) The first thing we realize is that the hotel charges for parking. It did not bother us at first but would be nice if they said so on the website. So we get to the room and it is really cold in the corridors and room (65 degrees is what the thermostat was set at in the room.) Not a big deal in the room as we just adjust the thermostat but in the corridors it was chillier than the room. So we settle in. The rooms were really nice. But the tv was a little let down, but no big deal. My mom (the other person with me) was upset that the fridge could not be used without having a charge added to the account(which most hotels do include so needless to say we were befuddled.) But we brought a cooler with us so we were not really concerned as it was only one night. The staff was very courteous and attentive to our every need. But this really felt like it was only accomodating the upper class with all the added fees...

Reviews.Title: “fabulous views from our room”
Reviews.Author: janneman10
Reviews.Content: We did a roundtrip in Florida and stayed here for two nights. Ask bayview and as high as possibele ! We has a great view over the bay (room 1416) The room was clean, large with a very comfortable bed. The sheets and pillows are excellent for a good night sleep. There is no fridge or in-room safe in the room. The bathroom is also really nice, here the towels smells like they should. We did valid parking (max 28 dollar a day), no problem checking in and out, they are fast. Also we tried the breakfast buffet, it was tastfull and complete (20 dollar p.p.) Only free high speed wireless internet in the lounge, not in the rooms (10 dollar extra charge in room) We booked the room by travelagent for 120 dollar, with the extra parking costs the price was still not bad at all. One of the best hotels during our holiday, if there is a next time, we book it again without any doubt . The location,down -town, was oke. There are just a few fast-food eateries near the entrance of the hotel. Things looked not so nice a few blocks further away, so we did not walked around the area. South beach is a 15 minutes drive. We also did some beaching on Key Biscane, loved it.

Reviews.Title: “We hated staying here”
Reviews.Author: apaul786
Reviews.Content: Fridge didnt work Staff was rude and all spanish speaking. Staff lied that the bus system of Miami was very difficult to use when in fact it was more inexpensive and a lot easier than getting around w/ a taxi. Room was small and boring. Pool sucked Cooling system was messed up (we could not control it) We stayed there 5 days and really got tired of it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not convenient to anything!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1Denver_Co
Reviews.Content: I won't restate what has been said in earlier reviews. This is a stay overnight for a cruise hotel. I am on business and an $8 cab ride to downtown. The hotel is not convenient to anything or anyplace. The hotel sorely lacks business services...no FedEx supplies and no one that even understands enough about business needs to ask about supplies. The one issue i must stress is do not--I repeat--do not take the overhead train cars to or from the hotel area after 6pm. Regardless of what you are told it is not safe for anyone. If you don't know the system you will go around in circles and the cars are invested with local hoodlums and drunks. There is no police presence...ever! Last night i took it back from Bayside and the car was filled with drunk teens that were looking for a fight. They don't get off they just ride in circles and look for trouble. There were two young girls on board that were terrified...I told them to get off the tram with me--they did and I put them in a cab to their hotel. I have been travelling to Miami for years and it just gets worse every year. The downtown is a ghost town except for a couple of hotels and Bayside. Do not wander off the main strip! One other note..the restaurant in the hotel is nice but the waiters are drenched in cologne so that is all you smell and taste. I complained to the "manager" and she told me that it was "their culture". Huh? So, if you are staying one night and then heading to the cruise terminal it is fine...anything more than that look at a more upscale place in a better area of town.

Reviews.Title: “Terrable Housekeeping Staff”
Reviews.Author: liensailor
Reviews.Content: Check in was very nice, after being in the room for sometime, my elderly mother in law reached under the pillow to discover a used " prophylactic" . Housekeeping came up and changed out the sheets, but the vision never went away. Upon inspecting our room, my wife found used empty shampoo bottles in the shower. The next morning the hotel manager was "unavailable" to speak to us, but the gentleman at the counter said he would " refund our money " from the cruise package to us. As of today, we have not heard anything from the hotel or the cruise line to confirm this. Other than that, the hotel is very nice. I feel the housekeeping staff is totaly at fault, and needs better supervision.

Reviews.Title: “$28/night for parking?”
Reviews.Author: bobhance
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online, feeling I had gotten a great deal. But being told upon arrival that I have to pay $28 a night for parking (plus tips for valet) really made me feel like I had been reeled in at a low price, then gouged once I got here. I've never heard of paying that much for parking. While it's not a fortune, the principle of the thing just upset me and kind of soured my experience at an otherwise great hotel. After the initial shock of the parking, the hotel was great - clean and comfortable, big room, nice view. But the location isn't the greatest; the area seems pretty sketchy at night. We thought we'd avoid the parking fees by parking on the streets nearby, but after driving around the blocks between Biscayne and 2nd Ave NE and seeing a couple of guys slinging drugs on the corners, we thought it best to just pay. Also, I wouldn't recommend going to the Checkers across the street after 10pm or so - we did our first night, and there were some pretty shady characters hanging around. Great burgers and wings there though!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous views and service”
Reviews.Author: caist
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hilton for a pre-cruise night April 10, 2009. We were late arriving because of flight delays but were welcomed enthusiastically with all documentation for our cruise arrangements at hand. The room we were assigned was a corner room with floor-to-ceiling windows and a gorgeous view. The room was very spacious and the bathroom awesome in size. The food service in the morning was excellent -- we were catered to in every way. This was a wonderful overnight stay for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good facilities”
Reviews.Author: robbie678
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during tropical storm fay's tour of Florida, the back drop of such dark skies with the bright lights of Miami port were quite magnificent. The hotel is in a convenient location, close to the port if you are planning a cruise, and a 10 minute taxi ride to the famous South Beach. Play station and fst broadband available in the rooms, though there is a charge, there was a decent tv and good views across the city. A few of the staff seemed a little snooty for my liking, though on the whole they were fine, the bar staff particularly went out of their way to make sure we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise hotel, esp'y for lost luggage victim”
Reviews.Author: kenanwy
Reviews.Content: Hotel was convenient to and from Miami airport via SuperShuttle ($16 to and from here) and to cruise ship at nearby port. I came a day before the departure of my cruise and thank goodness because my bag did not make the flight, even though I'd checked in 2 hours before the flight. As the hours wore on, I became increasingly agitated with United Airlines which could not confirm with certainty the location of my bag or when it would be delivered. I called often and continued to get unsatisfactory answers. However, finally, just before the last shuttle departure to the port, a very nice bellman at the hotel let me look around the storage room and lo and behold there was my bag (I had been previously assured that it could not be at the hotel). It could have been there 10 minutes or 10 hours, who knows--a bellman had accepted delivery and never reported it to anyone. I was so happy to have the bag and reported back to the chief concierge, Yasser, what had happened so maybe someone else wouldn't have this same mix up. He escorted me to the shuttle, heard me out, talked to the bellmen and was extremely kind. When I returned to the hotel after my cruise, I learned that I had been upgraded to a suite--yay! So even though there was a mix up with my bag which caused me some frustration and sleeplessness, the Hilton more than made up for it. This hotel deals with lots of "cruisers" and the location is so convenient next to the port --I could see my ship from my hotel window. The views of the skyline and the port are terrific. The service overall is excellent. Good amenities without a lot of nickel-and-diming, eg, free high-speed Internet with 5 or 6 terminals and connected printers. Nearby Bin 18 is a wonderful restaurant, and was recommended by the concierge (David, who was also very helpful and nice).

Reviews.Title: “I would expect more of a Hilton hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CHOPPERCAM
Reviews.Content: At best I would say this hotel is average, something I would expect from a lesser chain and especially from a hotel that claims to have been updated recently. My first room was next to a very loud ice machine, but to the hotel's credit I was moved to a lower floor and away from the area of the machines. Personally, as a honors member I thought I would be given a higher floor or at least some preference of location. My second room had a television of "little green men" The set was terrible, the colors were not adjustable and the set was of vintage age. Again, unacceptable for a hotel recently updated. The interenet connection did not work either and wireless is only available in the lobby. I complained to the front desk at 6:30AM however, at 7:30PM the problems had not been addressed. I eventually received another vintage tv that favored the red colors rather than green. However, the internet problem was corrected to my satisfaction. Housekeeping varied. I had one person who did clean the room well but the majority of my stay had a person who did not even bother to wash out the coffee cups. The bartender had a habit of charging several of my group for an extra drink that was not ordered. At first I thought it was a mistake until others complained of the same problem. Minor issue, as an honors member, I hoped to receive a morning newspaper, that did not happen once during the entire stay. The hotel also charged me for valet parking daily even after I explained that I did not have a vehicle much less parking in the garage. On the plus side, the bed was comfortable and the lobby area clean. The staff was also friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: ny501
Reviews.Content: I got a fantastic corner room at this hotel with spectacular view through the floor to ceiling windows. Rooms offer great features are clean and large, certainly good value for money. I was less happy with front desk staff, I thought they were arrogant, slow and unprofessional, which is unacceptable for a hotel in this category. The lobby looks very tacky and smells funky but the pool area is spacious and perfectly located facing South-West. I also used the gym that offers good quality equipment. My room service dinner arrived quick and was of good quality. A lot of people complain about the 'scary' neighborhood that this hotel is in. I really don't get that, the area is not the busiest you can imagine, but you can walk everywhere and the convenience of having the bus and metromover station right next to the hotel saves a fortune when traveling around. This is a good down town hotel, I enjoyed my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Miami Hilton- fun, professional, welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Watthree
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay four days at the downtown Hilton during the Miami Marathon in January. They made me (and all runners) feel very welcome and we had a great stay. Here's a recap of our stay. Staff: The front desk staff was very nice and helpful. Check in was quick and whenever I called to speak to the valet, they would identify my room and have my car brought around without my having to speak to the valet. That was a nice touch. The valet parking guys were very nice and helpful with directions and suggestions. They did â€œmisplaceâ€� my car keys one time and it took about 10 minutes to find them (although the car was within sight of the valet stand, so that wasnâ€™t the issue). But they were cool and they made it fun to come back to the hotel. Facilities: The setup is a little odd. There is a motor lobby on the ground floor and the you take an elevator to the lobby, a couple of floors up. The lobby bar and restaurant are nicely decorated and there is wi-fi available. I had dinner at the restaurant one night and it was good, with nice service. Nothing special, but a good value. I had a room on a concierge floor and it was great. The usual Hilton amenities, very clean and comfortable. The concierge lounge was great. The staff there was awesome and the breakfasts each morning were a great way to start the day. Lots of fruit, pastries, eggs, bacon, potatoes, cereal, etc. Coffee was delicious. The evening happy hour was a lot of fun too. The pool area was great; it could be a little bigger but the lounge chairs were extremely comfortable and the pool was heated, which was nice in January! Highlights: Definitely thought the service in the concierge lounge was outstanding. The pool area was relaxing and had beautiful sunsets. I liked the valet guys, too. Areas for improvement: The elevators that take you from the lobby to the motor lobby are widely spaced and the lights that indicate when an elevator arrives cannot be easily seen if you are standing to one side of the elevators, so if you hear that it is arriving and it is a couple of elevators down, you may miss it by the time you get to it. It was a common sight to see people running from one elevator to another because by the time they got to the one that "dinged" the doors were closing. Additionally, there was some outside maintenance being performed when we were there and although there was a floor to ceiling window (with a great view of the Cruise Ship Terminal) it was dirty. I would have really liked a Jacuzzi in the pool area; after the race it would have been great to sit in one of those! But the pool was nice. The lady in the gift shop didnâ€™t get off her cell phone when she was ringing up my purchases each time I was buying something (3 times). The service from everyone else was so good that it just seemed out of place. Iâ€™m guessing sheâ€™s not a Hilton employee but to me thatâ€™s just not an acceptable level of service, no matter where youâ€™re working. Finally, the elevators on the floor I stayed on and the floor below were very, very loud. There was a grinding squeakiness when the doors on the elevators opened on two of the cars. This woke me up several times a night, and Iâ€™m not a light sleeper. It was a real screeching noise. I called the front desk about it after the first night, but there was no improvement. Overall impression: I liked this hotel and this is the third hotel Iâ€™ve stayed at downtown. The Intercontinental was nice and the Doubletree had a Jacuzzi, but if I go again, Iâ€™ll probably go back to the Hilton. (I wrote reviews for those others two if you want to check them out!) Nearby transportation: The hotel is very close to the major highways, so itâ€™s easy to get to Ft. Lauderdale or the airport. The Venetian Causeway is two blocks away so itâ€™s a short hop to Miami Beach. There is a Metromover station one block away so itâ€™s easy to get around downtown Miami, like to the American Airlines arena or Bayside Marketplace.

Reviews.Title: “One night, pre-cruise, no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: macdadsjaw
Reviews.Content: Its amazing what people find to complain about based on the numerous bad reviews of this place. However, we stayed here on a Saturday night before our cruise and were given a corner room, 4 times the size of our cruise cabin, with views of the bay and cruise terminal. The location was perfect, a $10 cab ride to the port, a grocery store a block away for any necessities, a good breakfast/lunch place less than 2 blocks away, if Burger King isnt your thing. Everyone on the staff was nice to us, the pool suited us fine for an hour or so. Only real negatives, which were stated in other reviews were the TV, which is getting dated and faced the couch and had to be turned 90-deg towards the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good if you don't drink”
Reviews.Author: Gomershad
Reviews.Content: Booked via Royal Caribbean for a pre- and post-cruise stays. Very nice hotel, neighborhood didn't seem as bad as other reviews reported. Our rooms (both on 16th floor) were very spacious and well-appointed (except for the outdated TVs with blurry pictures). The HVAC system was very puzzling - A/C wouldn't kick on when we dropped thermostat to 62, but came on very strongly with cool air when we increased thrmst to over 75. Strange. Bed was awesome, but the pillows were feather-like and our heads disappeared and were engulfed when we laid our heads on them. View of the port was wonderful. The property - building, grounds, etc. is very, very nice. Has a very classy feel/appearance. All the staff we encountered (except the concierge, see below) was very friendly, helpful. The front desk called my cellphone when my room was ready. They, don't however, allow one to purchase an upgrade to the Concierge Level of the hotel. Strange. Even Sheraton offers that. The bathroom was nicely appointed. They could use makeup/shaving mirrors, though, since the granite vanity is fairly wide and far away from the wall mirror - makes shaving difficult for us glasses-wearers. Usually the showers in the high-rise hotels nowadays just have water trickle-out. The shower water pressure/volume here was GREAT - haven't had a hotel-shower like that in years. It was wonderful. Also, there was never a shortage of hot water. I'm puzzled by the annoyance expressed by other reviewers of the main lobby being a couple floors above the motor lobby. That is quite common in big city downtown hotels. Not a bother at all, really. The motor lobby is very well staffed and very attentive/friendly. THE POOL IS AWESOME!!! OMG - nice wide deck surrounding an unusually large/nice pool for a hotel. Water is heated, but not overly so, so there's no "shock" when you get in. All the chairs had rolled-up towels on them. Very, very nice. Even our shuttle driver from the port to the hotel said the pool was "legendary". Unfortunately, the pool bar was never opened, but there was an occasional waiter that wandered through. We did run into problems on both occasions with the (beautiful) lobby bar. Understaffed, overburdened resulting in poor service - especially considering the high prices. Plus, the English-challenged barkeeps didn't know how to make a standard Manhattan - one bartender lady had to look it up in a book or something and made it "perfect" rather than the standard "sweet" (added dry vermouth along with sweet) YUCK! Heck, even Applebees knows how to make a Manhattan! The hotel should invest in more people, trained in bar service, to cover a lobby bar of this size. It would go a long way to elevating the "class quotient" of the place. Especially since it's so attractively decorated and maintained. We even saw the plant-service guy going around wiping down all of the plants' leafs!! At breakfast in the lobby bar, the poor lady seemed overwhelmed by all the people, running out of $5's, running out of plates. Plus, they didn't have bagels on the continental b-fast...what's up with that? HOWEVER, there is FREE WI-FI in the lobby bar with plenty of electrical outlets on the perimeter...MUCH APPRECIATED. Didn't use the full service main restaurant. One look at the menu prices convinced us to look elsewhere ($16.50 for the standard 2 eggs/sausage breakfast?!? Yikes!!). We opted for Burger King right across the street! Also, the Concierge desk seemed to be neglected. Had to wait over 10 minutes for the guy to show up (he was delivering flowers to a room - couldn't a bellhop do that??), and then when he came back, instead of even acknowledging me, he answered the ringing phone and talked to them for another couple of minutes. Tacky for a hotel that's trying to be classy. Overall, if one doesn't typically use the concierge and the bar, this place is very, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Cruise Five Rooms excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: Nanook_of_Northeast
Reviews.Content: This hotel and the staff were great. The renovations that I have been reading about appear to be just about complete. The rooms were GREAT! All five of them. Updated, clean, and very comfortable beds. One of the rooms air conditioning did not work and the front desk gave a rebate for that room which was nice. After working 15 years in the hotel business I know that perfection isnt always possible thus I appreciate it when hotel staff goes the extra mile. For example, I was told by the front desk that I needed to go down to the transportation office in order to book the shuttle to the cruise terminal. When I got downstairs to the motor lobby there was no one at the transportation office. The bell captain noticed I looked confused and asked me what I needed. I told him I needed a shuttle to the cruise terminal for 12 people for 11AM the next morning. He told me that no one was at the transportation office but he took my room number and told me he would have a shuttle for me at the time requested. Just based on prior experience I thought that the next morning we would be scrambling for cabs so I got downstairs a little early. The Bell Captain recognixed me as I got off the elevator, got all of our luggage together and got us oon our way in our shuttle. I the hotel business sometimes the HOSPITALITY piece is forgotten. Not so at the Hilton Miami Downtown. The service was the best!! Also the fitmess center was really excellent. As was the resturant. We had lunch one day and breakfast another

Reviews.Title: “Almost Impressed by the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: bobbo48
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton for 3 nights pre cruising. On arrival we were greeted by the portering staff. We were made to feel very welcome indeed. On checking in I requested a Port view from our room if possible. None was available, although judging from the amount of people on the move around the lobby area over the few days we stayed there , I suspect there probably was. Our room on the 17th floor did not disappoint. We had a lovely view of the airport with planes taking off etc. Great at night time with the lights of the city sky line. The hotel seems to be located on the edge of Downtown area. I would not reccommend walking at night in this area. Day time is ok as there are plenty of people about. Breakfast was a bit pricey at $ 30.00 for 2 people. Average food, nothing special. The bar just off the lobby is nicely located for a few drinks or so. However, the service here leaves a lot to be desired. We called in for a drink about 6.30 or so. there were 2 girls working the floor and only for the intervention of a lovely old gentleman ( who was looking after the free nibbles available here) we would have died from the thirst. Eventually our drinks arrived. I should have ordered a second round there and then, because it took forever to get the attention of our server. When we were finally acknowledged by the server we relaxed. big mistake. she went off to serve someone else ( just arrived in the bar) and completely forgot us. I gave up and went over to her, demanded the bill and paid her off. This was the only event in our stay that gave a bad taste. I would use this hotel again, but next time bring my own booze ( joke)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, 12 blocks from Bayside Market”
Reviews.Author: dano068
Reviews.Content: My girlfiend stayed here New Years Eve and wanted something downtown and not too expensive. The hilton was a good pick for location and value considering the events going on around Miami New Years Eve night and New Years day. The room was very clean and the bathroom was large and well taken care of. It is 1 block from one of their rail & bus stations which we utilized to get to South Beach and back with out having to cab it. The staff was helpful pointing out the buses to take and some good locations to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated”
Reviews.Author: thefirstreader
Reviews.Content: pros: Room was clean though a little tight and the city view was great at night. Friendly stuff. Coffee was amazing. cons: the first floor was for moter. Valet parking was over $25. The main lobby was not actually on the second floor - confusing. TV was not functioning properly.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicola58
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, found the hotel clean and friendly, good bar area and resturant... I did not like the area the hotel was in i would of prefered south beach area. Although the hotel was only a taxi drive away from south beach. Overall i found this hotel to be one of the nicest hotels that i have stayed in, we flew to miami from vegas and arrived at 7.30am we were able to check in which was great staff were very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Motel”
Reviews.Author: Lovelyliki
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for us through our travel agent - it was near the airport & near the port of Miami where we were leaving on a cruise. Though I found the hotel very pricey (for us) I'm sure you could get a much better rate on line. The room was nice & we sort of had a view of the ocean - the staff was excellent - from the front desk to the valet! We picked up a car through Enterprise at the airport & was allowed to drop it off at the hotel the next day, very convenient, since the cruise line was supplying a shuttle for us to the pier. Since we paid $210 for the night I thought we'd get free parking - we used the valet service for $28 (plus tips) which we found pricey also. We didn't stay there long, it was basically a place to sleep for the night so considering that I thought the $210 for the room & $28 for the parking was VERY high but I really had no complaints about the hotel or the staff. And it is a very lovely place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: ARGYLE_ULTRA
Reviews.Content: My family (2ads 2ch age 6 and 5) travelling from the uk stayed here for 2 nights pre cruise and found the hotel to be in a great position for what we wanted. 1. Close to cruise terminal (5 mins in a cab) 2. 10 mins cab ride from south beach (about 20 odd dollars in a cab) 3. Close to bayside for shopping and food. 5 mins in a cab or take the free metrorail from omni station only 100 metres away. Or you could quite easily walk it (however I would be reluctant to walk it at night). When we arrived we were given a really friendly welcome from Elvin who guided us to check in and made a real fuss over the kids, which he did everytime we walked through the lobby during our stay. Check in was simple and we got straight to our room which was of usual Hilton standard and very clean (2 double beds). The room has floor to ceiling windows which offer a great view, sadly our room was not at the front of the hotel to see the cruise ships, which I would imagine would be spectacular, but we still enjoyed the view we had. We had breakfast there on 1morning which was 18 dollars each, service was good, juice was of good quality and the choice of food was good as was the quality. After a busy moring of sightseeing South Beach we decided to use the hotel pool. The pool has a really nice secluded rooftop section (not the roof on the top of the building, but an area just off the main bar and up about 10 outside steps). The loungers were of good quality and each one had rolled up beach towels on which gave it a private club feel. Pool is of a good size and we had a great time in it. Overall the hotel was great, people were very friendly, rooms good, location good for what we wanted, rooms good and clean, easy to get cabs and to the metrorail. Cabs from airport 30 dollars cab to airport 22 dollars

Reviews.Title: “Great, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fargofotos
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with great views. The staff and GM were extremely nice and accommodating. I would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay...we were all pleased!!”
Reviews.Author: lifesabeachct46
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Connecticut last Saturday. We arrived with a warm greeting from Pedro the Bell hop. Once in the beautiful lobby we checked in and it was a breeze. We had a total of 4 rooms. All the rooms were spacious, clean and the views were incredible. My family was fortunate to stay in the corner suite. My girls did not want to leave for the cruise and just stay here!! We had yummy burgers by the bar before retiring for the evening. In the morning it was so special to wake up, open the curtains and see "our ship" awaiting our arrival. We went for a swim in the beautiful pool and had a terrific breakfast before checking out. I would recommend this hotel. I had spoken to the general Manager prior to our stay and was so impressed with his professionalism and friendliness. My family can not wait to go to Miami and just stay here!! Thanks to the entire staff of this hotel for starting out our vacation on a perfect note!

Reviews.Title: “Significantly Improved Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pr123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton for a weekend of personal business. I had stayed in the hotel in July and had a bad experience, but due to the great attitude of the staff and knowing that it was undergoing conversion to a Hilton I tried it again. While there is still some renovation work going on in the entrance lobby; this stay was significantly improved. I am glad we gave it another try. The staff continue to be very friendly and helpful. It is clear that they are well trained. The room we stayed in was recently refurbished and was exactly what I would expect from Hilton. The restaurant served a typical Hilton quality breakfast, and service was quick. The elevators, which were experiencing problems last time we stayed, gave no trouble. Once they complete the renovations, I am confident that this property will be a great hotel. I am sure that I will try it again some time we are in Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Elmer&Lizette
Reviews.Content: After reading all the bad reviews I expected a real dump. That was not the case although this is not a hotel you want to book for a special occasion. The rooms are ok. Clean, quiet at night and good beds. Nothing special though. Our room had a balcony that we couldn't use because of all the construction going on. Tools and debris were lying on the balcony. The ongoing construction and the strange location of the lobby doesn't give you the feeling that you're in a 4star hotel. Tip for runners: It's a nice run from the hotel towards Miami Beach (which is only 4k away).

Reviews.Title: “Low price, but lots of noise”
Reviews.Author: OtisDads
Reviews.Content: As others have noted, there is ongoing construction at the Downtown Miami Hilton that involves drilling into concrete from 9:00 am to 5:30 pm each weekday. We were there only one night, but it was difficult to relax in the afternoon, and we definitely made sure we were gone by the time it started back up again. We got a good deal on the room, which was nicely appointed, but heard nothing about the construction noise except on this site. The management did seem responsive, but of course there's only so much they can do short of stopping the construction. The location is good, but Miami is not a very walkable city so the expensive parking at the hotel can become an issue. We walked to Bayside, about 15-20 minutes away, and were basically the only people on the sidewalk except homeless people. Very convenient to the arena and opera house, though. Also, they allow dogs for apparently no extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Lots & Lots & Lots of Construction...”
Reviews.Author: ConDMedic
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight in this hotel...Yes, lots of construction - First parking is terrible.. you have to valet $28 per day, plus tipping or self park $24. The parking just stunk~ I guess I just like to get my car myself etc. After the valet you have to take an elevator to the 2nd floor to the reception desk. I did find them pleasent. Also, Housekeeping was helpful. The bar did not have any Happy Hour & drinks were very $$. The room was nice. The bed, pillows, and sheets were very comfortable and I did sleep very well. I will say that there is lots of construction on the street and in the hotel. Trying to relax in your room before going out to dinner is impossible. After reading someone elses review about the construction I thought, "how bad could it be?" It is really, really bad. I am glad I only stayed 1-day. But, for business if you are up & out early and come back late, it wont bother you.

Reviews.Title: “Run, don't walk, to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kapulanikai
Reviews.Content: This is without doubt one of the nicest hotels I ever stayed in and has a professional staff that are unequaled. Superb and First class in every way. Good work Hilton! You've got a winning team at this location!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Carm&Rico
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night pre-cruise and had a really nice stay despite mixed reviews. The hotel staff was wonderful and very professional. I was impressed. Our room was fantastic; very modern, floor to ceiling windows with a nice view, clean, and very roomy. We got an unbelievable rate via Priceline for this hotel so we really can't complain. The area is not in what we thought was downtown, rather it's closer to the Art District. No big problem. Was a block from the metromover (free transportation) and we did use it to go to Bayside for dinner and a "Millionaire Row" boat tour. We'd stay here again if the price was right. Not sure if I'd pay full price until all of the renovations are complete as they do warn noise starts at 8-9 am. When it's finished, it will be a top notch place. Get a good rate, be flexible, and you'll have a really nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't choose it but if I could, would stay some place else”
Reviews.Author: escoss
Reviews.Content: Well, I'm in the hotel (checked-in last night) as I write this review, and it's perhaps the worst Hilton I've stayed so far in my life. I don't even refer to the construction noise racket going on - I was kind of somewhat mentally prepared after the reviews I had read but its the other things - a good number is small little things but very irritating and I'll try to list them in the chronological order. To begin with you should be prepared that the driving into the hotel in the makeshift lobby (motor lobby as its called in here) looks so uninviting that it reminds you of a third world hotel. I say that based on my travels - I've seen hotels under construction but they make it a point to make the construction area more lively and appealing to take focus away from construction - here, they seem to focus on the distraction itself. After you get off the car, you proceed to a small lobby with elevators - since the valet doesn't tell you that its not the main lobby so you look at the empty desk to your left, scratch your head and decide to push elevator button anyways, wherein you discover a button for the Lobby to proceed to main Lobby. The man I met at the reception area was as dry as they come in customer interactions - no smile, just questions and then I was handed the room key. He did tell me though that there will be construction noise from 8 am to 5 pm, more of that later. Elevator seems a little slower than other hotels but its only a minor irritation. My first impression coming off the elevator onto my floor was that someone has scrimped on money - its most dull carpet that I've ever seen - sure, it doesn't cause you any problem and looks and feels new but someone has gone horribly wrong with the aesthetics here. This theme continues into the room. My first impression of the room was that it was spacious but with the most dull looking furniture. The elctric outlets are curiously unavailable. There is a small coffee maker but no where to plug it in except maybe on the study desk or in bathroom. The internet router was all set except that it didn't have a power supply. The bathroom is ordinary with cheap looking wood work but with nice faucets, The house keeping may not have been very attentive when they cleaned my room - a half filled bottle of conditioner was right up on the counter - mind you, there was a filled in bottle too along with shampoo and body lotion but why leave the half filled bottle - Just to annoy the visitor. Later when I called housekeeping for some cloth hangars - the lady picked the phone and went "Yeah"! in a screeching voice as if I was an employee and not a guest and then as I was talking to her, without stopping me or saying hold on, just shouted" Gregory" - take some hangars to 12th floor and as I pondered on what my next move should be - started talking to me back again. Of course, I had nothing more to ask for except thank her for trying to help in her own style. By the way, the sound from the grinding and cutting machines is very deep and very real and you can't escape it during the day so plan to stay away in the day time - you can;t even have a decent conversation on the phone within your room while this continuous work goes on. All in all, my impressions of the hotel so far - find some other place if you can. I'm here to attend a conference being held in the hotel and that's why I had no option but if you do- stay some place else. On the plus side - The conference area is decent for this size of the hotel and I found nothing wrong with the area. The concierge in the main lobby is also helpful. The metromover train is practically next door so going to Bayside park or other areas in viccinty is easy and free. I have not checked the gym or pool yet so I'll post a review if I get a chance to visit those. By the way, I'm in room 1207 if you have stayed here and wondering what floor am I talking about

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kimmy24
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a 4 day conference. Construction was happening on the exterior of the hotel. The staff here were more than excellent. My colleague and I both received excellent service. The breakfast buffet is expensive but worth it. Complimentary coffee, fruit, and bottled water were offered once one exists the elevator in the morning into the lobby. Room was clean, comfortable beds, with excellent view of the bay and downtown. The OMNI trainstation was only a block away. Taking the train toward downtown is free and a five minute ride to the famous Bayside Marketplace --- which is a must do! Overall, was a great stay :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Alemati
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel trough hotwire. When i saw a hilton hotel i was excited about it. The hotel is very nice and clean. The beds are so soft and confortable. I didn't like the parking U$ 28,00 per day, i think is so expensive because i payed U$ 67,00 for one nighte, so it's almost 50%.

Reviews.Title: “T-Bird”
Reviews.Author: TBirdWilliams
Reviews.Content: I would like to start by saying this was the worst hotel experience I have ever endured, let alone paid for. From the beginning, we ate in the buffet and were misinformed of the price, then charged an 18% gratuity, when it took my "waitress" 15 minutes to bring me a cup of coffee...which was her ONLY trip to my table. The food was ridiculous and we found ants on the muffins, which was disgusting, but forgiveable, at this point. We then went to the front desk to check in and asked for suggestions for pizza delivery because we weren't from around there. The front desk agent simply replied, "Oh, there's Dominoes and stuff", and that was the end of it. We checked in to our room and settled in. At about 11pm, a man, who I am assuming was a maintenance man, attempted to ENTER OUR ROOM. Luckily, we had the latch on, but he actually put in the key, unlocked it, and tried to come in, without so much as a knock. As I wake from my sleep and go in to the bathroom, I notice DRIED BLOOD on the toilet. I had had it with the place at that point. Be assured, I have already contacted the Miami Health Services Department with that one. Moving on: the air conditioner in our room was clearly malfunctioning, it went on and off every 15 minutes with an EXTREMELY loud screeching and grinding noise, probably why the man tried to enter our room. To top it all off, when I took a shower the next morning, there was ABSOLUTELY NO HOT WATER. I'm not an idiot, I know how to work a faucet, there was simply no hot water. I will never stay at a Hilton again. I have been a longtime Starwood member and rightly so. We made a reservation last-minute or I would have never stayed there in the first place, but believe me, I have learned my lesson! I only paid $111 for the room, not including the ridiculous $48 for breakfast, but I wouldn't stay at Hilton Miami Downtown again.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressive - no real point to staying there”
Reviews.Author: mooshai
