Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a business conference and have to say I was less than impressed. Everything was just about average. On-site restaurant was simply okay, surrounding neighborhood was very blah, and the staff was ambivalent. Due to on-site construction, elevator service was horrible. And a lot of construction in the "motor lobby" on the ground floor. Finally, despite the name, it's not really downtown per se, but a 5 minute drive from downtown. Unless you have a rental car, you're at the mercy of taxis to find an interesting neighborhood since this one is so bland.

Reviews.Title: “HIlton Downtown Miami - Highs and Lows”
Reviews.Author: ssap01
Reviews.Content: A group of three of us stayed at this motel during October 9th thru October 13th. My opinion is that this motel was extremely unorganized during this time. Upon arrival at the motel my party was told that we couldn't be checked into a room despite paying our trip in advance because they were having issues receiving payment from the vendor. We had our payment receipts and confirmations in hand and had also called in advance to confirm before arriving. We have to stand around for about two hours before being checked in. Upon checking in the room they assigned us was the wrong type. We had to go back downstairs to be assigned another room. When were assigned a new room the keys didn't work so we had to go back to have them activated. The room we finally received was very nice. We stayed in 724 which was a one bedroom suite. It was very spacious and well kept. On the upside the manager bought us dinner and drinks at the restaurant for our inconvenience at check-in and he was very apologetic and nice. The food at the restaurant was excellent and the service was great. For the most part the staff was very professional and on top of their job. There was a male bartender that in my opinion was very rude, unprofessional and obviously doesnâ€™t like his job, but that was my only negative encounter. We didn't rent a car upon arrival, but met a really nice cab driver who took us everywhere we wanted to go for the whole time we were there. This was an expensive option, but it was convenient since neither of us in the party was familiar with Miami. One of the downsides to this motel is the location. There is no food or entertainment around. There is a Checkers and a Burger king across the street. Overall the stay at this Hotel was satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Major Issues With Downtown Hilton”
Reviews.Author: leelee223
Reviews.Content: Despite some negative comments that we read on this site we still decided to give the Hilton a chance because the location was perfect for our trip. I must say we were extremely disappointed with our stay there. The renovations were the least of our worries. The room was nice. We had a Jr. Suite with the Bay view. The room was very spacious and nicely put together. HOUSEKEEPING: Never understood that there were 4 people in the room (room can hold 5) and choose to only put towels for 3 each day we were day (4 days) despite many calls to the front desk. They also did an extremely lousy job in cleaning the room. They would leave dirty glasses and leave new ones and they did not change the sheets. VALET: I must say the only friendly people at this hotel were the actually valet driversâ€¦those in the Valet booth were extremely rude and will forget to give your keys to a driver to get your car (happened to several guests) RENOVATIONS: Drilling started at 7am right outside our window. We made a complainant and were told we could have a free breakfast. When we went to retrieve the breakfast we were told that we couldnâ€™t get it and were accused of lying about getting a free breakfast. FRONT DESK: Members of the front desk staff were extremely rude and condescending!! Messages are not sent to the manager but rather put to the side. We finally spoke to one front desk manager who compensated us for one nights stay because of our troubles. We were pleased until the day of check out when we dealt with an â€œassistant front desk managerâ€� who gave us trouble with our reimbursement. Long story short itâ€™s a good thing I spent more time out of the hotel than in because my stay at the Downtown Miami Hilton could have ruined my entire vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but still exceptional”
Reviews.Author: davidmeyer
Reviews.Content: I was on the 21st floor with a wonderful view of downtown Miami, Biscayne Bay and the Atlantic Ocean. While the hotel is under renovation, it didn't create any inconveniences for me. The lobby and the restaurant area was very nice, and the room was above average. The things I key in on, the bathroom and and the bed, were exceptionally clean and comfortable. Finally, the room service meal I had was A++. The fillet was one of the best cuts of meat I have ever had at a hotel. My only regret...that my wife was not here to enjoy the trip with me. Perfect location for enjoying Miami, South Beach, Miami International Airport and I-95.

Reviews.Title: “71/2 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: ein-uno
Reviews.Content: Good *Room decor was contemporary *Bed / room was very comfortable *Pleasant stay overall *Close by to Downtown Nightclubs, Bicentennial Park,Bayfront Park Amphitheater, A.A. Arena(Concerts,Sport Events). *Atmosphere in Lounge /Lobby area is Cool *Staff was better than expected(for Miami!) Not Good *Parking,Parking,p a r k i n g!!! I think it was $28 a day to valet park.Self parking fee was not much cheaper either and finding your car might be a bit of a challenge.Taxi or other means of transport might be the best if You are unwilling to pay over $20 dollars for parking. *Room was clean but some more attention to details are needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: joeyboey
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel and would definitely stay there again. We had no waits at the reception or the elevator as some reviewers experienced, this might be due to the fact that September is the slow season. We had great service, and our room was beautifully renovated and extremely clean and spacious. The floor to ceiling windows are spectacular, we felt very pampered. We used the rooftop pool which was great even in the rain! It is nice and large and deep and the patio has a very nice view. I would suggest going accross the street to eat, the restaurants in the hotel are quite pricey but at the Doubletree across the street they have a bit of a mall with a few different alternatives. We ate burgers and fries at the deli there and really enjoyed it. I booked on Priceline and spent $65 and felt that we got a steal, I would have paid twice that. Anyone having a bad experience at this hotel is either too picky, or maybe was there at too busy of a time. We have quite high standards and the Hilton met them quite nicely. My only negative comment is that it was very hard to get anyone from guest services on the phone from the room, but when I went down to the desk they were readily available. I also tried to use their express check out service that is supposed to be available by phone but did not get through on that either. Overall though a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay !!!”
Reviews.Author: SILVINILS
Reviews.Content: The Hilton was perfect for my stay, in june 2008. The bedroom and bathroom brand new, everything works. Excellent for me!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Hilton on Biscayne Blvd (Sept 4 - 7)”
Reviews.Author: va_man1
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried from the reviews about the Hilton. After staying there, I think some of these people that complain either are used to staying at the Ritz-Carlton or just too damn picky. We got there on Thursday night and didn't have to stand in any lines to check in. The front desk guy was nice enough to give us a room facing the bay after we requested it although what they had available was on the 4th floor. The room had two huge windows with a nice view and it was nice and cleanly decorated. The buffet breakfast (whcich was part of the room rate) was very good I must say, although it was the same every day, but we didn't mind). We were able to grab some bottles of water and fruit on our way out for the day. Another positive was the free internet service in the lobby (they had 3 computers you could use as well as wireless if you had a laptop) We were also able to avoid paying the $28 parking fee by parking across the street at a meter and then making sure we moved our car in the morning. Everything was pretty close and accessible from the hotel (Bayside, South Beach, Coconut Grove etc.) Of course the downside was that the elevators were slow, depending on what time of the day it was ..but the way people complain on here, you would think it was the end of the world. It really was not that bad if you had 2-3 minutes of patience. Overall, I would stay there again because the other hotels were a little more expensive (Doubletree, Marriot) and you would have to pay even more to include breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Works Just Fine Night Before A Cruise”
Reviews.Author: jman_mn
Reviews.Content: Booked on Priceline w/ a $54 rate for 08/28/2008. A football season kickoff game was being played in Miami this weekend so the hotel was full of kids from both teams. Been in this situation before- ignoring kids' shenanigans during their free time is the way to go :) Elevators are being "upgraded" so they were down 2. Valet staff & lobby staff were very friendly. Enjoyed the decor in the common areas. Didn't use the pool, however, they were renovating the landscape. The pool was open, did see a few guests out there. Got a room on the 20th floor, loved the contemporary remodel. Desk, bed, armoire, bathroom vanity, light fixtures are were decked out with a modern look. Air conditioning wasn't working the greatest. Although it was cool, it wasn't cold enough for my taste. Room temp hung around 72 the whole time. At first I thought it was due to being so high in the building and that outside it was 90 degrees and humid, but later on determined it just wasn't getting cold enough. Didn't change rooms because it was very late, was tired, and I was getting up early in the morning so it didn't bother me. Informed the hotel on the way out about this. Ate the breakfast buffet the following morning. Had a pretty good amount of choices, pretty standard affair for a Hilton. Waiter was prompt, friendly, and polite. Food was great. Price was I believe $18.95/person, standard buffet price these days at hotels (but cheaper than Vegas hehe). I saw one review on here where the patron complained that a gratuity was added automatically to the bill- this is the case all around downtown as it happened to me in other places. The whole experience was just fine, was just what I expected (except for the air conditioning). Would I pay full price? I don't think so, wouldn't pay full price for the Intercontinental either, just not how I roll...

Reviews.Title: “Go Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: tyoung1106
Reviews.Content: The reason why we chose this hotel was because it was supposed to have been remodeled within the last 6 months. This hotel fell well below our expectations. We booked through the hilton 800 number and was told the best rate we had to pay in full so we did that for two rooms. We were not told that it was a net direct rate and it was non refundable or non exchangeagble and we came during hurricane season. The staff upon arrival - a young lady was assisting us with our check in. Had no rooms available that fit our request that was booked and paid in full so she got frustrated and walked away. A gentleman by the name of Tori was exceptional in picking up the pieces to assist us with our check in at 1am (after our flight arrived). He was able to put us in two king rooms, but they were not remodeled, had poor internet service, were not remodeled, and smelled Horrible. The smell was so overpowering that as soon as you opened the door you could smell it in the hallway. We were told that these were the only king rooms that were left. So we made the best of the room and went down the street to walgreens and got some candles febreeze and lysol to disinfect the room and make it liveable for our stay. I will not recommend this hotel to anyone. The resources such as the Internet could be better. Connectivity could be improved. The bar hours of operation could be better - if you are on vacation 4pm until 10pm are very limited and forces you to have to go elsewhere to patronize other restaurants and services. The selections are limited as well - with luxury prices, one expects luxury and at the very least premium selections. That can be improved.
